text: I started taking probiotics due to the onset of diverticulitis.  They have proven effective in stopping the pain.  Other reasons for taking them include counteracting the detrimental effects of antibiotics (which destroy both good and bad bacteria, indiscriminately) or just as a way to build up good bacteria. The brand that the doctor originally prescribed was very expensive, and probiotics tend to be expensive in general.This 4X Pro-B brand is just as effective as, but better value than, the other brands I have used.  I also like the blister packs with the days printed on them, so that I can keep track of whether I have already taken one that day.

I have used Cascade Complete Actionpacs for some time and have been pleased with them, mostly because they are so convenient.  I have a tendency to use far too much detergent/washing powder/whatever and these pacs oblige me to use the right amount and avoid waste.  You need to keep your hands dry when handling them, or you can start the casings dissolving.  The container is conveniently shaped and sized for storage in a kitchen cabinet.But, do these Cascade Platinum Actionpacs clean any better than their Cascade Complete cousins?  That's difficult to say.  I have noticed that all the tea stains are removed from cups with this product, so my guess is that they are a little more powerful.These are certainly worth trying.

Remember to cost in the strips and the control solution when considering this purchase.  They are extra and they are essential.  You will use rather more strips than you might think, because you will sometimes make mistakes and have to discard some, and you also need them for the test solution.  Overall, the costs seem reasonable.There are quite a lot of instructions included, and you do need to read everything carefully, because mistakes can damage the unit.  Once you get the hang of it and have used the unit a couple of times, it seems quite straightforward, but you should take it slowly and carefully first time and, I repeat, read all the instructions first.The unit seems to be accurate, in that it agreed with the recent test my doctor had performed.Those with diabetes or pre-diabetes will find this useful, but it is also useful for anyone who simply wants to monitor their health.

Following my annual exam, my doctor recommended me taking vitamin D.  That surprised me, as I live in southern California and get a lot of sunshine.  But apparently, as we get older, we need a lot of vitamin D.  I started with 2,000 IU but the doctor has now ramped that up to 4,000 IU.  If you are getting on in years, you may want to ask your doctor what he recommends with regard to vitamin D.This particular brand is outwardly just like the other brand I used – small, easy to swallow.  But these also have the potency I need, have a reassuring set of ingredients, and are low-priced.  I'll go with these from now on.

I suppose if you are following the South Beach diet, you might want to incorporate these, or another of their range of snack bars, into it.  Even if you are not, but are looking for a snack bar, you should try these.  They are high in fiber and protein, but also in calories.  They make a point of not having artificial sweeteners, but that means they do have natural sugars, and a lot of them.They are perfect for an after-workout snack.  I always need something after a vigorous workout, but feel guilty eating a regular candy bar.  This is a good, healthier, healthy(ish) alternative.  As I have not done that vigorous workout for a while, I'll have to think up another excuse for eating them.I like the texture - slightly chewy, slightly crunchy, but not too much of either.  I also like the taste, which is somewhat unusual, with vanilla and yoghurt overtones.Although these are a little too sweet for my taste, I think I'll adopt them as my mid-morning snack, and find some way to compensate for those 200 Calories.

A good quality product that has its uses for skin and hair care as well as food.  Fragrant and mild-tasting.Ladies, here's an idea:  get your partner to give you a massage, using liberal amounts of this oil.  Then, invite your partner to lick off the excess.  Repeat as desired.  The procedure will benefit more than just your skin.(DISCLOSURE:  I was sent a free sample of the product to review, under no obligation).

A monopod is a great help in steadying a camera, and to have it double as a walking stick is a good idea.  This one is good quality; sturdy, robust, but light.  It extends from 18 inches to 59 (not counting the removable bulb), so your viewfinder will be around 5 feet high when you use it.The screw locking holds well, so you can extend it to the length you want for a walking stick and use it with confidence.The compass in the removable bulb at the top looks to be of limited use, but I suppose they may as well make some use of the bulb.If your hands are not as steady as you'd like, and you could use a walking stick, this is a good purchase.

My first impression when unpacking this was how light (and flimsy) it was.  But that did not prove to be a problem, as it is not likely to have to withstand hard knocks or rough handling.  The small size is actually an advantage - it fits discreetly beside the toilet.It worked very well.  I got more use out of each disk, and more thorough cleaning, than I expected.I see that some other reviewers report a problem with removing the disks.  I did not have that problem with mine.  Pulling the trigger released the disk, every time.  The instructions say, "In a case where the disk does not fully release from the handle pull back on the trigger and use the side of the trash can to aid in removal".Check out the cost of the refill disks first, to decide whether you think it's cost effective.

This is a cream, not a foam or a gel.  It will not lather at all well and is not intended to.  Nor does it hydrate particularly well, like the gel I usually use does.  In the hot, dry climate where I live, hydration is very important, which is why I think I will stick with my usual gel.It does promote a smooth shave, and it delivers the antiseptic qualities it promises, so you should try it if you have very sensitive skin.  It recommends using a brush to apply it but there seems to be no need for that.

This is a 10" X 7" 55-page paperback, with about 50 black-and-white photographs by the author.  It is a fascinating resource for anyone with an interest in the island's history.  The book seems to be very rare.  I can't remember where I got my copy, which is now sadly falling apart.  Even sadder is the contrast between the beautiful island of the book and the overdeveloped, commercial vacation retreat that Aruba is today.

I am a great fan of Listerine Original Antiseptic mouthwash, which I have used daily for years, and of Listerine Whitening Original, which I use when I remember to.  I like the clean feeling that the Original Antiseptic mouthwash leaves me with.I received this Listerine Total Care Whitening mouthwash as a free sample, and found the taste repulsive.  Not just bad, but horribly bad.  There is clearly some ingredient in it which does not suit my taste and may not suit yours.I would certainly recommend trying the Listerine range of products but, given that this item is not cheap, you might avoid it unless you can get a free trial taste of it first.

This is a concentrated, virtually scent-free washing powder.The container, a plastic tub, is very convenient - much better than the big, leaky cardboard boxes I usually have in the bathroom.The scoop is very small, and was lurking at the bottom of the tub.  I had to dig deep to get it.  I see that a couple of reviewers have said there is no scoop - I expect they have just not dug deep enough.I needed two scoops for a large wash.  The cleaning power is comparable to my regular detergent.

I've used a few of these Knorr sides and am happy with them.  They are a quick, simple way of turning some chicken into a tasty meal.This variety has the creamy texture that it promises, especially if you use milk and margarine or butter, instead of just water.I fry the chicken with onion and mushroom, then add the water/milk/margarine and the packet contents, and stir and simmer.Tolerance to spiciness varies a lot from one person to another.  I would class this as very mild, but for some people with a very low tolerance, even this will be too much.  Some like it hot, and you could always spice it up with chipotle sauce if desired.I don't think any food product as processed as this can really be of much nutritional value, but it gives a convenient, tasty starch base to whatever meat or vegetables you serve with it.

This a beautiful collection of rarely heard orchestral songs by Sibelius, performed by the Finnish lyric soprano Soile Isokoski and the Helsinki Philharmonic Orchestra.The title track "Luonnotar", at nearly nine minutes the longest track, is described as a tone poem for soprano and orchestra.  It is known to performers as a fiendishly difficult piece.  The text is from the first part of the Kalevala, the Finnish national epic, and deals with the creation of the world.  Luonnotar is the Spirit of Nature in Finnish mythology.  The music is every bit as dramatic as the theme would suggest, and Isokoski's vocal agility and power are very impressive.  It takes a great singer to avoid being overwhelmed by the orchestra in a piece like this.In addition, there are 18 further songs, all based on Finnish and Swedish texts (Swedish was actually Sibelius' first language).  They are all fine, all very dramatic, and include songs like Driftwood and Swim, Duck Swim, which prevent the overall experience from becoming too somber.Very highly recommended.[PeterReeve]

This was Maria's debut solo album, released 10 years after the release of the eponymous The Even Dozen Jug Band, of which band she was a member.  She has gone on to make more than 30 more solo albums, though oddly enough not - so far as I can see - a "Greatest Hits" or similar compilation.  If you are new to her, this album is still the best place to start.Her only big hit single was Midnight at the Oasis, the second track on this album (the B side was Any Old Time, the album's first track).  It was written by David Nichtern, who plays acoustic guitar on this and some other tracks.  The song became notorious in the 70s as the alleged cause of a great many pregnancies and losses of virginity.  Take that as a warning or a recommendation, as you choose.The rather bawdy, or saucy, flavor continues throughout Muldaur's career and is at its strongest on this album in the Blue Lu Barker song Don't You Feel My Leg.  Inevitably, this flirty sauciness has earned Maria the condemnation of feminists, which seems to have bothered her not at all.  At the time of writing this review, she is still performing at the age of 69, and is currently touring with the Bluesiana Boys in what she describes as "an evening of New Orleans flavored `Swamp Funk', Vintage Blues, & good ol' American Roots Music!"Various shades and interpretations of American Roots is what this album is all about.  There are excellent musicians backing her.  Greg Prestopino's piano on Mad Mad Me, Richard Greene's violin on Walkin' One and Only, and Amos Garrett's electric guitar on Midnight at the Oasis deserve special mention, but it's all good.  Ry Cooder (no less!) plays acoustic guitar on the opening track.Her voice can be a little shrill in the upper register, but never lacks heart and soul, and has a lovely, lilting, lyrical quality.Essential 70s interpretation of some "good ol' American Roots Music".[PeterReeve]

I was working my way through OUP's A Very Short Introduction series when I discovered the A Brief Insight series.  They have the same texts, but the print is larger, they are hardcover, and they have more illustrations, many in color.  So unless you want a very small book that you can slip into a pocket, the Brief Insight versions are better.For this particular entry in the series, you absolutely must get the Brief Insight version, because the illustrations are essential to the book and they are greatly superior in this version.This is the best introductory text on Postmodernism that I know of.  The scope is very broad, covering (I should say, touching on) all aspects of culture - the arts, science, philosophy and a broad range of sociopolitical issues.  Butler has the correspondingly broad range of knowledge and interests to carry this off.His approach is a critical one.  Rather than just introducing an idea, he will explain it and immediately critique it, encouraging the reader to think about it themselves.  If you have seen some postmodernist art and found it self-indulgent and trivial, then don't let that put you off reading this book - you will find Butler as skeptical as you are.Butler also wrote "Modernism: A Very Short Introduction", (I don't think there's a Brief Insight version).  I haven't read it but I guess it would make sense to read that before this entry, if like me you are working your way through the entire series.[PeterReeve]

Joseph Süß Oppenheimer was a German Jewish banker who was executed in 1738, as a result of charges brought by the many enemies he had made in making his fortune.His story was the subject of many literary treatments, most notably Lion Feuchtwanger's 1925 novel titled Jud Süß.  Feuchtwanger was Jewish, and an outspoken opponent of Nazism, and his portrayal of Oppenheimer was very sympathetic.  In 1934, Lothar Mendes directed a film adaptation of the novel.Goebbels, the Reich Minister of Propaganda, commissioned a new film version, partly to counteract the Mendes film.  The result, Jud Süß, made in 1940 by Veit Harlan, is very remarkable in many respects.  For one thing, the film is surprisingly entertaining.  It is fast-paced, well acted and the crowd scenes are (for the time) very well done.  This is in stark contrast to the usual propaganda films (see Der Ewige Jude, for example, also made in 1940 at the behest of Goebbels, and which is laughably bad).  One can imagine members of the SS, who were required to see this film, groaning at the thought of having to sit through another propaganda film, being pleasantly surprised as this action-filled costume drama unfolded.The film is also remarkable for its moral ambiguity.  The gentile characters, including the hero - the romantic lead - are really unsympathetic, whereas the Jewish characters - including the title character - come across quite favorably.  The propaganda message - intentionally or not - is that corrupt politicians are more to blame for the social and economic problems than are Jewish bankers.This DVD is a 2-disc package with many extras.  The film print is excellent.  In so many ways, this is a film worth seeing.

I was happy with my Kindle, but concerned that it seemed very fragile.  It appeared inevitable that it would get dropped or knocked and that would be the end of it.  It really does need a protective case.I like the look and feel of this leather case.  It is thick enough to provide protection but not so bulky that I cannot still keep the kindle in my jacket pocket.  The overall quality and design are good.If you want to prop it open, on a desk or wherever, then you must prop it at a narrow angle or avoid a smooth surface, as it relies only on the surface friction to hold it in place.The hand strap worked well for me and is a nice feature.  Same with the elastic strap that holds the cover in place, whether closed or open for reading.  I do not use the storage pocket, but I suppose some people might.All in all, an excellent product for the price.

With no added sugar or salt or flavorings, this must be the healthiest breakfast cereal you can buy.  It's also the kind of thing people tend to either love or hate - and tend to hate as a kid and learn to love as an adult.  I've always loved it and still do.  I have two biscuits each time, and leave them to soak in the milk before eating them.  You can of course sprinkle sugar on them if you must, and add fruit if you wish, but I prefer them with just milk.Buying it on Amazon's Subscribe & Save makes it very convenient and economical.

UPDATE (10/2014):  The current seller here on Amazon insists on sending the wrong product.  They send mint-flavored toothpicks (the label is different from what you see on the product page).  The taste is quite different and I find it repulsive.  Claiming a refund is proving difficult.  So 5 stars for the advertised product, 1 star for the seller.ORIGINAL REVIEW:  My dental hygienist remarked on the improvement and asked me what I had been doing differently.  The only thing different was that I had started using these toothpicks.  She was very impressed with the results.They are obviously good at dislodging food particles from between teeth, but just as importantly, you can run them along the gum lining, where they disturb the bacterial growth and stop it building up.Tea tree oil is a natural, general purpose antiseptic.  The oil's scent is distinct but not too strong on these picks.  Of course, whether or not you like the scent is entirely a matter of personal taste.Well worth trying especially if, like me, you hate flossing.
Mine lasted less than a year. Used maybe 8 times. Pretty pricey for that. Going to get another Roku.

Mine doesn't look like this. Don't know if they've changed since I ordered mine a few months ago. Mine looks like the one in the picture I'm including, but I like the one I've got, and it's stood up to summer weather just fine.

I had a Wheelskins on a car I used to own. I really couldn't justify the cost of another one for my truck, so I was curious about this. I had low expectations, based on the price, but was so pleasantly surprised once I stitched this on. The only thing I wish I'd done differently... my steering wheel (1991 Toyota pickup) is a bit thin. I should have stitched it tighter. Maybe someday I'll redo it. But I didn't use anything other than what they sent along. (I see other folks have used different thread, etc.) Get yourself a book on CD and listen to a chapter or four and spend a nice afternoon stitching this on and you should enjoy this for quite a while.

I am a pen and notebook nut. I have some nice, expensive pens, but I always come back to a couple favorites. The EasyTouch and the Center of Gravity pens are hard to beat for flat out writing pleasure.

I used to carry a battery-powered flashlight in the glove box, and when I would infrequently need it, the batteries would invariably be drained. I have not had this light for long, but the concept is brilliant, and it works great so far. It's brighter than I would have figured, and I like the red glow while it's charging. I use this is a 1991 Toyota pickup. Am thinking of getting one for the wife's Elantra. This might be a great stocking stuffer this year.

It's a very nice size for the power rating. Attractive design with sleek power gauge LEDs. A surprising value, including a micro-USB cable. (Also comes with a small bag which I haven't used yet, and probably won't.) I toss this in my small cinch bag and I don't have to worry about finding an outlet when I'm out and about if my phone battery gets low. I'm thinking of getting a couple more. One for my wife and another for my high school son to keep in his backpack.

The person who designed this is literally dumber than a mouse. My mouse managed to figure out how to open one of the side plugs and I miss her. I guess I can sell this P.O.S. now. Anyone?UPDATE: The mouse was found, but she was dead. It's a loss that's more difficult to weather than I would have thought.
This is an expensive and obnoxious night light. If you can get it to work it probably won't be for long.

First off, would it kill people to add what they bought the bulbs for? Here, let me try it. I bought them for a 1991 Toyota Pickup. Nope. Still alive. I found these to be no brighter than a filament bulb. They will require resistors, as the rear turn signals flash too fast now. They won't fit in my front turn signals; the base of them was too broad to fit into the socket. I may just go back to normal bulbs for normal people.
Bought this for my grandma for passover. She doesn't get it.

If you buy this, buy it for yourself. Do NOT buy it for the child of a relative. Unless you hate that child's dad. Because guess who gets to dick around with this thing, getting more and more frustrated as the hours unwind? You guessed it. Not the kid.
This is good for half the job. Still need white-out for the other half. Or if you start with white paper, probably good enough.
It's very handy for carrying around candy cigarettes. But be warned, it's very darkly colored. Hard to locate it at night or in a darkened room.
The zipper is not very strong, but it's good for carrying around things that are smaller than it. Note: Not strapless.
It's paint! It's orange! It's orange paint! WHO DOESN'T LOVE ORANGE PAINT???

Nothing new under the sun. Wish I were the kind of person who could stop reading a book halfway through, because after the second third, I found Jesus, too, and started praying the book would end.The first of her memoirs was pretty good, and the second wasn't terrible, but this one just droned on and on.I'm writing this to make sure I don't accidentally pick it up at some point to give it another try.
Of all the hoses I've ever handled, handling this one has been the greatest thrill of my life (vis-à-vis hose-handling).

It's quite a bit larger than a traditional bulb, and it's not omnidirectional, so it's not the best in a small fixture. It's good for a lamp where you can direct the light. But it's fine as advertised. I just should have ordered soft white.
Or order a size up. That would be less work.

These are great for sudoku and crossword puzzles. I wish I could find the refills in stores next to the pens. Hard to tell which ones. The "Ballpoint Pen Refills for Most Ballpoint Pens, Fine, Black Ink, 2-Pack" here on Amazon may be the refills, but they don't look like what came out of the pen. * * * UPDATE * * * The refills noted here do not fit.

I have two of these. One I bought when they were first introduced. I still use it for my home computer, and I love it. It has orange rather than blue for the FN, home, etc. keys. The build quality of the keys on that one is much better than the build quality of the one I just received for my work computer. This new one, the keys are pretty clacky and loose feeling.I have many, many Logitech products, and it is rare that I'm disappointed. I hope they address this issue, otherwise they're killing what (was) a damn nice keyboard.** I have set the new one aside and am using the old one... was just too frustrating. Typing was very inaccurate on the new one. **

Really, anything you can plug a USB cable into will probably work. If this were only $5 and delivered within the hour by a unicorn wearing a fez, maybe. But $20 and delivered by your surly USPS employee when they feel like it? Nah.

You might have some problems connecting to your internet due to interference generated by the treadmill motor. Changing the WiFi channel might solve this. For me, it was a coincidental thing when one router died, and I replaced it. Now my computer connects. Another doesn't, but this can be solved with a wired connection, for sure. If you are just wanting to watch DVDs, then this isn't an issue.It might take some time to dial in a walking speed that's typing-friendly, but, even if it's slow (I'm at 1.7mph now), it's still much more active than sitting in a chair. I could -- and plan to -- get used to this.

I've had this six weeks now. I wanted to break it in before I reviewed it. It's really holding up well. It still looks new and none of the corners are beaten up or fraying. The magnetic clasp is handy, and not too cumbersome. It's very easy to flip open when needed. It holds the phone firmly, and yet it's not a tremendous hassle to remove the phone and replace it once in a while when I want to just have the phone in my hand -- say for reading in bed. The pockets for cards are nice. I carry maybe six or seven routinely, with some bills folded in half and stashed in the big pocket. It still fits in my front pocket. It's a winner.

I chose this one after looking around quite a bit for a "personal" laptop. I didn't want to always be using the work laptop, and I wanted something smallish I could throw in a smaller bag to cart along with me. That said, I've configured it to do all things I do for work -- ssh tunneling with PuTTY, Git, etc. so it's really handy for a secondary work machine if I'm away.In a pinch, I've tethered to my Galaxy Note 3, and that was very easy to do, with pretty good results for having to ssh into a command line on an Ubuntu server.Things I'm not in love with... mine does not have a lighted keyboard. Wah. I don't know how often I've ever found myself needing to type in the dark, so this is a minor gripe. The battery could be better. Really don't expect to get more than four hours of solid work done on this machine without plugging it in. The keyboard can be a bit springy, but this can be fixed. The touch pad isn't nearly as nice as the one on my retina macbook, but this isn't a deal breaker for me.Things that are fabulous... It's very easy to upgrade the RAM to 8GB. It's nearly as easy to add a SECOND HARD DRIVE! I just threw a 480 GB hard drive in mine, and now I have an i5 ultrabook with 8GB of RAM and some 600 GB of hard drive space. Once you open it up to make these upgrades, just throw some small bits of carpet tape under the keyboard and the keyboard is nice and tight with good feedback. To counter the little-bit-wonky touch pad, I snagged a Logitech ultra-thin mouse. This highlights the fact that this machine has bluetooth built in. Works great. This machine definitely rivals any other (full-sized) laptop I've ever had.I don't use it as a tablet, but it's great to think I could. Since buying this and swapping an iPhone for a Galaxy Note 3, I don't really have much use for the iPad anymore. Bottom line: I like this machine quite a bit.
I didn't know how well I'd enjoy this book, seeing as how I only have white crayons. But, as it turns out, that's the only color required! Magnificent!

One of the first things I did with this helicopter was crash it into the wall above the dogs' water dish. After it was completely submerged, I quickly turned it off, removed the front cover, and dried it with a can of compressed air. I had to solder the battery wire back on, but, darnit, it still works.My son has the Chinook, the Apache and an S033G. These Symas are just tremendous fun. I would have loved to have had one of these when I was a kid.

I have ordered several of these, and, up till the last batch of 50, I had nothing but stellar luck with them. But this last batch, I went through about 25 successful burns, then, all of a sudden, the rest would not be recognized as writable... and some that were, the software only saw them as single-layer discs.What changed??I've bought the Verbatims for this last round of burns, and am having 100% success with them, so far.If I see anyone say that the Amazon discs are back to what they used to be, I will come back and order them again and change my review.

This is tremendous fun. It is too bad the country seems to be so idiotically polarized now, because a great many ignorant people are missing out on a good time, merely by insisting to remain willfully ignorant.Buy this book and read it. Even if you have to forget who wrote it.

In case you didn't know, Bret Easton Ellis was not fond of the movie Less Than Zero. And he seems to have written this book entirely in an effort to spite the movie adaptation of his first novel. But he's taking out his frustrations on us, his dear readers.If anyone wanted any ammunition in their argument that Ellis' talents are overhyped, this is a full belt. Anyone who compares any of his works to J.D. Sallinger should have their library card revoked.With this short work, Ellis has grabbed random handfuls of tricks and gimmicks that seemed to work in his previous books, but they don't stick together in this one. The sex and violence is here, but not in a good way, like in American Psycho. The name-dropping (ugh!) that was so tiresome in Dramarama is here, too. And the Lunar Park pseudo-creepy vibe is kind of recreated. Maybe. I guess. But not really.The main character has an iPhone. He seems to mention this on each of the 160-some pages. I guess iPhones are supposed to be a symbol of the moral depravity that supposedly is the hackneyed Hollywood scene. He wears a hoodie. On more than one occasion. He drives a BMW and he's lost weight. Not really sure what this is all about, as there's never really anything substantial about this little fish that's tossed in the chum. But there are lots of little details like this that just don't matter, at the expense, apparently, of details that might have made any of the characters sympathetic, or any of the myriad plot lines merely believable.This is a mystery that is not engaging. The narrator's hung up on some prostitute the way a fifteen-year-old boy would be infatuated with a seventeen-year-old girl. It just doesn't work this way in the adult world, and it's really boring to read about and figure this to be the driving conflict in the whole story. People die. Just like people do every day. Everyone is evil. Everyone is scheming somehow. Everyone is depraved. Everyone is so one-sided and so thin that you can see the end right through the transparent pages that separate the start from the last page.In the final analysis, I really do feel this is just Ellis flipping a big `ole bird at the movie version of Less Than Zero. Too bad he had to include all of those who were really kind of looking forward to another of his books. Hoping maybe he had started getting closer to where he started. Maybe he feels the same about his readers, too. I don't know. It's kind of easy to think maybe so when you look at the back inner-jacket photo of him grinning over whatever booze he's imbibing.The book has many unanswered questions. The characters themselves pose some in the text. I guess we're supposed to ponder upon their meaning and feel we're getting a peek inside a great philosophical mind, but the real question posed here is, "what's wrong with writing a novel to tell a story?"

I have heard this way of cleaning ones mouth through a mutual friend and never had any idea about which oil to use. Fortunately I came acroos the oul pulling bottles a couple of days back. I tried them and can feel the freshness in my mouth and improvement in oral health after using them for threeweeks.I saved a lot of money by ordering a two month supply.

I have been using the vius cleaner for a while ,  I have been using it on  my 60 inch TV too as I liked its performance on the tablets and smart phones. It is alochol free , sulphate free and also bio degradable so you dont have to worry about any health issues. It cleans all the dust and finger prints on the screen as promissed.  I would strongly recommend buying it .

The Asscom car charger was the simplest car charger I have ever seen. Even though it provides three USB ports it is slim and weighed less than the most USB car chargers in the market. Its stylish too with its golden colour band and have worked perfectly with my Android and  Iphones. I would recommend using the charging cable from the same manufacturer if they are selling one. This is super speed charger with smart sense capability that would help the charger to stop over charging your phone.

Got these bad boys in the mail today.How to use you ask?1)  Plug into socket2)  Take your cable and plug into charger3)  Plug phone into other end of USB cableBABOOM!  You are done.  It charges and does its job.  Nothing negative about it.  Great work guys.I was given these chargers for free in exchange for unbiased review of the item.

This is the best solution I had in recent years, I have tried so many other solutions for two years but was never satisfied with the results. The VolutreX worked great for me and I am happy along with my wife. I would strongly recommend buying it . Its worth your money.

When I heard for the first time I was surprised to hear that we can use medicines to increase the Butt size, But not anymore. After using GluteFX  butt enhancement pills for a month I can see the difference in their size. These are your best bet if you really want to increase your butt . Believe me and add it to your basket without a second thought.

The BRU french  press was amazing and incredible, I have decided to buy another one as a gift to my dearest cousin. The coffee brewed was really good and as a regular coffee drinker , I can assure you that the filter reaches your expectations. Yoou dont want have to worry about cleaning the filter as itis very easy to clean . Its so easy to use if you follow the instructions, Even a new person can freely use it without any trouble.

Oternals Electronic dog collar has made my job easy, These days my doggy have started acting weird, may be because she was pregnant. She started barking on hearing small sounds and whenever a friend visits my house. The colar did its job good and covers good range.  I have been using it for three weeks and never absorbed any reaction. I would recommend buying such a high quality collar.

In researching how to best use Jojoba oil I came across this statement from a website called vitaminstuff:"Jojoba oil is actually composed of liquid wax esters rather than oil. The body’s natural sebum also contains wax esters, which act as a sort of natural moisturizer and environmental barrier for the skin. However, wax ester production steadily decreases with age, causing the skin to appear dull and emphasizing wrinkles; a reduced ester content in the skin can also lead to the development of conditions such as psoriasis, dandruff, and rosacea. "It's actually not an oil, which explains why it absorbs into the skin so easily. Jojoba oil is also great for those who have a lot of allergies, because it resembles the skins natural sebum. You can use this amazing oil either by itself, or mix it with your favorite essential oils. Here are a few of the ways that I have used it:*Place on the lips for an amazing moisturizer that creates soft, kissable lips. My lips felt amazing!*Use as a body lotion, it doesn't leave a greasy feeling afterwards.*Rub a couple of drops between your palms and smooth over your hair to ease frizz.*Apply after shaving for soft, smooth legs.I received this oil at a discounted price, in exchange for my honest review. This has become my new favorite oil!

Received in exchange for a honest reviewOf all the characters in this book it was Aaron that I loved the most. I loved how he learned from the sins of his past and was trying to get beyond that. I loved that he was making an effort to become who he wants to be and not what others thought or expected of him.Melody when you begin is a little whiney. she is lost. Has lost her way in life and has lost passion. Passion in everything. As a character she shows the most growth. she goes from being whiney and self destructive to a strong take charge business woman who now has confidence in her abilities and has found someone to love and care for her. She does have some wariness when it comes to Aaron though.Aaron is not what people think. He is struggling to find his place. He loves music but doesn’t love the world of music. His desire is to sing and write and support his brother. When the story begins he fears relationships and family because he has seen what the music world does to them first hand. After he meets Melody he finds his muse and begins to change his tune on what he needs, wants and desires. They help each other resurrect their careers, become stronger more aware people and support one another. they find love when they are least expecting it and stumble at first out of fear but in the end they are great together.this is a fun no holds bar book about reinventing yourself, gaining confidence in who you are and what you can do and finding the one person who makes your days brighter and supports you. Aaron and Melody are wonderful sweet characters who with the help of each other gain the strength to see that they will make it, are better and stronger than they think and find love in each other. Aaron’s song to Melody so swoony. the romance is one based on attraction and friendship they come to respect and rely on each other. A great journey of two people finding their way in life and to each other.

Received in exchange of a honest review.With each book of Alice Clayton’s I fall more in love with her writing style. I love the sexy jokes that drip of innuendo and this book has so much of that. I love the denial of wanting more and slowly succumbing. Alice Clayton not only has a great fun sexy book here but the beginning of a great series.With this book what I liked most was the fun snarky ways and also the jokes were awesome. But the way that Roxie slowly saw that her hometown was a great place after she ran all those years from it. I loved how she began to find a love and fondness for her home and how her perspective about small towns and herself began to change. that isn’t to say she still wasn’t a bumbler especially around Leo but she was able to overcome her awkwardness of being scared to become her old self and stay strong and still be fun, loving, caring and nice. She was able to do what she loved while being at her family diner when she thought that she would drown in the monotony. Her high school crush and his husband helped her with this as did Leo.Leo the sexy smexy guy with a passion for the land he worked but coming from a family everyone associated with money. He wasn’t what Roxie expected and she turned her world around. He made her see beyond the wanting of success and the city and to what was passionate, wild and free. She began to see a caring sweet amazing guy who gave snark as much as he could take from her. The references to Almanzo Wilder cracked me up. It added a fun light element to the book as these two explored their feelings for each other.there wasn’t a moment that clayton didn’t have you smiling and loving each character. Even the ornery dairy farmer was likeable. Each character brought a whole level of fun and element to the book. Each played a part in creating a great experience throughout the book in which you got to see them and their town for what it was. They also helped Roxie in seeing what she was afraid of and confronting those fears head on.the story between her and leo was amazeballs. The banter and the sexy moments will have you laugh and fan yourself all at once. Clayton has outdone herself again with the perfect amount of smexy, intimate moments, fun snarky banner, finding yourself and what you want and romantic moments. She has us engaged from the beginning and doesn’t let you go until the end and what a ending. We get a sneak into what is next to happen in the series and a happy ending that is sure to keep us in stitches and smiling even in the later books. I am hooked on this series and can’t wait for the next.

This was wonderful. such a beautiful romance. I felt for Sawyer and Luke. Sawyer because of how much he kept inside and how much he wanted to keep his family from suffering from who he was. He was so afraid people would hurt his family’s livelihood and of disappointing his family that he kept who he was from everyone. Luke because he was treated so horribly in his past that you wanted to just hug him and tell him everything would be okay.Each character gave meaning and depth to the story. The ones that added comic relief were Zach and Kendrick. those two were a hoot. They were there when Sawyer needed them and showed such love and support even if they were goofballs. Kendricks jokes were to much they had me rolling. The ones when Luke and Sawyer went to the aquarium were just to funny. That comic relief was needed with the story of these two and their journey to finding comfort in who they are and finding love with each other..Sawyer’s family were so loving and understanding. Nicky was adorable with his honesty and way of seeing things you can’t help but smile. When the ones of his family didn’t initially show support for Sawyer you felt for him but as you learned why it broke your heart. They loved him so much they didn’t want him to hurt and didn’t realize they were hurting him more. This made them turn around and the support and love was breathtaking to see.I do want a story on Hayden and Mikel because that little tidbit was one that got you wanting to know more. Luke was a wonderful guy but hurt so much. He was trying to honor his mom but not really because he wasn’t  living. He was existing. He was fighting his feelings for Sawyer because of his pain from his dad and brothers. Sawyer knew this and was sweet, kind, understanding and patient. It hurt him to see Luke this way but he gave him the space and support that was needed for him to come around and see what he wanted and desired. What that was was Sawyer. I felt so much for Sawyer for this book showed us his struggle in his teens and college to present day and how much he wanted a love like everyone in his family had. He found this with Luke but it took time. Time for Luke to see that it was okay to love Sawyer. Once Luke came to terms with this it still took awhile for Luke to accept Sawyer’s family and that he wouldn’t hurt him. He was hurt so much in his past. As they got closer and the love became stronger, Luke began to give more to Sawyer and it was a wonderful sight.When apart we saw Sawyer show his own strength and from a distance love and support Luke but also go through a scary time in which he showed resilience and great character. He showed us that hate doesn’t work against hate as violence doesn’t work against violence. He showed us that acceptance of those that have hate towards his sexuality and forgiveness for their ignorance was the best offence even when they hurt you. It shows those around you how strong, kind and compassionate you are. It shows strength of character and morals. It shows people what kind of person he is and is a good example for others to follow.This is a sweet, heartbreaking, emotionally wonderful love story of two men who struggled to come to terms with who they are and who they love. A story that depicts a beautiful love that helps one heal and the other find strength in himself to be there for the one he love no matter what. A wonderful story that keeps you wanting to see what will happen and hoping for a happy ending. I loved the story of how Luke and Sawyer found themselves and love with each other. A love that lasts forever and I look forward to reading Zach’s  and Kendrick’s stories next.

This is a deviation from the other books of Barbara Cutrera's we have read. Here we have a more futuristic dangerous setting with intrigue, romance, suspense and unusual things occurring.Olga I will say disappointed me I expected more from her character and not a judas. Miss June was awesome and she helped you see that goodness could come out of helping others. Jason I was mixed at first. I didn't trust him but as the book went on he became more soft and understandable. He was invaluable and I saw the kindness of who he was. Paula was sweet and I was glad her and Jason got a happy ending. Jullian just evil and so deserved all that happened to him.Buddy what a wolf in sheeps clothing. It lets us see how one tragedy can scar and change a person. He went from this kind, idealistic loving man into I am not sure what you can call him in the end. I felt sorry for Nadine for she had no idea her husband was in so much pain that he couldn't deal and kind of went nutty.Nadine poor woman. She was sweet and kind. It killed me to hear her story. She is such a strong woman who went through so much. I am so glad that Chelsea and Aric are now a part of her life.Chelsea I am mixed about. She seems to be naive and yet brilliant at the same time. We get a look at what a Traumatic Brain Injury can do but at times she was a little confusing. Her passion was wonderful and so was her kindness but her childlike actions didn't always mesh with her desires and actions. It just took a while to see her the way Aric and others did. she was a strong character with compassion and was wonderful for Aric I just had to take time to reconcile all sides of her. I love her support of Aric and how she helps him see that happiness is okay to have. That it isn't his fault what happened to his family and that he should go on living.Aric was great to me. He was lost when we first meet him. So lonely and trying to help others. He wasn't dealing with his loss or what happened to him. He found purpose and love with Chelsea and she helped him open up. It was like watching someone grow and open up before your eyes. His compassion and love for chelsea and others was amazing. His protection of Chelsea was incredible to see. He and chelsea went through so much and had so much deception and danger put on them you feel for them and hope that they get peace soon.the plot kept you on your toes as you tried to piece together Chelsea's past, why people were being killed and Alraic and his condition that kept him from dying in the D plague and gave him the unusual medical condition he was in. The mystery and how these two tie together is fascinating and intriguing. Watching them support and love each other was great.This was a intriguing book that keeps you on your toes while the characters explore who they are, how to heal and find love with each other and a family amongst themselves.

love this fun heartwarming take on Cinderella using Ash and Mark.

Mark is one who tries to hide his looks. His past has him wanting to blend so that nothing will happen to him. He works hard, has dreams and is kind. He stays to himself and is a mean fashion designer.Ash is lost. He lives a lie so he won't dissapoint his family and lose them. In order for him to stay what they want he becomes something he isn't. He becomes a playboy. Now he is stuck. He has to give off the charming facade when he really is a vulnerable, kind, sweet man who wants to be loved and become something his family and himself can be proud of. Now he is in a bind, in order to get his inheritance, he must marry and he has two weeks. Little did he know that this would be a rocky fun wild ride.Mr. Pennymaker is a hoot. He is elfish but sneaky. He meets Mark and takes a liking. Suddenly Mark is now showing his designs to others but he is wearing them. No one can tell it is him. Pennymaker has him dressed in woman's clothes he designed and calling him Mariel. This rouse catches the eye of many not because they can tell it is Mark but because Mark is gorgeous. He also catches the eye of Ash for the first time Ash is attracted to a girl and this surprises him.Ash's first trip to getting a wife doesn't turn out well. Bitsy is fiesty, independent and call spot bs a mile away. This has Ash lay his cards out but Bitsy sticks to her guns. Meanwhile Mark has caught Ash's eye as he is serving them. Ash is intrigued by the man everyone calls Sinder. To make this more complicated Ash becomes his knight in shining armor and they get close.Little do either of them know, Ash gathers strength and courage from Ash and makes a life altering decision, Mark becomes the Cinderella story at a ball with his fairy godfather helping and orchestrating it all.this is a fun, sweet story about a boy who has a rough teenage years and works hard to try to save for his dream. He meets the playboy who wants to be more. They fall in love and this love helps one to not only want more but gather the strength to change the circumstances he is in. Their story is a fairytale for the one comes from the hard work to become the Cinderella to the playboy prince that wants more for himself. Each character adds flair and excitement to the tale as you come to the beautiful wedding and ending that will have you smile. A story of finding your voice because of the strength love and support from another gives you. A quirky sweet fun romance that is a fairy tale in all ways

this is sensual fun and fascinating to watch unfold. We have the older woman in Kendall who was burned by someone. She worked hard and thought that it would pay off and she would get her dream of a family at the end only to get tossed aside. This left her feeling very distrusting and alone. Now she has worked her way to becoming someone and wants to settle down and have children but only with someone of similar ways. She doesn’t want to join in the dating pool and find someone so she goes online. This cuts out the getting to know if they are compatible because the site does that for you.Meantime her world is in a tailspin because of the young sweet and gorgeous Jase who wants her but due to his childhood has a set plan and doesn’t  want to deviate from it. He does though feel drawn to Kendall and wants to get to know her and become more with her.She resists him at first but he does wear her down. She sets it though so it is only friends with bennies and over time they will stop because she doesn’t want to get hurt and wants a family whereas he wants a family but not right away.As they go on this wild sexy adventure they get to know each other and see that they are alike in many ways. Not only do they get to know each other’s  bodies they fall in love. For Jase he begins to see that he wants Kendall and is starting to believe in watching his plans. For Kendall it causes her to panic because of Jase’s age and his not wanting a family right away. When they do walk away it was Kendall asking for the space and when something unexpected occurs she controls how everything will happen without giving Jase a chance to say anything.He does though. He gets her to see him and his desires and they get a great happy wonderful ending.  I like that we have two strong characters whose lives have had detours. One decides to structure their world and the other work hard and than go after their desires because they are now established. They find each other and succumb to the attraction only to have their world turned upside down and that is a good thing. they have to learn that life isn’t always structured or follows a timetable and that love comes when you least expect it.A wonderful set of characters that bring you on a sexy ride as they see what love does to their world and how it makes them better.

This was adorable. I absolutely adore Emmett. He is a strong character that has manners, is kind and considerate. He doesn't try to harm anyone or treat anyone with disdain.Casey Peeler has given us a southern romance. A clean southern romance that has your heart go pitter patter. What makes this even better is that the romance doesn't take over the book or overwhelm you. This book is about the strength of one girl-Reagan. A girl who has been through so much. When she was younger she lost her parents and is raised by her grandfather. What stands out in this time for her is the little boy who brought her a stuffed bunny. This little boy was Emmett. This bunny has become her safety blanket like Linus has in Peanuts. It gives her comfort and lets her know that she will be okay. It also lets her know there are others that care. Over the years Reagan becomes the epitome of what every parent wants in a child. She is kind, thoughtful, smart,considerate and does as asked of her. For her though her grandfather comes before anyone or anything.When this world of hers gets a wrinkle, Emmett is there. He is back and still in love with Reagan- the little girl who stole his heart and never let it go. He doesn't try to take over her world though. He tries to find a place in it. He understands who comes first and only asks to play a role. He is there for her when she needs it and becomes her support system. He allows her to see that someone out there cares and won't walk away.The romance is slow building and sweet. Sometimes I had to look up things because I am not familiar with Southern ways or even sodas. It was good to get out of the familiar and go into the world of the south. the country where romance is sweet and life seems to slow down and not be so fast paced. A romance that is based on trust and friendship and not just attraction. Two people who give each other strength and support coming together not to take over the other's world but make it better.The family aspect shows us what family is and what family does for one another. Grandpa is awesome and he will have you laugh, cry and smile all through the book. He is one tough ole bird.A sweetly written book on family, loss, survival and love. A delightful read that keeps your heart warm and smiling.

The skating aspect is amazing and so real. The training, the competitiveness is just so real. You feel like you are living these characters hopes, dreams and disappointments. This is a sweet romance. They struggle to get together not because they don’t  like each other but because of their skate partners and being each other’s competition. For Josh though this isn’t a issue. He doesn’t care. He has liked Courtney for eight years. She has been his inspiration in the choreography he creates and he has waited so long to be with her. Courtney has the problem but because she is confused. Not over her feelings but over how it would work. Could they concentrate on their skating and if one loses would they be happy for the other?Each character has their own flair. The twins are cutey patooteys and how they latch to Courtney is precious. Mrs. Cappers cracks me up. Josh’s parents meh they are way to controlling. Love Courts parents though they are the right blend of supportive and loving. Em and Sergei I believe they were trying to do what was right but that doesn’  t always pan out. Stephanie, Josh’s sister, major B*. Mark is Courtney’s partner and he is intense. we don’t get much on him although you can understand his fears, wariness and intensity. This is his last chance at a medal so everything is on the line for him.All the scheming and evilness of Stephanie I am glad to see doesn’t work. She outs Josh and Courtney but that gets them stronger and closer, she is horrible to Courtney but that only makes Courtney strive for more. Josh is nothing like his sister-he’s kind, thoughtful, sweet, patient and swoony. He treats Courtney like a queen and is so shy and quiet that it isn’t  until he says anything that you believe he is liking Courtney or even going to do anything about his crush. As they get closer the relationship takes on new meaning. they now have a support system and trust each other. Unfortunately things do tear at them until Courtney sees that her heart belongs to Josh. She has to get over the sting of loss to be able to move forward. All at once her world crumbles and she is lost. This takes  time to come back from. Good thing Josh is a patient guy and loves her.the story is sweet and I love watching Josh blossom and show himself to others. I love how he gains the courage to show his feeling and intentions to Courtney. I love how it is this love that gives him the courage to stand up for himself and what he wants to do with his life. I felt bad though that his parents never really believed he could make it on his own. So glad that Courtney’s family is their to support them.This book brings you into the world of competitive skating and the competitiveness. It shows you and has you feel the hopes and dreams of those in the sport. We see love blossom, fears realized, worlds crumble but love pull them through and they come out stronger.A nice book on love and finding who you are. finding your voice and the support and love you need to help you become who you want to be.

this book does not need Cindrella’s dress to be read and understood but by reading Cinderella’ s dress first you get a better idea and background first. You also get more depth to the characters and the parts they play. Each character has a role and has importance even if it isn’t seen at first.The building of the era and the surroundings is excellent and needed so that you can transport yourself back to this time. the descriptions and stories make you feel as if you are there living it. The history of Cinderella as we know it is upended and this viewpoint and tale is just as wonderful and beautiful.Shonna Slayton has taken a fairy tale we all know and adore. One we wish would happen to us and upends it a little. We now have the descendants taking a role but the dresses and shoes are magical. the fairy godmother is a woman named Esmerelda but known to others as something else.this adventure takes place when Kate is on her way to Italy with the Kodolenko’s and Johnny. Johnny is on his way to work with his dad for the summer, the Kodolenko’s  back home after claiming the dresses and Kate to find Cinderella’s shoes and her dad.Nessa is the next in line for the dresses and boy is she spoiled. she loses sight of what is important and begins to treat Kate as a servant. She forgets that as a princess she is to serve others and not boss them around. The dresses take over her thoughts and she lets the greed that all is warned about consume her. We do however get glimpses of the real Nessa throughout the book and at the end when she learns her lesson. Overall Nessa is a nice caring girl who gets caught up in the idea of being a princess and having something others want.In a way so does Kate, she doesn’t  get spoiled but more possessive. Her fear of not doing what is best for the dresses has her become more green. She thinks of herself as the owner instead of the keeper. It is Johnny and her adventure that has her see this. Her and Nessa are the next generation for the dress and shoes and they are to change the role this has. I hope we get to read how this happens in later books.Johnny there aren’t  enough words for him. He is swoonworthy. So loyal kind and amazing. He loves and supports Kate as she does him. He has the patience of Job for understanding about the keeper role and waiting for Kate to find her way. He is steadfast and wonderful. What lesson he learns when they are pulled into a game and left behind is that he needs to trust Kate like he asked her to trust him. This goes a long way in helping their relationship get stronger. Their belief in one another is never ending and their support of each other is infinite as is the love and respect they have for each other. He is a true Prince Charming and I want to see more of him and Kate and how their relationship builds more in later books.The story itself is unique and as said before upends the cindrella tale. We get a fun twist about the dresses and shoes and see them be used for good and hopefully find a new tale with them. The adventure through Poland is eye opening and dangerous for Kate. She has to learn to rely on Lidka. Lidka who wants to love but is afraid of losing everything again. Who is angry about the war. When Lidka realizes she was used, she shows herself to Kate and helps her out. Lidka is the complex character who shows us all what can happen when you lose everything and are afraid to show your love. She is the one who helps everyone learn lessons from their greed and want of the dresses.This is a creatively written, beautiful and alluring tale of hope, dreams and love. About finding faith in those around you and in the love you have for others. About reunions that show what it means to have love and have a fairy tale happen with a happy ending. About finding someone to love and trust and about beginning to open your heart and let someone in. A great adventure for a pair of shoes that can lead to finding a father that leads to danger and lesson learned but also finding out how much someone means to you and learning what greed can do. I hope that this series has more to come because with each book the story got more alluring and entrancing and drew you into the characters, era and tale being unfolded before you. Each book drew you into the book more and had you feel you were living in the moment and feeling what the characters were. A wonderful book and series so far.

Wasn’t sure what to think at first but after I began couldn’t stop. It wasn’t the erotic moments that captured me though. It was the story itself and the characters.We have two people who have fears and don’ t let anyone in. One because of feeling left behind and replaced another because of the actions of her parents. One becomes like stone and the other runs when someone wishes to get close. They live their emotions in horse showing and jumping. this is where they feel safe.I liked Grant more than Heather I will admit. Grant was tough as stone on the outside but as his feisty witchy sister said he is soft on the inside. He sees the good in people when there is good to be seen. He tries to please others so they aren’t  hurt but this has hurt him. He no longer stands up for himself that is until Heather. He trusts her and has a connection to her. She helps him find his voice again. He helps her see that she can open up and that not everyone thinks she is like her parents. Grant doesn’t care what her parents did for it isn’t who she is. this takes awhile for her to see. See that he loves her and wants her. Grant shows Heather who he is on the inside and not what she thinks he is.Heather is a stubborn, feisty but kind and compassionate woman. She has a problem letting people in. Her and her brother have shut down emotionally due to her dad’s past actions. This has left her alone and distrusting. Her world is her horse’s and trying to beat Grant in that arena. She almost settles for the doctor she works with so that she can have someone but Grant changes this. She is so afraid of making the wrong choice that she runs and allows the voices of her past that told her she was worthless and everyone would walk away to take over. Grant though sticks to her. He doesn’t  relent. He is there to support her, care for her and love her. Until she is stupid and tries to push him away.Miracles though happen and they find each other once more. Grant shows her love and compassion for he is this on the inside. He is kind and caring, patient and wise. One who is there no matter what. this is a erotic, sensual and intimate book about finding the one to open your heart and to trust. A book on finding your voice and yourself and allowing yourself to love and be loved by someone.

This begins with the telling of three different peoples lives and where they are emotionally and physically. Eventually three of those people’ s lives collide at the resort. the journey to getting there and what happens there is interesting.Xan is a little bit snobbish to me but she does have reasons. What her boyfriend did was all kinds of wrong and it was what pushed her to go through with going to the Resort. She is a strong character although sometimes rushes to judgement and than when someone changes doesn’t  acknowledge or give second chances. She thinks the worst of Jason no matter what even when he is being the sweet guy that is underneath that jackass exterior. Xan is brought to the island to fix things. Her eyes are opened to so much and she is good at what she does but needs to learn that sometimes what you see isn’t all there is.Phuong is in a tough situation. She wants to help her dad’s company but also become more independent. When her brother does some stupid decisions they affect her and she turns to becoming a email mail order bride. Her  first dip landed her the horrible guy who used her in ways that are beyond the pale. He was quite abusive so by the time Jason comes in the picture she is skiddish and self deprecating. She believes she isn’t worth the effort.Jason (jay) has more to him than meets the eye. We begin with him as a arrogant, selfish rock star who thinks woman just fall at his feet and he can have whatever he wants. He drinks to much but I think this is due to his loneliness. He wants more in a relationship. He wants a companion and someone to take care of. He is a closet romantic and the books he reads are hysterical. One night he decides to try his luck on a site and begins talking to Phoung. She changes him to be the sweet kind man we see in the end.When Phuong escapes her situation she has a rough time trying to get to Jay but when she does she is afraid. She thinks its all a joke. He does get her to see it isn’t  and as they get to know each other they get close. They begin to love one another.this is a hot, fun romance of two people who want a happy ever after but afraid it isn’t possible. When they find one another things from the past effects the present but they work together to get through it. Jay is such a kind supportive patient and sweet guy. he treats her like a queen. The book has steamy moments but is about two people coming together under strained circumstances and becoming more than they expected to each other.

so many emotions here. Love Nik. On the fence about Callie but understand her and her actions. Callie’s dad no just no he was wretched.Nik is lonely and lost. Lost in grief. He is trying to find a way to go on from his parents death. He is trying to change his routine and where he is going with his life. A great guy who sees beyond what people portray decides to take on the role of coaching.Callie is the gymnast who is going against the grain. She is 26 and still going for the Olympics against all that say she is to old. She is in a sport that she used to love fulfilling the dreams of others and trying to prove she still can win. She is rote in her movements and shut down in emotions. She is lost in doing what others thinks she should and not what she wants to do. Nik becomes her coach and the catalyst in her life. the catalyst that sees beyond what she portrays and gets her to begin to feel and see what is out there. Not that she can’t do it but that she is no longer passionate. Not that people look down at her but that she shut herself off so that she can become more focused. he teaches her that focus and emotion don’t have to be separate. emotion can drive the focus. Nik is more than a coach but a trusted friend. But for them feelings become more.The romance that occurs is intense. They understand each other and with Nik’s kindness and patience it helps Callie to see who she really is and become comfortable with herself. she begins to gain confidence and support. She feels that now someone is in her corner. The barbs they take at each other in the gym are fun and quirky. they show passion and fire. A passion and fire for the world they are in and for each other.Her dad though what a piece of work. He almost dismantles a bond that is precious and beautiful. One that helps the other shine and believe in themselves. A bond that is forged from love and understanding. Fortunately for us that love can handle dad’s and being miles apart. When Callie is in danger Nik is there no matter what. It is this love that shines through in everything both does.A passionate look at love and the world of gymnastics, the book gives us two people who see beyond what they show others to what is inside and what they need. A book that gives us passion and love but shows us what love can do. Shows us love can overcome obstacles and help one shine when no one else thinks they should at that age in that world-the world of gymnastics.

received in exchange for a honest review. This is a cute cute romance.Ben is this awkward guy who has a love for books and this is what he wants to get lost in-the emotions, thoughts, concepts of books. He wants to immerse himself in what they bring to him. He wants to express this love to others and have them show him what they see in the book. He wants others to see what literature can bring to them. But his family is against this. They feel this is a pipe dream. So he swallows his love and goes the path of least resistance. He crushes on the girl his parents would approve of so he can feel numb. He is a sweet, kind shy guy who just is lost. Lost in the expectations of the moments his family creates for him. Than comes the one girl who is feeling similar to him. A girl who doesn’t read but has the world opened to her by Ben showing her what books bring to the table. A girl who doesn’t want to disappoint her dad but isn’t sure if her life goal is the same anymore.  Hannah is a smart sweet girl and she is lost. Lost in the world of chemistry and wanting to change the world and follow her parents footsteps. But one day she meets a boy- a wide eyed boy who showed her a new world. A world of books and who he was. This changes her and excites her. She no longer feels the same about the world she is living in. The world where chemistry is what she wants.As they go on in the world of books they find each other. Their thoughts, feelings and beliefs. What makes them them. What they love and what they truly want and love. they become friends but deny they feel more. As the feelings grow so does their trust in one another. Ben does do some stupid things but only because of fear. Fear of losing everything. When he realizes this, he changes. He goes with his feelings. And they are good together. Their story is cute. It shows us how life expectations wear on us but when we let someone in we can find the strength to become free. Free of expectations and of what others want. We can just become who we are meant to be. Ben and Hannah find a anchor and support system with each other. they become friends and fall in love. they help each other through difficult situations with patience, kindness and love.This is a fun sweet cute story that has likeable characters who warm your heart as you read about them finding courage to stand up for their dreams and find love with each other.

This is a fun book. Charlie is a man on a journey to not only find courage but love and himself. He has gone through so much and did what he had to to survive that now he fears what he can do once he walks away from what he knows. He walks away for love. Love that transforms him.Allison at times is a little irritating but she does grow on you. Her love for Charlie is wonderful. The ending wasn’t what I expected and I am not sure what her true character will be but the next book will certainly tell us this. When she does what Charlie thought she would he does lose himself to his grief and has something happen. Another unexpected moment. But it is Charlie that has us see her goodness again.the story is a fun flirty one that has many twists and turns and mouth open from the Wow that is handed out to you. Truly Charlie you will root for and what to see change his life for love. He has gone through so much to finally find love and have it ripped from him is heartbreaking. He does fight himself about it for the longest time until he can’t anymore. When he does give in is when heck breaks loose and our holy wow factors begin to emerge.Each character brings a new dimension to the book. From Allison’s  greedy mom, her sister who is seriously having anger issues towards men, Charlie’s friends who support and love him, Jacqueline who is freaky obsessed, Charlie who is fun flirty and the transformation from male escort to who he really is will knock you off your feet, and Allison who is the reason Charlie wishes to be himself and find himself again.the ending will have you wanting the next book. A great beginning in this series on love and how it can empower you to change and how it gives us the strength to become who we are meant to be

A great deviation from her Submissive series. Emma is a tough as nails, honest and hard working woman who has been put in a bad situation. She is out of a job and needing one desperately. Her options are limited and so she turns to a home nursing position in which the nurses don’t seem to stay long. William is the geeky gorgeous nerd who is hiring. He isn’t what anyone expects in a nerd. He is a little cocky and a lot sexy. He does have this side to him that is sweet and kind and when it comes to Emma he is everything. Cocky, fun, sweet, kind, and sexy as sin.They try to fight the attraction so that Emma doesn’t leave but in the end the Grandma turns those tides. She is hard on the nurses that won’t make a good mate for her grandson. With Emma she is a sweet lady. This has Emma believing that it’s her grandson who chases off the nurses. Little does she know what is hidden behind that geeky exterior. When she finds out it is harder than ever to fight her need to be with William but both do because she needs the job and he wants her to stay.When they finally do come together it’s explosive, erotic and sexy. How he opens up in the end so that she feels wanted and loved is beautiful and shows the sweet, loving side of William.This is a fun sweet and sexy book. We have the geek who seems arrogant and cocky but is really a nice guy who loves his grandma and wants her to be comfortable. The grandma who wants to find someone for her grandson before she goes and the nurse who needs the job and is fighting an attraction she doesn’t want. When the elements combine we get a book that has some fun snark, hot romance and a sweet ending that puts a smile on your face.

I never thought Lord’s story could be beaten out as a favorite but one took the prize. Here you are truly put through an emotional gambit. when you read about Lucas and Yve your heart will go out to them. they have such sad troubling pasts and have risen above them to become strong people. the past has left scars that only those who have survived can understand, see and heal.Lucas when we first saw him in this series came off as a cocky, arrogant man who only looked out for what was best for him. He didn’t hide behind airs. He was who he was and that was what you accepted. Yet here we see who he really is. We see the damaged vulnerable Lucas who feels guilt and shame. We see the Lucas who is still fighting for approval of his father. We see a Lucas trying to rise above his past and show his past that he is a survivor and better than perceived. We see a Lucas who is also kind and compassionate. One who has a strong soul and heart. He cares and those who he lets in he protects with all that he is.Yves past is just as sad and heartbreaking but she doesn’t  try to beat it out she overcomes it. Except in her own way she takes her past and uses it as a shield. A shield to paint the male species as the enemy. One in which she decides she is not one that needs help, and a man to be there for her. Her mother taught her she doesn’t want to rely on someone else and also that men aren’t to be trusted or considered anything but users. She wraps herself in a arrogance of anger and distrust. Towards Lucas she is truly not nice at first. she fights him left and right and treats him horribly. At first you feel that you are okay with this but over time you truly want to smack her upside the head. Her past has a lot to do with her shielding her heart from him. She has placed him in the category of all rich men and didn’t want to give him a chance. slowly though he works his way to her walled up heart and begins to break her chains around it. As they get closer she still fights with everything she can to not relent to her feelings. That is until her life is turned upside down and he is there for her. He is kind and gentle and lets her in. In to his home, his world, his life and his heart. Her scars have made her stronger but also more defiant. As they both show themselves to each other, they see the scars of the past and what it has done to themselves.Each uses these scars to shield themselves from pain but also from love. As they open up to one another the scars are healed and they begin to truly find their way to each other. As the danger in Yve’ s life gets greater, Lucas gets closer and he is truly her protector. He shows her strength and love. Kindness and patience and respects her and her choices. the ending oh my. You will swoon at Lucas’s moment of swoonworthy romance.this is a powerfully written book of two people with emotional and physical scars from the past who hide behind them to keep from being hurt again. As they come together the scars are exposed and they help each heal. They fall in love with one another and see that with each other they truly can be themselves and get over the walls that they closed themselves in and find themselves and each other.

Trina starts the book as a rather frigid girl who thinks she knows everything. She is schedule oriented never sways from her opinion and schedule. She feels that she is the one teaching Slade. Determined to get him fired so that she can do things her way for Slade will surely be the slacker she knows he is. She only sees one side of things and that is her side.Slade is so easy going and relaxed you wonder if he is gumby. I think he is like this because of the pressure his parents place on him. He is rebelling against them in his own way trying to show them he is a person and his own person to boot. When his parents threaten him with no allowance unless he gets a job he goes on the interview his mother setup for him for a nanny position. Little did he know his mother was being underhanded.It’ s funny because neither really saw the other as anything but thorns. Slade wanted to be her partner as a nanny and she wanted him gone. even when he helped her she thought he was being uncooperative and a bad nanny. She fought him left and right and just treated him beneath her. As she gets to see who he is she begins to like him. The barbs they have are fun and the adventures as nanny’s  they go on with the children are a hoot. the little kids they are watching are a scream. They are so cute. It is because of them that Slade and Trina truly get to know each other and see who they really are. Slade at first denies his attraction. thinking it is just because of the bet he has with his friend. but as the summer wears on he begins to see it isn’t. He changes. He becomes more responsible and stops his player ways. He is still fun loving but now he feels things and sees he likes trina.Things do begin to build and it is a joy to see. These two are so fun and sweet once they get over the hangups. They work well together as well. He is the fun and she is the rational and logical one. He is calm and collected in situations and she helps to enrich the days with educational musings.When things come to a head in their wonderful peace, I feel Trina overreacted and was a bit hypocritical. What she was doing was a lot worse than Slade’s bet. He was trying to loosen her up and get her to have fun. In the process he fell in love. She was deceiving him in a bigger way and when it came out from her accidentally exposing the secret she had she I don’t think understood the depth of the hurt to Slade. He felt as if she didn’t truly see him. that she saw him as just a job a slacker who couldn’t hack it. They both did some swoonworthy actions to get the other back.This is a fun loving sweet book about two opposites who come together. they begin to see each other differently as they work together and they change their opinions of one another. Trina changes from being so schedule oriented and thinking she knows all to letting her hair down every once in awhile and having fun. she sees him as a equal.
