It also takes up so little space on my desktop that I'm able to use an Apple mouse on either side (I'm ambidextrous and also switch if one hand hurts more than the other). Also, because it's so compact, I don't find myself overextending to reach for either mouse.Unlike the Apple mouse which disconnects from the bluetooth all the time, I never have that issue with the keyboard. I honestly have trouble using my old Kinesis--which is probably better for my hands--because it is wired and not as convenient as this keyboard.As for aesthetics, this is an Apple keyboard. There's no question that it LOOKS better than just about any keyboard out there. It also holds up. As I said, I haven't had any troubles with it and the one issue I had with some keys after YEARS of constant daily use was quickly resolved over the phone.

I've been using only Neutrogena sunblock since I was a kid and started having allergic reaction to "regular" sunblock. Neutrogena has never disappointed me or my super sensitive skin.What I love most about the ultra sheer sunblock body mist is in the name, it's ultra sheer. Unlike other sunblocks, including other Netrogena options, I don't feel it going on or once it is on my skin. In fact, I pretty much forget about it...except when I'm in the sun and I need to reapply it!This three-pack from was a much better price than I could find in any of my local stores. Perfect purchase.

After watching my hand towels from Target get rattier and rattier, I purchased these from last minute before a big party at my home. At the time, I was looking for something simple, not something that would stand the test of time or anything. I purchased them in white because that's all that was available and I picked this particular product because it could be delivered Amazon Prime Fresh.It's been about a month since I ordered these towels and I am have not been disappointed. Yes, obviously, my expectations were very low but I will never buy another hand towel at Target again! Despite being white, these towels have stayed vibrant after many washes without any kind of bleach. They've stayed the bright white in color that they were when they arrived promptly on my doorstep.Aside from how well the color has held up, I'm very impressed with how the quality of these 100% cotton towels. I've bought towels that have barely held up after one wash but these look brand-new. No loose threads. No complaints. These are some great towels. They may be plain but they're pretty amazing.

I seriously cannot get enough of this product. It was recommended to me in my 7th month of pregnancy and I wish I had discovered it sooner. I was going through cartons of much more expensively priced epsom salt at the drug store.First things first, THIS IS HEAVY because you're getting A LOT of epsom salt. Whenever I get a delivery of it via Amazon Prime Fresh, I have a hard time lugging it from the door to my bathroom. But to me, the price is worth the effort though and convenience.Epsom salt works and this product does not disappoint helping me relax my muscles in tub or soak my feet in the shower. It definitely has helped me with my chronic aches and pains. I use it faithfully every night, especially while pregnant!

I have carpal tunnel and repetitive stress injuries along with some other ailments that make it hard to hold up the phone for long (or short) periods of times. Because of this, I am used to using Bluetooth headsets with my cellular phone.I recently got a home phone set up in my home and purchased a Panasonic KX-TGE233B DECT 6.0 Expandable Digital Cordless Answering System to fill up the gaps in our home where our cellular service hits a dead zone. I noticed really quickly that I was having travel holding up the phone for periods at a time during phone conversations and I wanted something better than using the really impressive speakerphone.This headset fits the bill. It's lightweight. I keep it plugged into one of the handsets all the time by my home office desk. I find that the headset is really comfortable and surprisingly sturdy.

Basically, my husband and I had had enough of losing our remotes in the couch cushions, under the couch, all over the living room and I found this on Amazon. I needed something that wasn't fabric because of our dust allergies and the faux leather fit the bill. Now, the only complaint we have is to one another when we forget to put the remotes BACK in the caddy which happens less and less often as we get used to the caddy.The quality of the product is very good--much better than I expected for the price really--and it looks great even matching my faux leather couch in the same color. It's taken some nosedives off our storage ottomans and side tables and still looks great. I do wish that it would spin a bit more easily and that it had a carry handle for when I want to move it around the house.  But the product is exactly as advertised.

I have extremely sensitive skin but it wasn't until a dermatologist that suggested Vanicream that I realized how sensitive. After using regular shave cream for so many years, I got used to the idea that when I shaved my legs, I would have super dry awfully chalky skin.Then I found this product after using the Vanicream lotions. It takes a bit of getting used to after all those colorful, foaming, fragrant shaving creams that you can find at your local drugstore. Vanicream shave cream is thin, it doesn't foam, it doesn't have a scent or color. Despite how thin it is, it gets the job done. After I shave my legs now, I don't need to slather cream. This shave cream seems to have a dual purpose: helping me shave my legs and keeping them moisturized for long after.

I've tried to wrap my hair in silk or satin at night when I go to bed but I get lazy. I've just gotten used to the idea that when I get up in the morning, I need to do anything possible to revitalize my matted, flattened curls. But that was all before I discovered this product!!!I have 3b tight curly hair that is very fine and very dry. This product isn't kidding about the extra-moisture. It leaves my hair moisturized for days...not even my pillow can take that away at night. Instead of having to use product in the morning, I just fluff up any curls gone awry. The great thing is that promised extra moisture doesn't translate into leaving my hair oily. It really leaves my hair unbelievably soft.As someone with chemical allergies, I also appreciate that this all-natural product doesn't give me hives!

I was really hopeful for this product. I had originally intended to get the Flex but I was mesmerized by the features and technical aspects of the Charge so I decided to go big or go home.I was very pleased when I received the product. I love that it doubles as a watch.Unfortunately, like many people have had, I had an allergic reaction right away. Within 30 minutes, my wrist was bright red and covered in hives. I had followed the directions on the product to the letter. I was disappointed to do some research as I was returning it to Amazon to see that this was very similar to the issues people had had with the Fitbit Force. The recall with the Force actually kept me from buying a Fitbit for over a year.Now I really wish I'd gone with the Flex as it has been around longer and there haven't been the allergy complaints that there have been for the Charge. Instead of getting the Flex right away, I've decided to see how Fitbit deals with this new situation with the Charge. So far, it seems as if they're just blaming it on the customer.Update: After being disappointed by the Charge, I returned it and got a Fitbit Surge. The Fitbit Surge did not give me any allergic reactions until the band broke in a couple of places around the wrist area. Fitbit sent me a replacement the next day after I contacted them via email as it was still under warranty.

I cannot get enough of this granola. It's delicious! Whether you eat it alone (seriously, I've eaten it straight out of the bag), with yogurt or as cereal with milk, it doesn't disappoint.I'm glad that the granola comes conveniently in a pack of four because as soon as my husband finishes a bag, he gets worried about where his next granola snack is coming from. We go through them incredibly quickly because, as I said, the granola is so tasty.

I love this product! I was skeptical because I've used other types of mousse and they have never worked for me. Most of them have dried my hair something terrible. I have Type 3B tight, fine curly-kinky hair.I have chemical fragrance allergies and have had a really hard time finding products for curly hair that are fragrance free or use natural fragrances. In the case of this product, the fragrance is natural and very pleasant.My biggest problem in the morning is losing curl definition while I was sleeping. My new routine is to dampen my hair with some DevaCurl Mist-er Right Lavender Curl Revitalizer and I stick the Shea Moisture Coconut & Hibiscus Frizz-Free Mousse in my hair. And then I'm done! The hold and shine are really incredible and my hair is definitely frizz-free. Even better, it doesn't feel weighed down from product and feels really soft!

These are great pencils and they're exactly as pictured: they come pre-sharpened and in psychedelic, aesthetically pleasing cool colors.I didn't have to sharpen them for a very long time and only broke part of the point when I pressed down VERY hard once using one of the pencils. The pencils claim to have "break-resistant lead" not break-impossible lead.The erasers are good quality but not perfect. I like that when I use the eraser, I don't end up with "eraser droppings" all over the place. It's a very neat process with this eraser. However, I felt like the eraser was "okay" and even after I use it, I can still see what I've attempted to erase unless I press down hard. I can see going through the eraser much faster than the pencil at this rate.

In the Amazon description for The Girl Below, it reads “enthralls with a strange magic akin to Audrey Niffenegger, Haruki Murakami and Sarah Waters.” On that short list, I’ve read Niffenegger and adored her books but I did not feel that kind of magic while reading this book…not even close.I received The Girl Below via Amazon Vine and started reading it right away. I put it down after just a few short pages because I was bored to death. The protagonist Suki Piper is not only unlikeable and insufferable but also terrible and unreliable. At one point in the book, it feels terribly ironic when Suki herself figures out that the other characters save for Peggy and her family find her pretty awful, too.I asked to receive this book because I am an Anglophile fascinated by all things British and I was intrigued by the story of Suki returning to London after ten years in New Zealand. The mystery in this book is not one dysfunctional family because I felt that was never solved. The mystery of this book is WHY we should read it.The book delivers bits and pieces that never really add up: including Suki’s mother’s death, her father’s abandonment, crazy garden scenes, inappropriate relationships and “exotic” locales from London to New Zealand to Greece.  The descriptions are lovely. The writing is lovely. There are books where a character is so interesting that you can look past their likeability but this is not that book. Suki becomes more and more unsympathetic even as we learn more about why she is the way she is (her family’s “mysterious” backstory).I didn’t grow to care for Suki no matter how much of the book I forced myself to read and I did force myself to read it until the end. The book aims for creepy and mysterious with strange scenes where Suki seems to walk between the past and the present leading the reader to wonder if she’s lost her damn mind or if these are fantasy sequences until all is “explained,” halfheartedly I felt, in the end.Suki seems to find her place, however disturbing and strange in Peggy’s family eventually but there are things like her relationship with the sixteen-year-old grandson that are just unreadable and further your dislike for her character. I really started to wonder why no one else in Peggy’s family thought that Suki was losing her mind but they were too preoccupied with the much more fascinating Peggy. In fact, a book that followed Peggy’s daughter Pippa and her misspent youth or the mysteries of her sulky grandson Caleb or even her son Harold or son-in-law Ari would have been more interesting

Fans of rock star romances will be drawn to this tale of young love tragically torn apart and the pain and misunderstandings that festered over their years apart.  With the world of rock music as a backdrop, it's all about the love and friendship between three people and their journey to putting their pain behind them to find happiness.  As the second installment in the Sound Of series readers get a glimpse of the other band members of Destruction that leaves you wanting to read the previous installment while longing for the next as each musician is sexy and larger than life.Brent was a ladies man in high school but has become bored with all the women throwing themselves at him.  Sitting next to the smart and pretty Aimee who offers to tutor him changes his life irrevocably though as she's the one girl to lead him on a merry chase leaving him uncertain of their relationship.  When she's torn away from him by her villainous, and cliched, mother just as their connection takes a dramatic turn it sets him on a path of self-destruction amidst years of separation.  When she finally returns it will take a lot of forgiveness and putting past pains behind them for them to finally make a HEA.  Brent was a sweet and sexy musician whose befuddlement over feelings and relationships was fun to watch.  He was always there for Aimee, showing her he cared in every small word and deed, and it made him perfect boyfriend material.  He has a caring side, a big heart in wanting the best for those he loves, which further endeared him to me.Aimee's life was set in stone due to her parent's machinations.  Her lone act of rebellion was falling for the rock god which set her life off in a completely different direction which brought out the nastiness in her mother and years of fear and pain.  Reuniting with her lost love, whose love sustained her in her darkest hours, sets her up for more pain as she tries to right past wrongs in hope of a HEA.  Aimee was a bit naive at the start of the story, having lived a life of almost all work and very little play to live up to her parent's expectations.  Being with Brent gave her unconditional love and support, along with a strengthening self-esteem.  The event that pulls her from Brent is a serious one, emotionally intense, but takes on an over the top melodramatic turn that lacked believability.  Their years apart makes both of them stronger, giving them the chance to make a family as adults.Along with these two engaging main characters comes drummer and best friend Eric who's the sounding board for Brent and Aimee as they traverse their relationship.  Eric's the sweet, supportive, and funny friend who keeps his own feelings hidden so his best friends can find their HEA.  Eric lights up a scene with his big heart and endearing quirks and I look forward to him finding love in his own book that I'm counting down the days for.  From start to finish this is a story full of intense emotions.  The flashback section nicely sets up Brent and Aimee's reunion and shows the strength in their commitment if they can just move on from past hurts.  Readers who enjoy New Adult-themed reads with melodramatic twists and turns will want to check out these rock gods and their sexy dichotomies!

When it comes to romance novels it's all about the hero for me, and with Hendrix these two authors have crafted an amazing one!  Hendrix might have come from a background of physical abuse with the idea of love foreign to him, but with his mother's guidance he's a sexy yet sweet man who goes out of his way to help those he cares about never expecting anything in return.  He's charming with a talent for dirty talk and though he doesn't think himself capable of love and commitment it shines through for that one woman in his every word and deed.  Surrounding him are two brothers battling their own personal demons but equally sweet and sexy with them a formidable trio always there for each other with playful banter and brotherly mocking which brought a smile to my face.  Each brother had a unique personality, immensely appealing in their brashness with moments of vulnerability that kept me enthralled with them.With Hendrix's feelings regarding love you knew it would take a strong-willed woman to win his heart.  The authors though didn't go for the obvious in that Olivia is a woman full of quirks and insecurities, but with a big heart to fully embrace all of Hendrix's need to be the protector and become an important part of the group he calls family.  Olivia came from a family of divorce which left her vulnerable to a betrayal by someone she called family and it's left her full of self-doubts.  After years of letting the negativity hold her back she's finally remaking herself, embracing her own naughty side and stepping outside her comfort zone with the luscious Hendrix as her guide.  Olivia's a delightful heroine who has an obsession with underwear with words of inspiration on them.  Whenever she needs strength she calls on those words, along with music lyrics, and each time she does it brings a smile to my face.  Olivia's a bit naive when it comes to sex, a bit unsure of herself because of her past, but it didn't hold her back when it came to Hendrix which made for some very hot scenes with bits of humor too.  I enjoyed watching Olivia gain inner strength as the story progressed and admired her desire to stand on her own but accept help when it was given. Seeing her transformation was like seeing a butterfly emerge from its cocoon and with Hendrix there every step of the way it made for a heartwarming journey to HEA.This was a story that moved quickly when it came to the relationship between Hendrix and Olivia.  With his desire to take care of her though it made sense and showed how big of a heart he really has behind his brooding nature.  The connection between them is sweet, scorching, and crackled with electricity as the sexual tension between them is off the charts.  Though both of them have pasts they're trying to deal with there were very few roadblocks to their HEA. There were no big misunderstandings or outside forces that pulled them apart. Many issues were hinted at, characters that seemed villainous, that were either forgotten about or too quickly and easily wrapped up.  In the romances I read I want my couples to have to work for their HEA and that didn't really happen here.  Despite that small quibble I loved this couple and their sexy yet heartwarming connection.  I enjoyed their playful banter that easily, and almost too often, segued into erotic sexual interludes.  Surrounding this memorable couple were Hendrix's two sexy and supportive brothers Morrison and Jagger. They're both hurting from the past, with very different reactions to it, with Morrison becoming a player (with two women being his usual choice) and for Jagger it's his fists.  They both hide behind a fun loving facade and I look forward to seeing their hidden pain released by finding the woman to ease it. From start to finish it's the characters who drive this story, their interactions charmed me and kept me fully immersed in the lives of the Caldwell brothers and I'm greatly anticipating the next installment!

When it comes to m/m romance, I can always count on Ms. Addams to pile on the intense emotions that pull readers into the action.  She's done it yet again with this third installment in the Tarnished series and its young hero who gets put through the wringer to come out stronger on the other side.  She's crafted an atmospheric tale that has you living and breathing the ups and downs of the times while witnessing the differences between the haves and have nots.  It all makes for a compelling story with a protagonist you can't help rooting for.Picayune was born the child of a whore and his mother never let him forget it. He had a strong will though and smarts which saw him to success as a lawyer after recreating himself as David after years of her physical and mental abuse. All along his journey to betterment he was rewarded for his strong work ethic and good heart through the support of numerous people.  His mother might not love him but he created an unconventional family of his own.  Though he found success in his career love eluded him.  Growing up in the world of prostitution made many jaded when it came to love but not David who was holding out for something real and strong.  It left him lonely quite often and wondering "what could have been" in a twist that ultimately gives him what he's always wanted. David was an admirable character whose rise to success was hard-fought and richly deserved as he rose above his humble beginnings.  He never forget those who once cared for him though, helping those still in that world to find something better in scenes that warmed my heart.Aiding him in his journey to HEA was an intriguing and colorful cast of secondary characters that affected David's life in very different ways.  Growing up it was prostitute Spencer who brought a bit of cheer to Picayune's life and introduced him to the many realities of living in their harsh world.  Theirs was a relationship of love and friendship held back by fate from becoming more until a life-altering event brings them back together in a surprising and cheer-inducing twist. Spencer's a fun and flirty character who always brought a smile to my face for his outspoken comments.  He too went through some very heavy things in life and his road to HEA was another highlight of the story.  David's mentor Emile was another important part of his life as he was always supportive, never wanting anything in return.  He was scared of his sexuality becoming common knowledge which held him back from happiness when it was offered and took the story in a melodramatic turn that felt unnecessary by being what he wasn't. Emile though was a good man who gave David the tools to his HEA and I'm still hoping he finds one for himself.  This was ultimately an intriguing story with compelling characters that fully immersed me in this saga of rags to riches to romance.  Most of the characters were memorable and immensely likable with David's mother being the exception for her nastiness and cliched demands and actions towards the end of the story that added unnecessary drama.  Readers who like historical reads seeped in the language and sights of the times will be drawn to this m/m read and its sensual romance amidst the dramatic recreation of a single life and I applaud Ms. Adamms for her engaging storytelling.

As a fan of sports-themed romances, and the movie The Cutting Edge, this romance captivated me from the first page to the last with its realistic characters and its charming friends to lovers romance.  The ice skating world is vividly depicted with twists and turns regarding which team would go to the Olympics keeping me on the edge of my seat and conflicted as to which team to root for.Courtney came from a middle-class family and had to work to be able to pay for her coaches and costumes.  Her family was emotionally supportive and only concerned about her happiness but it was on her to reach her dream.  With college on the horizon, this was her last chance to make the Olympics with her long-term partner Mark.  Though they work hard they've never achieved the success that was expected of them. To push them to victory, their biggest rivals are made their teammates with fireworks resulting due to personality conflicts, jealousy, and unexpected attraction.  Courtney once had an awkward encounter with Josh, but it's one she's never forgotten.  Facing him every day, and finding a kindred spirit, has them becoming friends and slowly something more. Expectations on the ice, and those off the ice, put pressure on a relationship that's already destined to end with the culmination of their skating careers but if they let it love might win out over familial obligations.  Courtney's immensely likable with her relationship with Mark one of siblings with little hiccups from time to time.  She's a hard worker too and loyal to those she loves.  Her relationship with Josh starts out subtly as she's always seen him as the enemy in their pair's world but quickly finds much to like.  Their romantic journey of friends to lovers is charming to see evolve as both found quiet support in the other, particularly Josh whose family is radically different than him in their beliefs and actions.  Courtney's wise beyond her years with actions that were understandable and mature with each roadblock thrown at her and I was cheering her on every step of the way.Josh comes from a family of wealth with a life planned out since birth.  In every way he's the opposite of Courtney but once they get around each other they start discovering lots of similarities.  He too remembers his teenage encounter with her and has been consumed by "what if" ever since which fuels the fire of their burgeoning relationship.  Josh is extremely likable, talented, and oozes charm.  Though others can't understand why these two opposites are attracted, Josh finds her to be his inspiration and his times with her the only bright spot in a life of severe expectations and judgments that might keep him from his HEA. Josh is sweet and sexy and his interactions with Courtney showed a man of deep convictions and emotions he's not afraid to show and I totally fell in love with him.Ms. Comeaux crafted a compelling story full of charm and angst.  Though the pace was a bit slow, and the story went on a bit too long, I was still kept on the edge of my seat through the twists and turns of competition.  The world of ice skating from practice to competitions was vividly depicted and brought out different sides to the characters, the reality behind the glitz of being on the stage, which made the characters even more intriguing.  The main characters of Courtney and Josh were an entertaining couple with a relationship that kept a smile on my face while I cheered them both on to living the lives they wanted. Equally engaging were the glimpses of Mark along with Josh's sister and skating partner Stephanie. These two skaters were opposites too, but identical in their anger over their partner's relationship, with their interactions crackling and full of sexual tension that I'd love to see dealt with in the next installment.  Throw in issues involving family dynamics and you have a story full of emotional highs and lows that affect these characters on the ice and when it comes to their futures off the ice.  I applaud the author for not taking the expected path when it came to which pair would win as it made for a richer, more believable story. All in all this new to me author crafted a story that pulled at my heartstrings while keeping me on the edge of my seat and I recommend it to those wanting a romance full of charm, sweetness, and believability from the first page to the last.

When it comes to emotionally intense reads Ms. Warren has become my go-to author for her interpretations of a gritty world inhabited by characters both complex and not easily defined.  Her Stripped series has especially captivated me for its darkness and feelings of hopelessness where you're constantly rooting for those few kindhearted souls to survive.Honor (Honey) Moretti was born into a family of wealth, but it was also a family mired in the mafia.  As a young girl she was given everything but freedom, living in a gilded cage alone and feeling unloved.  Her place in the family was one of being a commodity that her father gave to the highest bidder.  Her life of being engaged to a man of power purporting to be a hero was one of physical and sexual degradation, fear, and hopelessness though as everyone knew of her predicament but did nothing to help her.  With her sister's future heading in the same direction she was left with no choice but to run.  Where she ends up at is stripping in a place just as dark and gritty as where she came from and populated with women just as lost as she and working for a man of frightening power and mystery.  She's there to discover secrets about her past and sells her talents to Ivan to earn his protection and knowledge in a complex relationship based on sex and desperation.  Her life is irrevocably changed the day an intense man expresses an interest in her which leaves her emotions in conflict as her heart reawakens to the sensuality and sense of safety he exudes.  Just as a HEA seems possible her past comes back to haunt her and truths about her newfound hero are revealed in a maelstrom of bruises, blood, and bullets.  From the very start Honor is a sympathetic character.  She's cynical about men and love and in some ways is street smart.  When it comes to protecting herself though she's too kindhearted which puts her in constant jeopardy.  It's that kindheartedness, despite all the darkness in her life, that made her an admirable heroine that had me cheering for her to find HEA.Kip is a man of mystery who exudes power and sensuality.  He's drawn to Honey the moment he sees her in a scene that crackles with sexual tension and slowly morphs into something more powerful. Their burgeoning romance was sweet as he spent time getting to know Honor, but there was always a sense of foreboding when they were together.  Theirs is a complex relationship full of attraction amidst a battle of hearts and minds which kept me on edge.  As Kip's past comes to light it further complicates their feelings and puts her life and future in doubt.  Though Kip kept much of his past from Honor he was always there when she needed him, being her savior when all hope was lost.  He's a complex man who was once a criminal but after a stint in the military he's now more dangerous than ever.  He's sexy with moments of sweetness with a talent for erotic talk and action and I found myself drawn to him despite his secrets and dangerous nature.  His familial relations make this story more suspenseful with unexpected twists and turns that further complicate his relationship with Honor and ultimately shows him at his best and worst.  He's definitely a hero but one that is tarnished by fate.This is a dark and highly sexualized story with many of the women in it being abused in one way or another which might make some readers uncomfortable. While these vividly depicted scenes were hard to witness they do pull you in and keep your heart pounding.  Along with Honey, the other women at the strip club are hardened by life and love, with intriguing and painful pasts of their own just starting to be revealed.  They're all strong-willed though under the dubious protection of Ivan and bouncer Blue, with both men appealing despite their intimidating natures.  The world of the strip club is vividly presented in all its smokiness and sex with each character multifaceted which further kept me guessing and on edge.  Kip fits perfectly into this world as he isn't what he seems either.  He's a commanding and protective man whose feelings for Honor leave him confused but their mutual attraction makes for intensely erotic sexual encounters that are sometimes sweet but always scorching.  From start to finish I found myself fully immersed in this story despite a beginning that started a bit slow due to all the twists, turns, blood, and lust surrounding the denizens inhabiting this world full of greys.  It's a depraved world at times, an intense one that I look forward to revisiting in the next installment as each character's earned the right to have a HEA through each bruise to their body and soul.

Taboo romances have become an obsession for me, particularly stepbrother-themed ones, which is what drew me to this tale of soon-to-be stepsiblings who hide their mutual attraction behind snark and anger.  Getting trapped in close quarters though has them seeing a different side to the other allowing them to give into feelings long kept at bay.This story is one of insta-love and is a carefree read that brings a bit of afternoon delight to readers.  It's not groundbreaking but it is fun and flirty with a hero who's a bit of a player and a bit rough around the edges as he makes no excuses for his playboy ways.  Bentley's sexy with a bit of naughty in his nature who quickly embraces his protective side when he and Sierra are in danger.  It was an appealing change that had me rooting for him to finally grow up.  He's always seen Sierra as too perfect, and too judgmental, but their differences led to lots of sexual tension with biting banter that made their sexual interludes even more scorching.Sierra has always seen Bentley in a negative light for his playboy ways, but she's equally fascinated by him and the intense sexuality he exudes.  From the moment the story started, with their battle of the sexes underway, there was a sense of change on the horizon.  Their interactions were tense and teeming with sensuality just waiting to explode which had me on the edge of my seat.  Sierra may think she's different from Bentley when it comes to sex but seeing them together showed a couple who were equal in their intensity with her embracing her naughty side easily.  She may seem cold early on, but being around Bentley brings out her sexy side to add a bit of fun to their sensual interludes.From start to finish this was a fun read with a nice flow.  The character's feelings though weren't dealt with in any depth which kept me from fully immersing myself in their relationship.  The situation they end up in leading to their newfound connection was a bit melodramatic which made their proclamations of love a bit unbelievable.  Ultimately though, those looking for a book to take them away from the stresses of the day will find this a sexy romp with super steamy encounters and a tarnished hero whose charm is infectious.

The bad boys of the Sinner's MC ride again in this exhilarating and fast-paced story of reunited loves and their rocky road to HEA as they struggle to get past years of hurt and misunderstandings.  Ms. Castille brings back all the bikers we've come to know and love and gives us insight into the darkness that has surrounded the quiet yet commanding Zane in a story where you can't help but be captivated by the sexy and loving bad boy with a heart of gold.Zane's childhood was one of severe physical abuse amidst a life of family drug dealing where everyone doubted his ability to make something of himself. Besides his best friend Jagger, the only bright spot in this unhappy time was good girl Evie whom he loved wholeheartedly.  A single event though led to a life-altering night that had him on the run for a crime he didn't commit and his beloved Evie desperate for a savior.  Years passed and hurts and misunderstandings deepened to harden Zane's heart to the girl he once knew until her life is put in jeopardy and his need to always keep her safe resurfaces. Theirs isn't an easy journey to HEA though as Evie's desire to live a safe and quiet life wars with Zane's brotherly feelings and intense loyalty to his Club. Between lots of bullets, blood, and tears these two will wage a super steamy battle over their future that takes a few unexpected turns along the way.  Zane is a strong-willed and intense man.  Despite being hurt by, and lied to regarding her son, Zane easily forgives Evie and takes the guilt over all their wasted years onto himself.  He's caring, sexy, and his interactions with Evie crackled as they engaged in their subtle battle of the sexes.  In the previous installments he was brooding with a laugh seldom seen, but here he's playful and flirty.  Being around Evie and Ty takes him back to a less cynical time that brings out a well-earned smile as his darkness is slowly washed away from bringing truths out into the open.  He's been my obsession since the series started and I fell even harder for him by the end of the story as he's a compelling dichotomy of sweet and sinful.Evie was the first heroine in this series to be unfamiliar with biker life which is part of my issues with her.  Since I adored Zane so much I wanted someone worthy of him and often Evie left me disappointed.  She wanted to live a normal life but often wanted to experience the wildness of her childhood with Zane once again which led her to this series' notorious villain Viper.  Her reasons for being drawn to Viper though seemed to be related to daddy issues and her belief that she could control him.  After Zane left all those years ago she let one man destroy her life and was on the way to doing it again when Zane and she collided in a scene wrought with sexual tension.  Evie was easily led astray with believing the lies Viper told her which was hypocritical and left me disappointed in her.  She assumed things about Zane but didn't give him a chance to explain as she wanted to keep wearing her rose colored glasses.  Though she was protective of her son I still felt she was too weak-willed to be in this world, even though she showed a flash of bravery towards the end.  Ultimately I would've wanted a stronger heroine for Zane, one who didn't spend most of the book wanting him to choose between her or the family that saved him all the years ago.This was an exhilarating story with numerous action scenes balanced with steamy encounters between Zane and Evie which brought out a dominant side in him that made the scenes even hotter.  I loved seeing all the bikers from the previous installments and witnessing their brotherly banter and playful dialogue. I also enjoyed Evie's outspoken, larger than life friend Connie as she brought some much-needed comic relief to some pretty tense situations.  Her comments about bad boy bikers are similar to mine.  This world is portrayed as dangerous but it's not until this book that we lose a well-known character (though I'm not entirely convinced it's for real) and it was a heartbreaking moment.  Ms. Castille included a few twists and turns, notably the evolution of Deputy Benson, that have me intrigued for the future.. Ultimately, despite its frustrating heroine, this was another compelling read in the Sinner's Tribe series which fans of brooding and delicious heroes will devour!

With the popularity of Magic Mike, I'm frustrated there's not more romances featuring flirty and sexy male strippers on the shelves.  Luckily the drought is over with Ms. Huss' latest release introducing us to the charming player with a hidden heart of gold who unexpectedly falls for a woman who always assumes the worst of him and denies the existance of love.  From start to finish it's the sensual and complex Fletcher who holds your attention as there's vastly more substance behind his stylized looks which made for an intriguing unwrapping of the heartfelt layers that combined to make a hero worthy of the title.  I just wish the heroine had been as engaging as Fletcher as he routinely overshadowed Tiffy.  Despite my occasional irritation with Tiffy though this was still an immensely enjoyable read that I hope leads to more stories set in this world as it's teeming with energy, sensuality, and compelling characters.Fletcher Novak seems like a man in control of everything.  He makes a good living dancing in a popular male revue, has numerous moneymaking side businesses, and understands the intricacies of women like no other.  His reputation though isn't perfect as there's a long line of angry women who wanted more than he promised them.  With the future of the hotel where he dances hanging in the balance Tiffy Preston comes to straighten him out but has the tables turned on her unexpectedly as they begin a flirty battle of the sexes that changes his life irrevocably.  Fletcher comes from a family of money who, except for his grandfather, were cold when it came to emotions.  In every way Fletcher is hot, a man who embraces strong emotions, and soon finds himself drawn to Tiffy though he knows the low opinion she has of him.  Under the guise of helping her win the heart of the staid and sturdy man who sees her as a friend, Fletcher spends many hours teaching her the meaning of sexy and the power behind it.  While unleashing her hidden vixen he discovers he wants to know even more about her and show her that he's the man she belongs with which leads to a rocky road to HEA with her insecurities and trust issues putting them and readers through the emotional wringer.  Fletcher's a delightful hero who's loyal to those few who own his heart.  Even after everything Tiffy said about him and did to him, he still had her best interests at heart and protected her from afar.  He has secrets but he never lies, he's honest in everything he does even when others don't want to hear it.  He's smart too which all adds up to a compelling man who had me captivated from the first page to the last.Tiffy's early years were full of doubt, fear, and uncertainties as her mother raised her on her own making ends meet however she could.  It all left Tiffy a bit jaded even after her mother married into wealth.  Upon her mother's death she was left thinking love is a lie and those who rely on sex to make money are without honor.  These preconceived notions have her constantly at war with Fletcher but equally drawn to him.  At every turn he defeats her plans to fire him and his intelligence becomes an even bigger aphrodisiac for her.  Tired of being seen as a friend to her older co-worker Cole she hires Fletcher to teach her how to be sexy and win him over which binds them even closer together as she slowly discovers that her long-held beliefs aren't always true.  Overall I found Tiffy a strong-willed woman but a bit cold and judgemental at times.  She often jumped to conclusions and was slow to hear the truth as she always assumed the worst.  Being with Fletcher though brought out a softer and more carefree side to her that I enjoyed.  All she wanted out of life was safety, which the boring Cole represented, and it saddened me that she was willing to sell out her happiness based on her preconceived beliefs to get it.Fletcher and Tiffy were a formidible couple with a crackling connection and interactions that teemed with sensuality.  Their banter was witty, flirty, and showed their constant battle of the sexes which had me further engrossed in their HEA.  Tiffy was a woman tainted by her past and I felt sympathetic to her pain, but she still frustrated me with her constantly assuming the worst of Fletcher.  By stories end though she was a different person, someone more open and understanding due to the time she spent with him.  The other moments where Tiffy shined were in her interactions with her gay friend Claudio who was supportive but called her out when she was wrong.  Their banter was playful, a bit catty at times too, but always in the name of love.  Claudio was a breath of fresh air and I'd love a novella focused on his burgeoning romance with another dancer.  Fletcher though was the highlight of this story and I quickly became obsessed with him.  He was never what he seemed, he was a smart and sexy multi-faceted man, honest and loyal all wrapped up in a pretty package.  No matter what life threw at him he always came out on top and it's that strong will that made him the perfect match for Tiffy.  Though he too doubted love existed, he was willing to admit when he found it.  From its delicious hero to its sexy storyline Ms. Huss has crafted an exhilarating tale full of steamy encounters and unforgettable characters that I still have on my mind long after the final page was turned.

I'm a reader who's drawn to stories that put characters through the emotional wringer and Ms. Hansen has certainly done that here.  By taking her characters to the lowest depths of despair she builds them back up in a believable way that makes them even stronger and more admirable.  It's a gritty journey they take though, one with lots of tears and lots of regrets, but it's a very worthwhile one that has me ready for more as this unconventional family has more stories to tell.Jeremy once had a happy life married to the love of his life with a baby on the way when tragedy struck sending him in a downward spiral of addiction, anger, and regrets that his long-time friend luckily rescued him from.  His return to the land of the living is an emotionally intense one with each step as painful as the last.  A torrid encounter outside a bar though is the pentultimate moment in his recovery as he and the delicious Kai forge a connection that slowly deepens as both men move beyond their pasts to make a future together.  Jeremy is a compelling character who doesn't always say or do the right thing.  Grief sometimes brings out the worst in him but his lashing out is understandable as the events that befell him were unimaginable.  His journey of healing was easy to relate to as his feelings were vividly depicted with emotions that were palpable.  Through the early stages of his story you could feel the weight of his pain, but meeting Kai brought him a lessening of that weight.  Their connection was crackling outside the bedroom while their sexual encounters were scorching and intense with the battling of demons leading to more sensual encounters later on.Kai's life hasn't been easy either as his teen years were spent running with a gang which led to jail where he was emotionally, physically, and sexually assaulted.  It might've left him bruised but it made him stronger and set him on a path of betterment. He now works with problem youths with the interactions with these kids vividly portrayed and showing his caring side and understanding nature when it comes to abuse.  Kai's an admirable character who hasn't forgotten his roots which gives him a sexy bad boy vibe.  His professionalism in being a teacher also shines through to lend an air of refinement which makes his sexual encounters with Jeremy even hotter for this duality.  Kai's a heroic young man who's supportive and understanding and just what Jeremy needed to heal.From start to finish this is an emotionally intense read with feelings vividly depicted that brings readers along for the journey.  Their pains easily become the readers and it makes for a compelling story that easily immerses you in their battle for a HEA.  Kai is larger than life though he's a quiet and thoughtful man, he's caring and goes out of his way to help others to make him the quintessential hero who rose from the ashes of his painful past.  Jeremy's reactions to the painful events in his life make him a bit less heroic but being with Kai brings out a more kindhearted side to him.  Together they're an intense couple with numerous, almost too numerous, sexual interludes that segued into enlightening talks that gave readers more insight into their pasts.  For Kai, his past is one entwined with closeted cop Loren who's supportive and helped Kai get through what befell him in jail.  Their relationship was sweet, carefree, with playful sexiness that made for some lighthearted moments along with heartfelt talks and I look forward to seeing more of Loren in the next book in this series. Along with an emotional journey to HEA Ms. Hansen also dealt with issues of abuse and problems with troubled teens in a thought provoking way that adds to the story's overall intensity and leaves you thinking beyond the final turn of the page.  It's a story that's well-written, though it goes on a bit longer than necessary and juggles almost too many issues, but is one worth recommending for its powerful emotions and compelling characters.

Readers who love heroes mired in pain and angst, but with a hidden heart of gold, will be drawn to former MMA champion Rory Kavanagh and his burgeoning relationship with the sweet but emotionally scarred Clare.  In a story full of familial love Ms. Robinson also addresses issues surrounding domestic abuse, along with drug and alcohol abuse, in a believable and heartbreaking way that brings the main couple together and puts their newfound feelings to the test as their pasts continually come back to haunt them.  From start to finish readers join them on an emotional rollercoaster ride that leaves us hurting right alongside them while cheering them on to their HEA.Rory was once on top of the world until arrogance left him vulnerable to a career-ending injury that left him lost and mired in pity with alcohol and pain pills his only balm.  He no longer knew what to do with his life and felt like a disappointment with rehabilitating abused former fighting dogs his only joy. One night stands were once enough for him but meeting the sweet and bubbly Clare shows him a path to a new life, one that has him embracing the positives and discovering the power of love he sees in her eyes.  Being with her gives him purpose and the desire to be a better man.  It also brings out a sexy and charming side, a glimpse of a white knight, that's immensely appealing.  Rory's protective of Clare but gives her the tools to become more independent, helps her in the way she's helped him gain the strength to recover fom his past both physically and mentally.  It's not an easy journey that he undertook but an emotionally intense one that brought out many appealing sides to him that have me annoiting him as my latest book boyfriend.Clare lost her family at an early age and ended up falling for a bad man who promised her safety and a feeling of family, but it was all a lie as he was an abusive addict.  He physically and mentally abused her making her doubt everything about herself.  In a moment of bravery though she left it all behind to start a new life doing all she can to regain her self-esteem.  Her newfound life ultimately entangles her with the supportive Kavanagh family, and the equally damaged Rory, with their friendship and caring nature giving her her first taste of family in years and the subtle encouragement to become independent once again.  For the most part I liked Clare.  She had a positive attitude despite everything that happened to her and did everything she could to keep herself safe.  Though she was at first afraid and routinely timid, being with Rory brought out a playful and flirty side that made their burgeoning relationship entertaining to watch strengthen.  The only thing that frustrated me was her not divulging her past to Rory much sooner, along with her acting the martyr despite the pain it causes Rory, which put her and their fragile relationship in jeopardy repeatedly.  Despite that she and Rory were a good match that brought out the best in each other.From start to finish this was a satisfying read that beautifully balanced intense emotions with sensual encounters along with vivid depictions of living the life of an MMA fighter.  The Kavanagh family are a delightful clan with their playful yet heartwarming nature and I enjoyed the glimpses we get of each member that has me excited for more stories featuring Rory's sexy brothers.  While Clare was an admirable heroine it was Rory who held me captivated with his charming and sexy attitude and his painful journey of recovery.  Ms. Robinson's depiction of animal rescue further showed his kind heart and made his dog Ace another highlight of the story with his good judge of character and heroics.  The sensual interludes too were nicely spaced throughout the story and were hot as well as playful and showed Rory to be both caring and commanding.  While the story does go on a bit longer than necessary it all leads to a satisfying and richly rewarding conclusion that shows the true power of love.

Fans of the older woman/younger man theme will want to add this to their list of enjoyable reads with its likable characters and steamy encounters.  It's a pleasant read, set mainly in an exotic locale, that charmed me even as it addressed the familiar issues surrounding this favorite theme of mine.Janie's on vacation after signing divorce papers from a husband who cheated on her with a younger woman.  For twenty years she devoted herself to her family, never going after what she wanted.  Coming to an island full of sun and surf has her vowing to relax and decide what she wants out of her new life.  Meeting the sexy and younger Zade helps her embrace the fun life has to offer and has her seeing herself in a whole new light, a womanly light where her vibrancy calls to him.  Though she has concerns over their age difference she can't deny how supportive he is of her, how good he makes her feel, and how much richer life is when he's in it.  With their time on the island coming to and end will she go with her heart or let other's preconceived notions take away the other half to her soul that Zade's become.  Janie's a strong-willed woman who's not as bitter as most divorcees as she can admit she's excited by this recent change in her life. She's a bit leery of Zade at first but their crackling connection soon wins her over.  Her concerns about age are understandable but an altercation towards the end of the story felt a bit manipulative and overly dramatic and left me disappointed in Janie.Zade may be young but he's wiser in years than most young men his age which will come in handy as he has to use every ounce of charm to win over Janie. It's a fortuitous meeting between two apparent opposites as he too is on the island to reassess his life.  Before now he's never had trouble getting women but Janie's initial low self-esteem has her leading him on a merry chase and him using charm, sexiness, and playfulness to win her over.  Zade's the quintessential hero as he says and does everything right.  He compliments Janie at every turn, supports her and inspires her to live life wholeheartedly.  Through his artistic talent he shows her her true self-worth even as she lets his age blind her to the truth of their feelings for each other.  He's sweet, sexy, and caring and you can't help but fall for him.This was an enjoyable read with a delightful hero and admirable heroine.  The setting is exotic and romantic and helped bring these two people together through fun and flirty encounters.  The sexual interludes were scorching at first and got even more fiery and frantic as their time together came to an end.  The issues surrounding their age difference are familiar and dealt with in a mostly believable manner with the final confrontation feeling a bit over the top.  The ending too was wrapped up a bit too quickly as I wanted Janie to be the one to chase after Zade for a change.  On a whole though this was a fun and flirty read with a drool-worthy hero that's still invading my dreams and I recommend it as a decadent diversion to the stresses of the day.

As someone who's read numerous romances between a girl and her brother's best friend I was immediately drawn to the premise of this book.  I expected the usual issues to arise within the pages but Ms. Jackson set her romance apart with likable characters and a charming and straight-forward storyline.  It's ultimately a story about forgiveness and second chances too with enough flashbacks to give depth to the characters and believability to their connection.Cameron knew he did wrong the moment he slept with his best friend's sister. Instead of dealing with it head-on though, he ran.  Ten years and he can run no longer and it's an awkward reunion he has with the girl he's never forgotten as this time around he vows to make her his permanently.  Cameron was immensely appealing despite his earlier vanishing act.  He's grown older and wiser and knows what he wants this time around.  He won't waste time waiting for Dylan anymore and it's a sweet yet sexy onslaught he unleashes on her.Dylan was once in love with Cameron which is why she was heartbroken when he left.  Ten years later has her older and wiser too, along with fiery and strong-willed when focused on her career.  Seeing Cameron again reawakens the feelings for him that she's kept buried but she won't be won over as easily this time around.  Dylan was smart and confident and gave as good as she got when it came to their sensual tug of war.Theirs is a connection that's crackling with sensual yet playful encounters.  Their dialogue was fun and flirty and teeming with sexual tension.  Neither of them obsessed over the past as they're clearly more focused on their future.  There's no silly disagreements impeding their HEA either which was a refreshing change from these usual romantic entanglements.  Ultimately this was a pleasant diversion over way too soon.  From start to finish this was a charming yet decadently delightful read between two likable people and I commend Ms. Jackson on her entertaining storytelling!

As a reader, and an older woman myself, I was drawn to this older woman/younger man theme and charmed from the first page to the last thanks to a sweet and sexy hero and strong-willed heroine.  Though there's a bit of familiarity to the overall storyline it was a feeling of comfort that surrounded me and made this an immensely enjoyable read.  It may be the sixth installment in the Time for Love series but stands strongly on its own due to the compelling and likable secondary characters, engaging dialogue, and its sweet and sensual romance.  After reading this I definitely plan on starting the series from the beginning as the glimpses of past characters has me dying to know their stories and excited for what the future brings to the new characters as well.Bronagh's a confident woman moving on from a recent divorce, talented and doing what she loves in teaching culinary school.  What better way to move on than the sexy younger man rockin' it out on stage.  After a scorching night together they both know they want more but real life invades with issues that could tear them apart before they've barely begun.  Bronagh's a strong-willed woman who knows that her biological clock is ticking and doubts Brendan's ready to commit.  She also worries about the perceived improprieties of being his teacher.  These issues are understandable and addressed in a believable way that's the first hint at the maturity of Brendan beyond his years that gives you hope that they can have a HEA.  I liked Bronagh wholeheartedly as she's smart, funny, with a zest for living.  Her interactions with her girlfriends were an added bonus that brought forth more humor and had me identifying even more with her.  Their interactions were supportive and brought a smile to my face as they're the kind of friends you want for yourself.Brendan's another new addition to my list of book boyfriends as he's sweet, sexy, and oozes charm.  Once he sees Bronagh he knows he has to have her and is single-minded in his pursuit of her.  He's talented too with his culinary and musical skills which made him a favorite amongst the ladies.  He only had eyes for Bronagh though and I enjoyed their sensual tango.  On a whole he's a hard man to resist and Bronagh thankfully doesn't put up much of a fight as their connection is crackling and teems with sexual tension.  Brendan may be young in years but he knows what and who he wants out of life which had me cheering him on from the moment I saw him. His interactions with his brothers was equally entertaining as that of Bronagh and her friends with their playful and chiding banter which further charmed me and left me wanting to see more of his brothers.From start to finish this story held me captivated with its sweet and sexy romance, immensely appealing main and secondary characters, and realistic yet familiar storyline.  The romance too was sensual as Brendan showed even more talents in the bedroom.  Theirs is a romance that was scorching yet sweet that didn't gloss over the age difference but dealt with it head-on with their families having a vested interest as well.  It all made for a fun and flirty read with promises of more to come.  This was my first time reading Ms. Lopez but won't be the last as I enjoyed the family and friend dynamics she lovingly crafted which is just one of many reasons to recommend this book and series!

As a reader who's accumulated numerous book boyfriends, I can now add Lincoln Greene to the list in this sweet, sensual, and heartwarming series starter.  From start to finish Ms. Van Dyken pulls you into this story of love, loss, and acceptance that will put you through the emotional wringer alongside its compelling and likable characters.Dani once had the picture perfect teenager's life until the death of her parents left her life in darkness.  Guilt, sadness, and loss may have taken her voice but it's left her with a wonderful support system who stand by her no matter what. Into her predictable world comes the unpredictable movie star who uses all his charms to coax her back into living.  Dani was an immensely likable heroine clearly bruised by her parent's deaths.  She knows her response isn't normal, which frustrates her, but can't get past her loss.  She's lost her sense of purpose, but with Lincoln dragging her into the land of the living without wearing kid's gloves, there's hope for her.  She's ultimately stronger than she thought herself capable of and full of sass and witty comebacks which made her interactions with Lincoln fun to watch.From the very start Lincoln isn't your average movie star.  He's not at all arrogant but self-depricating and immensely likable.  He was a charmer who exuded confidence that belied a painful past of his own.  He knew Dani was different when she became his assistant but didn't count on the profound affect they'd have on each other as their playful interactions became more meaningful. Lincoln was sweet yet sexy, never coddling Dani but taking care with her heart, while showing her the beauty in living.  Though his own parents weren't overly loving he knew the meaning and importance of love and slowly bestowed it onto Dani.  Their interactions were sweet, witty, and playful which made their road to romance all the more rewarding.This was a series starter spun-off from another of Ms. Van Dyken's series which reunites us with familiar characters and introduces us to new ones.  Though this book can stand on its own, reading about these familiar characters will immerse you even more in this tale and the denizens of this charming town.  It offers a unique love story between two people full of heartwarming moments and fun and flirty banter.  With their early interactions of texting showing a burgeoning friendship to the covert and sensual longing that soon follows through words and deeds, theirs is a romance that left me cheering.  Readers will be charmed by, and fall in love with, this intensely emotional story and I look forward to returning to this lovingly crafted world.

Every few months there seems to be a taboo topic that romance authors become obsessed with and that overtakes the bookshelves.  Right now the topic is that of stepbrothers and they've become my obsession too for the intensely emotional conflict that befalls those involved and the scorching interludes resulting from all that desperation.Into this crowded genre Ms. Adams has crafted a familiar tale that still satisfies as her sexual interludes leave you parched.  The main characters are appealing as well as their bond grows from friends to so much more.  Mia's the girl more comfortable hanging with the boys who's found a place for herself amongst the Phi Kappa Alpha frat boys.  They treat her like one of the guys and she blossoms in their companionship until Jaxon's attentions become more sensual. She's always found him attractive but never wanted to ruin her relationship with the other brothers, but giving in never felt so good...until the next morning. Finding out the sexy guy you just slept with is now your new stepbrother throws both of them for a loop and leads to lots of heartache.  For Mia, it leads to endless doubts and obsession over what was and what she knows can never be. It's a frustrating time full of disappointed and angry parents, as well as loneliness and feelings of lost dreams.  Will Mia and Jaxon's love ultimately triumph over familial judgments or will Mia find the strength to stand up for Jaxon and their future?  Mia's a likable heroine, sporty and unconcerned with girly things. She's athletic and it's this that binds her and Jaxon together early on as she becomes a formidable match for him.Jaxon's well-liked by everyone and popular with the girls.  His attentions to Mia start out playful but soon become more intense.  Finding out they're now related threw him for a loop that left her alienated but it was a reflection of the fractured relationship he has with his father.  His father continually holds his difficult teen years against him and Jaxon fully expects his father to tear apart his feelings for Mia.  It's a desperate time of anger and sexual tension that was palpable as Mia and Jaxon tried to ignore their attraction.  Through it all Jaxon remained steadfast in his feelings as Mia desperately tries to go back into the friend zone which had me admiring him.  I ached for him as his father's vitriolic words tore at him repeatedly and desperately wanted him to find happiness. Even if that happiness couldn't be found at home there were his supportive and fun-loving brothers cheering him and Mia on.This was a story full of scorching sexual interludes, almost too many that started to feel similar.  At times it felt like an obsession for them, and the main basis for their being together, but luckily the vividly depicted snowboarding events brought them together outside the bedroom more intimately.  The overall flow of the story was good but Mia's inner dialogues of wanting Jaxon but knowing they could never be became a bit repetitive.  The main characters were likable with a sizzling connection and I was rooting for them every step of the way.  As secondary characters I liked the other frat brothers but found Jaxon's father a cliched villain and a bit over the top in his words and attitude. While the ending was a bit too easily wrapped up with Mia's confrontation with their parents it all still made for a super sexy, deliciously naughty, and satisfying tale.

Life in The Point continues to emit danger as the line between good and bad and black and white remains blurred and as new villains arise as old ones fall.  It's a suspenseful read full of redemption, revenge, and unconditional support when it's least expected that adds to the romance brewing between two people from opposite sides of the law.  It all combines to make for a story, and series, that keeps you on the edge of your seat through the compelling twists and turns that befall the desperate and memorable denizens of The Point.Reeve has spent many years trying to live with the guilt that a vengeful choice left her with, but when given the chance to right so many wrongs she runs back to the hell she left behind.  Chasing her, and reaping his own revenge for surprising reasons, is a sociopathic man who leaves a bloody trail behind him as others seek their own revenge on him for all the horrors he's inflicted.  She's a tough and strong-willed woman who knows she's not good but wants to do better as she grows closer to the only man to really understand her.  As she and Detective Titus King play a dangerous and sexy game to bring the bad guy out of hiding, more bodies hit the ground as those closest to them are left battered and bloody too.  As their connection grows truths about their pasts come to light that proves they're a perfect match full of grays doing whatever necessary to protect the town they both care about.  That connection makes them a formidable duo that will make the villain rue the day he challenged them all.  I admired Reeve as she never sugar-coated her faults.  She knew she'd done wrong and wanted to make amends no matter what the consequences were to herself.  She'd always been attracted to Titus and their plan gave her the chance to grow closer to him and the dark sides of himself he keeps carefully contained.  Their relationship may have started off as one based on love/hate but soon grew to one of acceptance, redemption, and admiration.Titus has always wanted better for himself which led to his leaving his brother behind in a world full of rot, decay, and preservation by any means necessary. He too is desperate to make amends which has him fighting an unending war against criminals which leaves him conflicted as many of those he cares about skirt the role of criminal.  It's a fight that's wearing him out though and that's left him lonely.  The only woman to make him feel alive is a woman full of demons who brings out his wild side but might be his downfall too.  Together they scorch up the sheets in a sensual game that might get them killed in the end.  Titus is an admirable hero sworn to uphold the law.  He's a truly good man who knows he's not perfect but does the best he can for those he loves based on a moral code of his own making.  He and Reeve are combustible together and I loved watching their relationship strengthen through their acceptance of each other's pasts.This was a sensual story full of suspenseful moments that kept me on the edge of my seat.  From its heart-pounding prologue to its exhilarating conclusion this book left me in knots as numerous twists and turns were revealed throughout the story.  I was drawn to the main characters and their crackling connection that was teeming with sexual tension and seen through their steamy encounters that allowed Titus to let go of the tight control he kept on himself out of shame. I enjoyed seeing past characters return too and the important parts they played in this madman's revenge.  All of them are just trying to survive and I was drawn to the close-knit family they've all become.  I look forward to more stories coming from this gritty and compelling world after seeing the frustration of Nassir, the dangerous longing of Keelyn, the nerdy Stark, and the conflicted Booker who's falling for a good girl despite himself.  Ms. Crownover continues to leave me in awe as she beautifully blends romance with raw emotions in a realistically dangerous world that will keep you coming back for more!

As a reader who enjoys emotionally intense reads, this one had that in spades. From its heroine who's been put through the wringer to the friends and family equally tortured by her poor choices and painful past, there's a constant feeling of foreboding and frustration that kept me turning the pages.  Add in two powerful men that treat Paige like a bone to battle over and you end up with a compelling read that keeps you on edge.  Though there's a HFN conclusion readers can expect more from Paige as she has a lot of healing to do and a past that's come back to haunt her leaving her HEA in flux.Paige is a young woman who has a tough exterior but is torn up inside after a painful incident hinted at but not revealed until the latter half of the story. She's thrown herself into work, exercise, and sports hoping to keep her demons at bay but they're slowly eating her up.  She may cuss like a sailor and give off a badass vibe but inside she's still a little girl with daddy issues that are the root of many of her problems.  Meeting the dangerous and mysterious Vance awakens her libido while meeting Matt awakens her heart as he provides her with unconditional support.  Being torn between two men harms her recovery even more but she can't help herself as they both call to her.  Even after her decision is made there's still doubts radiating off her and with past secrets coming to light she'll have even more doubts.  Paige left me conflicted as I applaud her putting her past behind her, but it's obvious she's still hiding from it as seen by her poor choices in romance and in her life.  She lets herself be dominated but demands control which reflected a wishy-washy nature.Vance and Matt are both larger than life characters with power and money to burn.  Vance is controlling while Matt is sweet and easier to talk to.  Vance is teeming with danger as he's not above using his power to crush others.  Matt's more likely to apologize for being overbearing whereas Vance doesn't know the meaning of sorry and relishes using his power to get what he wants.  Vance doesn't take no for an answer while Matt's willing to wait as long as Paige needs.  They're both intensely sexual though, teeming with sensuality, with both having crackling chemistry with Paige as seen by their steamy encounters with her.  Ultimately they're both compelling and I can understand being torn between them.Along with a memorable main cast of characters comes an equally appealing cast of secondary ones.  From Paige's brother Mark to his friend Danny, Paige has a caring support system who have problems of their own just hinted at. They're both sexy and would do anything for Paige, but aren't oblivious to her needing to get help when her pain starts taking over her life.  Their friendship's left hanging due to Paige's past coming to light and I hope to see more of them. This was a sexy story with a good flow.  The ending had many things come to light that threw Paige's life into chaos, a few surprising (not to me though) twists that greatly affected the course of her life throughout the story.  It all makes for an engaging tale that I couldn't put down despite my frustrations with the heroine and that will leave readers thinking long after The End.

Into the crowded genre of rock star romances comes this gem of a series that beautifully balances likable and realistic characters with the chaotic and sensual world of music.  Add in a compelling main storyline along with engaging secondary ones and you end up with a story you never want to end.  Ms. Shaw shows true talent with this series that continues to shine and at the conclusion of this story I'm already counting down the days until the next installment.Kit is the lone girl in a family of strong men whose protectiveness borders on smothering.  Each brother is loving with interactions that are sweet, playful and heartwarming but leave her frustrated as she wants to live her life by her own rules.  This family dynamic was immensely appealing and led to one of my favorite secondary storylines of Kit's twin brother Kale hiding his homosexuality and being attracted to a new friend of Kit's who's everything Kale wishes he was.  Kit and Kale are so supportive of each other and are always watchful of the other's hearts and dreams which Kit will need as she joins a band on the brink of stardom.  Though she longs to take this crazy ride she knows her heart will be in jeopardy as one of the guitarists is the man she's had a crush on since she was a teen and who she gave her virginity to.  That life-altering moment left her heart bruised as he never called her again but she won't let it stand in her way of being a guitarist with a successful band.  She always knew she was meant for something bigger and this is her chance.  Being around Shawn brings out a myriad of emotions in her, some heartbreaking and some juvenile, as he constantly shakes her self-esteem.  These moments of juvenile behavior sometimes frustrated me as everything would've been resolved much sooner if she'd just spoken of her feelings out loud instead of always waiting on him. Through it all though she remains a strong-willed woman in a man's world who gives as good as she gets and whose witty and flirty banter made her even more of a badass rocker!Shawn has always been popular with the ladies but music is what holds his heart.  One fateful night he meets a girl who names him as the reason she became a guitarist which made for an instantaneous connection that never truly went away despite his ruining the memory through his unintentional callousness.  With Kit joining the band emotional complications arise as she brings out the best and the worst in him.  He's the creative one in the band, the one who writes the lyrics and crafts the music, and collaborating with Kit makes their songs masterful.  Since their first meeting the sexual tension between them is off the charts and though they start off as friends it's clear they're destined to be more.  It's a rocky journey though as he's better at writing about emotions than acting on them out loud.  There's lots of hurt feelings and lingering anger over the past, but unlikely allies help him right past wrongs to reach an immensely satisfying HEA.  Through it all I found myself drawn to Shawn and his sweet yet charming nature.  He might not always make the right choice but his heart is always in the right place.This was a delightful read from start to finish with memorable main characters and equally engaging secondary ones.  The secondary characters are some we know and love along with a few new ones whose stories I long to hear.  Each character though feels like family with interactions that brought a tear to my eye as well as a smile to my face.  Shawn and Kit are combustible as even when they're apart you can still feel their crackling connection.  Kit's my favorite kind of heroine with her tell it like it is attitude and the unconditional support she gives to those she loves.  Shawn's strong and sexy and not afraid to show his softer side that's an appealing dichotomy to his bad boy rocker persona.  The rock 'n roll world is vividly depicted with all its sensuality and energy and these scenes immersed me in the story even further.  While this book can definitely stand on its own, with such likable characters and engaging storylines you won't want to miss a single moment.  Ms. Shaw's Mayhem series continues to impress with its engaging characters and storytelling and I recommend it highly to those looking for a memorable read that you'll be thinking about long after the final page is turned!

After all the action and premise set-up in the previous series installment things continue along the same vein with this novella.  The story continues to excite as the pages combust with a menage relationship that's super steamy and shows how far the heroine has come in healing after the atrocities dealt her by those who prey on a world gone crazy.  With two strong heroes to support her a HEA is guaranteed as we get to know more about these former soldiers and the safe haven they've created.Lia was once mired in darkness after the brutalizations done to her in Flash Bang.  Through the sensitivity and caring attentions of two very different men Lia sees a hint of brightness as she no longer jumps when encountering men nor finds herself haunted by nightmares.  She finally feels like the woman she was before the world ended and finally wants to admit her attraction to Cam and Travis.  It's not an easy decision for those involved but with the world in flux personal judgments no longer matter.  Lia's an admirable heroine whose journey to recovery was palpable with feelings of fear and self-doubt.  I applaud her owning her decision as to wanting both men and for not letting them make decisions for her anymore once she's found herself again.Cam and Travis are a formidable pair, best friends since the military.  Their personalities may be different but together they meet all of Lia's needs both sexually and emotionally.  Cam was the more serious of the two and the one with issues of possessiveness that made him the hardest to convince when it came to sharing. Travis was more playful and easygoing, easily accepting of sharing as he was focused on Lia's needs.
