At night, all it takes it to turn on the lights and not even 5 seconds later, it's ready.The digital display is large enough and backlit so even without my glasses my old eyes don't struggle, and the clean lines and low profile of this allow it to be unobtrusive no matter where it's kept.My only complaint is that the sleek glass platform does show footprints.  I'm a bit compulsive about this, so I've started laying a hand towel on the scale first, then stepping on the towel.  The fact that this may add an ounce or two doesn't really matter since as long as I do this every time I weigh myself, this won't affect consistency.

Completely love this item.We'd been using the Rabbit Aerator, and although this does a very nice job, it was tedious to have to wash the aerator after each use then use a stopper to cork the bottle to preserve what's left (I know, the easy solution would be to drink the entire bottle).Not only does this Spirit Aerator do a super job aerating, but it forms a tight seal to keep the wine stable till we finish it the next evening.The pour is smooth, drip-free and the device fits tightly on both corked and screw top bottles.  The fact that it is aesthetically clean and nice is an added plus - - - form and function!

Very nice grinding mechanism, adjustable coarseness, perfect size and nice, comfortable heft and weight.My one criticism  however, is also about something I like - - -There is a removable bottom plate that holds about a tsp and allows the grounds to be contained.  This is a nice feature, as you can pre-grind a nice spoonful, pull off the bottom, then either sprinkle directly from the bottom cover, or empty and measure out a specific amount.  It's also nice that when not in use, residual grounds don't filter out onto the stove or counter top.My only complaint about this removable bottom, is that it's a bit tedious to remove.  I typically just use my nail to pry it off (it's not super tight), but my husband with fat fingers and short nails will have to go grab a spoon or knife.  If my hands are dry, I can sometimes manage to grip the thin bottom and wiggle it loose, but how often are your hands dry when cooking?Overall though, still a nice 5 stars for a compact, sturdy and very attractive mill.

Strong magnet hold, keeps sponge off the floor of the sink and hidden from view.The magnets are super strong and I see no reason to have to use the adhesive.  Without the adhesive, the holder is infinitely movable and once it's in place, you can even make minor adjustments just by slowly sliding the holder around on the inside of the sink - - - the back magnet will just follow it around.The u-shaped holder was a bit large and loose, so all I did was gently squeeze it so my sponge fits a bit more tightly and doesn't tend to slip out as easily.This, along with the cloth holder are two of my favorite things in my new kitchen.  My husband says "what, we just spent $$$ on a new kitchen and these two $50 items are your favorite !?!?".  My point however is, you can spend to the moon on a new kitchen, but it won't look worth a dime if dirty rags and sponges are in view.I also tested the magnets for use on/through a cabinet door, and on the side of a cabinet frame.  No success - - wood is too dense.

If using this behind a tv or other object which will permanently hide this outlet box, then this is a great idea and great item.  The "wings" on the box allow for easy retrofit in existing construction.Please realize though, if using these anywhere that they'll be visible, these boxes are very plastic-y and cheap looking.  The face plate is not smooth and finished like usual outlet covers.  There are 8 screws and holes on the front - - necessary because half of them are for the installation wings, and the other 4 are for attaching the face plate to the box - - but all these screws and holes on the front are very, very unattractive.I ended up returning all these items because I ordered them for use in my newly remodeled kitchen.  I planned on using it behind my toaster oven and coffee maker so the plugs would be recessed and I could push the appliances flush up against the wall.  The outlet would still be visible however, and I just couldn't bring myself to have these tacky and cheapy looking outlets in my new and sleek kitchen.Cooper makes a single gang recessed outlet box which is finished very nicely, but I was looking for a 2 gang box which could accommodate larger chunky plugs.To date, despite hours of searching online and consulting with contractors and hardware store workers, I have yet to find an attractive double gang recessed outlet box.  No such thing exists.I ended up using the Cooper single gang recessed (http://smile.amazon.com/Cooper-Wiring-Devices-TR780W-BOX-Receptacle/dp/B007UNHI28/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1443318314&sr=8-1&keywords=cooper+recessed+outlet), and just living with the chunk plugs in typical flush outlets.(* * If looking at the Cooper, realize that this Arlington allows you to use any amp, or GFCI but the Cooper outlet is fixed in the box and does not allow any interchanging.)

First of all, this is a wonderful, clean, strong and genius idea for keeping unsightly necessities out of sight.  I purchased two of these -- one for my rag, and the other for my dishwashing gloves.The magnet is strong, yet allows for adjustments and changing your mind as to placement.  These magnets are so strong, I'm not even using the adhesive backing on the back magnet. In fact, once in place without the adhesive, it's possible to make adjustments by slowly wiggling the sink half of the magnet - - - the undersink magnet will follow.  I love how the bar itself, swivels and also lifts off the magnet base.This makes for very easy cleaning and wiping of the sink walls.  I keep the bar and the rag flush against the sink to keep it out of sight during the day, but swing it out at night to allow for max airflow around the rag overnight - - - completely dry in the morning and no more stinky damp rags.A couple of tips:- I asked users about the possibility of using this through wood (on the side of a cabinet).  No one knew for certain, but the consensus seemed to be "no".  They were right.  Although you can feel a slight "attraction" through the side cabinet panel, there was not enough strength to hold up the bar itself, let alone hold the weight of even a small towel.- I purchased this for a light remodel replacing counter tops and also changing out our old enameled cast iron sink with a stainless steel sink.  The cloth holder obviously works perfectly with our new stainless sink, but surprisingly, it worked by itself (without the back magnet) with our old enameled sink.  If I had given it a minute of thought, I would have realized the old sink is enamel over cast iron, so duh . . . of course it would work.But . . . for anyone else out there who may not have thought this through, be pleasantly surprised that if using in a cast iron sink, you won't even need to place the second backing magnet - - - it works without it.Absolutely love this, as well as the sponge holder I also purchased.  Clean lines and items out of sight!

My dad likes it ... My cat LOVES it!Purchased this for my dad who has a tailbone injury.  Although he likes it for use on softer surfaces like on the sofa or his lounge chair, he prefers the Cushy Cloud coccyx cushion (https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00NHYT36I/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1)to use in his wheelchair, in the car, and on other firmer seats.My cat however, absolutely loves this.  Her legs and tail fit perfectly in the channels of the cushion and  she actually aligns herself so all her legs and her tail have their own slot.  Additionally, because her weight (10#) isn't enough to smash the peaks, we think she probably gets some sort of massage or acupressure sensation from it.  We notice she will settle down on it, then roll her head, shift her body and purr like she's getting a massage.If my dad is sitting on it, she will jump on the armrest and stare at him until guilt takes over and he gives her the cushion.  Have since ordered a second one so there's no more competition.

Using to create two levels for stacking coffee cups in upper cabinets.These are sturdy, strong and stable.What I especially like about these, is that the shelving is a perforated metal material.  The typical vinyl coated racks have a grid that is spaced fairly wide.  For dishes, that's fine ... but any items with a smaller base (like cups, glassware or spice jars) tend to tip or topple.  This flat and stable shelf does not create that problem and is wonderfully solid.The small perforated holes still allow for airflow, if that's a concern.My upper cabinets are standard depth, and both these racks fit perfectly.  They are slightly shallower than the depth of the cabinet which makes perfect sense because it allows this top shelf to sit slightly offset from the items stored below.  This means no bumping your hand on the top rack when reaching in for something below it.On an aesthetic note, I have white dishware in white cabinets and the matte silver color of these racks are subtle and understated.Specifics to note: These are two separate racks in two slightly different sizes. They are fixed in size and do not literally expand in any way except that you can nest one under the other.  If you pull the bottom one out, I guess that would "expand" the usable surface area, except that the surface area would not be at the same height.They come fully assembled and the legs have rubber tips on them (comes w/ a bag of several extras too) to prevent scratching your cabinets.

My aviator (womens) style sunglasses were too large for a flatter style case.  They fit nicely in a soft sided case, but I wanted something that provided more smash protection while in my purse.This case fits my glasses perfectly.The case feels sturdy, and the included pouch and lens cloth are a nice bonus too.

Purchased this for my 86 yr old dad who came out of an extended hospital stay very weak and unstable. He is 5'6" and the fixed seat height, adjustable seat back and handles perfectly suit him.Although this is a bit more expensive than some other models we looked at, there were several reasons we chose this over the others.Pros:- It folds side-to-side rather than front-to-back.  This allows you to fold it to a narrower width to go through a narrow doorway.  It also means that even when it's completely folded closed, it is still standing on 4 wheels and will stand on its' own (no need to find a wall to lean it up against).My dad will go on walks with my mom and primarily uses only a cane.  They take this rollator along on their walks, so when/if he tires and needs to sit and rest, they will always have a seat available.  They take this along with them in its' folded position.  My mom rolls it alongside her as she walks - - holding onto the seat frame (instead of one handle) makes for easier steering alongside.- The zippered pouch behind the seat is surprisingly handy.  Throw in a bottle of water, light jacket, hat . . . my dad doesn't have a purse, but when my mom's with him, she sticks her purse in the pouch too.- A cinch to assemble.  One person, 15 minutes, done.- Lightweight.  Had to be lightweight enough that either my 86 yr old dad, or 81 yr old mom could comfortably fold, open, maneuver, load in/out of their car.- The included cane holder attaches to the side of the rollator, and is also surprisingly handy.- Curb lever on both back wheels allows easy transition up a curb without lifting - - step on the lever, pull back on the handles and the front wheels raise to step up on the curb.Cons:- Just my personal preference, but I wish the "Drive" logo that's embroidered on the backrest wasn't so large and noticeable.  Nurses, doctors, physical therapists at the rehab center, and perfect strangers have all approached dad to ask about it.  Trust me, this rollator is unique enough and we've gotten enough people come up to us to ask about it, that a large advertisement logo on the backrest isn't necessary.- Unlike the Nitro model, these brake cables are external (rather than integrated into the frame).  We chose this model purely for aesthetic reasons, as we liked this color combo.  Quite honestly, these external cables wrap and tuck themselves around the frame so well, the fact that they are external is not an issue at all. They don't stick out and there is no danger that they'll catch or snag on things at all.In summary, great purchase, safe, sturdy and very helpful aide in dad's recovery.

Not sure about the chemical properties of the actual cleaning and disinfecting ability of this cleaner, but it smells divine!  I'm not using it to disinfect nuclear spills or hazardous waste - - - for using to clean up drips and spills on my kitchen counter, it does the trick and leaves behind a beautiful and fresh aroma!

Nothing fancy about this small-ish size tv, but the picture is crystal clear, the sound is great considering we have no external speakers hooked up, and set up was truly plug and play.We've placed this in a cabinet in the kitchen so we can watch the morning news while sitting at the breakfast bar.  For our location, it fits perfectly and suits our needs ideally.  We couldn't be happier!

This is the only plug in motion sensor light fixture I could find that uses standard or fluorescent bulbs.  I mounted it in the garage and wanted to plug it into the ceiling outlet that the garage door opener is plugged into.  There is no junction box on the ceiling, so that's why it was necessary to find a corded fixture.Too bad this fixture doesn't work as it's supposed to.Motion sensor triggers with movement as it should, but the light stays on less than 15 seconds no matter which setting you have it on.  There is a choice of test mode, 1 minute, 5 minutes or 10 minutes . . . no matter which setting it's on, the light goes out after 15 seconds.Returned it, then had an idea . . . could I retro-fit a hardwired fixture with a plug in cord?I went to Lowes, asked for some guidance, and bought a basic, regular hard-wired motion sensor floodlight, and a 16 gauge replacement cord.Items are similar to these:http://smile.amazon.com/Dewalt-DW540-DW704-Dw705-Power/dp/B00NVDUQZC/ref=sr_1_5?ie=UTF8&qid=1420592056&sr=8-5&keywords=16+gauge+replacement+cordhttp://www.lowes.com/pd_182199-85538-SH-5412-WH-A_0__?productId=50236473&Ntt=motion+sensor+flood+lights&pl=1&currentURL=%3FNtt%3Dmotion%2Bsensor%2Bflood%2Blights&facetInfo=The only thing that posed a few minutes of head scratching, was how to mount it with no junction box.  The wired fixture that I returned, came with a mounting plate, but this hard-wired fixture is meant to be screwed directly into a junction box mounting bracket.I improvised and screwed the mounting bracket directly into the ceiling, then mounted the fixture to the bracket as instructed.  I also needed to drill a center hole in the drywall ceiling to accommodate the extra length of the machine screw going through the mounting bracket.Voila - - works perfectly and looks great - - - doesn't look at all like a Frankenstein hack.Even the guy at Lowe's wondered why there aren't more plug-in versions of this kind of light.  He actually thanked me for having this idea cause he said he'll sound like a genius the next time he can suggest this hack to another customer.

If you are buying to use to make ice cubes, you may want to think twice, as this is very small and would only provide enough ice for possibly 2 beverages - - - a waste of time for that purpose.However, for my purposes, it is perfect.  Each cube is almost exactly one teaspoon in volume.  I freeze grated ginger, tomato paste, chopped garlic and chopped fresh herbs.  After freezing, I pop out of the tray and into ziplock freezer bags to have handy whenever I need for cooking.I started with one tray for garlic however, after trying everything I can think of to try to get the smell out, I ended up buying 2 more.  I have labeled one tray for garlic, one for ginger, and the other one I use interchangeably for tomato paste and spices.I am a huge fan of using these trays - - - the tsp size is versatile, the cubes pop out easily, and except for holding onto the aroma of what's been frozen in it, it washes and cleans up very easily.

We'd been using a normal collar and leash for our indoor cat whenever we let her come outside with us on our back deck.  She's very comfortable wearing a collar, and we didn't have any concerns until she managed to squeeze under the deck and slide a couple feet to the dirt below.  That wouldn't have been of concern, except that the leash didn't reach the entire way.Luckily, the leash was only a few inches too short and she was able to stand on her back legs until we could reach her.  We saw it happen, so we reacted immediately.That scare is what prompted us to shop for a harness.This harness has been working perfectly for us.  Both neck and waist straps are easily adjustable and the extra strap around her stomach doesn't seemed to bother her at all.  I think, the fact that this does not have anything that sits on her chest, is what makes it comfortable for her.We also tried a vest style of harness, and a strap version that had a chest strap.  Both of these styles bothered her because the vest and the chest strap got in the way when she settled down to groom herself - - she didn't like not being able to lick her chest.A slight con, is that the leash and clasp rests on the cat's back, rather than hang from under their chin.  This seems to bother her a teeny bit, but this is where a leash is secured with any type of harness-style device.The clasps are easy for me to snap on and squeeze off, but my husband sometimes has a bit of a problem with his larger hands.I'm not sure I'd feel completely comfortable leaving her unattended outside, but for spending family time outdoors with us, I'm very happy with this harness.Overall, a secure, cute and comfortable way to keep kitty safe and happy.

The best advice I can offer is to pay attention to whether you need a 120 volt, or a 12 volt.  Since they are both 6W, they are both called S6, but they are not interchangeable.I made the mistake of not paying attention to detail and just ordering this when I saw "GE, 6W and indicator".  I needed the 12 volt for the water dispenser on my GE refrigerator.  This 120 volt does not work.My fault for not reading more carefully, but one star deduction for how easy it is to make this mistake.

Great phone however, this one I bought from Amazon was defective.After activation, sycing (google) and loading with previous phone data/apps, I noticed my contacts and calendar data would come and go.  Sometimes all contacts were there, other times only about half were listed.  Additionally, when I'd add a new contact via my laptop, it would show up on all my other devices (ipads, husbands phone), but it would not show up on this phone.Another thing that did not work, was the NFC feature.I took it to a Verizon store thinking I was doing something wrong.  They couldn't figure it out either.Kudos to Amazon - - - spoke to a rep on the phone and she was super in providing full return authorization.Although the price was lower here on Amazon, I decided I'd purchase the replacement directly from Verizon so I'd have their warranty and accessibility should anything else go wrong.

My husband has elbow bursitis.  Although he hasn't had to have surgery, he's had to have his elbow drained several times in the past couple of years.His doctor told him that having to aspirate might possibly be avoided by compression and icing at the first signs.Most other compression sleeves are pull-on styles that don't allow for using with an ice pack.The style of this brace, works great for both icing and compression.A small ice pack will sit nicely in the cupped section of the elbow brace, and the velcro straps are long enough even with the pack in place.  To wear for compression, although the main portion of this brace is not stretchy, the velcro straps are.  This allows you to strap it as loosely or as tightly as you need.Since purchasing this, he's had 2 situations that he's felt the bursitis flaring up (inflammation, ache).  At the first sign of flare up, he used this brace with ice and as a compression brace  . . . after 2 days, all signs of the bursitis were gone and his elbow was back to looking and feeling normal again.Much more comfortable and convenient than a trip to the doctor!If I had to cite a con for this item, it's that the velcro holds very, very strongly.  That's good - - - however, because it attaches directly to the brace itself (not to another velcro strip), the material of the brace is already fuzzy and showing signs of wear (aesthetic only, no affect on the integrity of the brace).  If we were concerned more about how this looks, this would be an issue, but for us, this is a very, very minor point.

My dad's cardiologist suggested he wear these during long car and airplane trips.  He was told that he could use either the thigh high or knee high styles.  Because he also tends to get cold easily, he opted for the thigh high so they'd also serve as thermals to keep him warm.First of all, he is very pleased with these.  They feel good on his legs, do serve to keep him warm and he wears them everyday and not only when he is traveling. The top band is thick, good quality, does not roll down or bind, and stays up comfortably all day long.Realizing they need to be tight in order to serve their purpose though, they are very difficult to put on.  He is 80 yrs old, and it's not very agile.  He has difficulty bending over and needs my mom or me to help him put these on.  The most difficult part is getting them on his foot and past his heel.  Once they're above his ankle, he can manage to pull them up by himself.The instructions and drawings are not very good, but this is what we've found works easiest for us:Turn them inside out, invert just the foot-to-heel portion, slip your foot into that section until the sock heel meets your heel.  Then, inch the rest of the sock up your leg.It's still not easy, but it's easier than trying to pull these on like you would regular socks or hose.

Absolutely amazing price for a huge bag of dried shiitakes.  Honestly . . . dried mushrooms are light as feathers, and a pound of feathers is a very large bag . . . roughly the size of a large bag of potato chips.I found though, that there are more hard stems and non-uniform sized pieces than are usually found in other packaged brands.In more expensive packaged brands, I find that I still have to cut and discard hard stems.  Although this brand has more stems that are inedible and tough, the caps rehydrate perfectly and the taste is great, so the cost value is still worth the little extra work.Also, although the description says "slices", realize that the slices and pieces are not at all, uniform in size or shape.  Again, for me this is not an issue, but if you are looking for uniform pieces for aesthetic purposes, this may not suit your needs.Overall though, I think the few more stems that need to be cut away, and random sized slices still make this a great value.

Great capacity, light weight and comfortable to use, and rubber lip makes it easy to sweep up small debris without leaving a trail behind.Although the size and bright color of the bin makes this not so easy to just tuck away and hide in a corner, the utility of it outweighs this minor inconvenience.We have a smaller version - -  like the ones they use in hair salons and hotel lobbies.  Although it was easily stowed out of sight in a corner, the small size meant frequent trips to the large trash bin for emptying.I bought two of these large dust pans specifically to use for sweeping up leaves on our back yard deck and in our driveway.  The swivel handle means that when the bin is positioned vertically on end, it sort of acts like a bucket to contain the debris in.  That is, if I don't fill it in one use, I can position the bin on end and sit it in the corner till the next day without worrying about the debris spilling out.  This means I only have to empty it into the big trash can when it is completely full.

My kitty loves chicken and loves chewy things.  I've tried similar chicken treats that are marketed for cats, but although she will eat them, she only does so halfheartedly.Not so with this treat.As they come packaged, the strips are a little large for a cat, so I cut them (with a scissors) lengthwise in three narrower strips.  They end up roughly the width of a fettuccine noodle.  She will carry it around in her mouth for a while, then settles down, holds it between her paws like a dog would a bone, and eats it right up.The consistency and texture is moist, not crispy and crumbly like many others, and is made with only quality ingredients with no grain fillers.

I wear a 6-8.  I typically wear a M, but wanted this cami to sleep in, so went one size up and ordered a L.Taking it out of the package was shocking . . . it looked like doll clothing, it was so tiny.  Thinking that perhaps the fabric was extremely stretchy, I tried it on.The length barely came down to my navel, and the fabric cut in uncomfortably tightly under my arms.  I gave it to my 11 year old niece and it fits her well although even if this was marketed as a childs cami, the sizing would probably still be on the small side.I will say that the construction was good, and the fabric was very soft and cottony.  It is not lined, nor does it have a bra shelf, but the fabric is thick enough so even wearing it alone, will provide enough coverage to provide comfortable modesty.If this came in an XXL, the quality and price would make it worth taking a chance and ordering another one.  Since the L that I ordered is the largest size it comes in, I guess I'm out of luck.

I don't know if it's even realistic to expect no movement at all from a rug that's on carpet, but using this rug pad, there is very little movement at all.Most important though, is there is absolutely no buckling or rippling, which is a tripping hazard and can be dangerous.The rug this is on, is in our carpeted bedroom alongside our bed.  There is no furniture sitting on the rug, so the only thing keeping it in place is this rug pad.Every week or so, I notice about an inch of the rug pad peeking out from under the rug.  The rug pad hasn't moved, but the rug has just worked its' way off a bit.Very easy to just tug it back into place.Our rugs on hardwood all have furniture sitting on them, so I don't know if I can attribute the movement of our bedroom rug to the fact that it's on carpet, or because there's no furniture on it.  Whatever the reason, the movement is minimal, there is no buckling and no tripping danger, and I am very pleased and satisfied.

As much as I hated to put a case on this beautiful phone, it's very slippery and I'd rather have a case on it than see the screen shattered after an inevitable drop.I love this case.  It's a stiff plastic and is shockingly tight and difficult to put on - - - and that is a good thing.  If I'm going to put a case on a phone, I want it to stay on and not gap at the sides or slip around in my hand.  Truly though, it's not easy putting this case on.  Start at the bottom, work your way up the sides, and use a credit card like a shoe-horn to ease the case up and on over the last corner.Once on, it's great.  It adds very little to no bulk, has a nice tactile feel to it that allows grip without a tacky gel feeling, still smooth enough to make slipping in/out of pockets (even tight jeans pockets) easy, cutouts are perfect, and mine has large camera lens/flash cutout that doesn't interfere with awesome flash photos.My previous phone had a case on it that I could slip on/off a little easier.  My previous case was also solid black.  I would keep a $20 in case of emergencies.This new case is not only too tight to make doing this practical, but I ordered the black/clear case which would not be very good at "hiding" the $20 anyway.

My dad has a difficult time hearing dialogue while watching movies.  Without spending thousands on a full scale home theater system, this sound bar provides super dialogue clarity and dimension to their Sony Bravia.Kudos to Vizio for including every cable necessary for installation.If I have one complaint, it is that for some reason, Vizio does not provide codes for programming with a Comcast remote.  I've tried every suggestion I can find (online blogs, customer support etc), but cannot find a compatible code that will allow just using the one Comcast remote for everything.  (Harmony works, but it's too complicated for my parents in their 80's)** Update : 8 months after purchase, the remote went inop.  After no success trying the obvious battery change and unplug/plug in again, I called vizio support.  I was pleasantly surprised by their helpfulness and the congenital and lengthy time that they spent with me.The tech admitted that vizio remotes are their weak link, so he had several things for me to try.1 - unplug/plug in again (already tried that)2 - Reset: 5 second press and hold of the bottom and the middle buttons on the sound bar (the volume down & the Bluetooth buttons)3 - The last thing he talked me through was very detailed, but it worked:Unplug ... Take out remote batteries ... Press every button on the remote ... Plug back in ... Put batteries back in remote ... turn on using button on sound bar ... Test volume using remote.It worked, and the tech told me this should be the one and only time I had to go through all these steps.  If it ever went out again, I'd just need to do either the first or second method.FYI, it has gone inop several times since (it'll do this maybe once every couple of months), but the tech was right, and have only needed to either just unplug or reset.

This is the third of this same faucet that I have purchased for several of our rental units.The price is absolutely a bargain for a faucet of this quality.  Even our contractor has commented on the heft and quality of the parts.  He has also commented on how impressed he is with the inclusion and quality of all connectors and lines needed for installation.The water pressure is strong using both the spray and stream settings.An additional feature I appreciate, is the versatility of installation options.  The on/off lever can be positioned on any side without compromising operation or appearance.  This is helpful if any there are any other dispensers, spigots, or sink accessories that may interfere with the lever.For example, we installed one faucet with the lever on the left because the soap dispenser was on the right.  Another faucet was installed with the lever facing forward because it was centered in the middle of a divided sink.The included soap dispenser feels sturdy and operates well too.Very high end feel, look and construction at a fraction of the cost.

I ordered the 28" inserts to fill 24" covers.  They filled perfectly and very generously.The pillows I received did not have any odor that some had mentioned however, I tossed them in the dryer with a dryer sheet anyway, just to give them a fresh smell.

Within the first several hours of receiving delivery of a new leather sofa, kitty jumped up and was surprised at how slick the leather was as compared to our old fabric sofa.  She slid off and left behind 2 small nicks and several claw skid marks.I am vehemently opposed to declawing, so with fingers crossed, gave this a try.Kitty is a 4 year old with tons of energy and personality.  In other words, she is not one to just lay limp in your arms and let you do anything to her.Not knowing if I'd be able to apply all 10 in one sitting, I first only filled 5 of the covers.  We ended up being able to apply them all, and it wasn't a problem taking a short break in between to fill the next 5.Notes:- It was easier with two of us - - husband to brush and distract kitty, and me to apply.  I think it helped a lot that we already trim her nails regularly, so she is used to having her paws touched and handled.  Alternately, I have also easily managed to replace single nails that have fallen off while she is napping and fast asleep.- Instructions say fill 1/3 full with glue however, it's not easy to see just how much glue is in each nail.  I used the glue sparingly at first.  That evening while she was playing with her mouse, 2 covers fell right off.  I replaced them and this time filled them more closely to 1/3 full as directed.I overfilled one of them and a little of the glue oozed out onto some of the fur around her toe.  I wiped it off quickly, but a teeny bit of fur stuck to the soft claw.  This really bothered her and she pulled that soft claw off right away.  My husband said it probably felt like arm hair caught in a watchband.- Before and after filling with glue, squeeze open each soft claw so they slip more easily onto each nail.- I tried using my fingers, then also tried using tweezers to put on each soft claw.  I found tweezers to be much easier - - more control, and easier to see what you're doing without fingers in the way.-  I ordered the clear because I purposely did not wish them to be noticeable.  As a side note however, if the covers were brightly colored, you could tell if any covers had fallen off with just a quick glance at each paw.  If one had fallen off, it would also be easier to spot around the house.-  After 2 weeks, one cover fell off.  A week later, we found another on the floor.  Both had nail sheaths stuck inside them.  This tells us that they work as they are designed to - - - that is, the covers fall off because the nails had grown and their sheaths had shed.  Sure enough, the bare nails were long and needed to be trimmed before new covers were put on.Caution however, not to trim the nails too short.  If you do, it doesn't leave enough nail surface for the glue to adhere to and the Soft Claw will quickly fall off.In summary :  Other than when the glue oozed out of the one claw, kitty hasn't tried to pull off a single cover.  In fact, she truly doesn't seem to even notice she has them on.They are a complete and perfect solution and everyone is happy.  Couldn't ask for anything more.

Bought this to keep in my purse for travel.  Not only is it handy in a hotel room, but more important is how it is a lifesaver at the airport.No matter what airport it is, there are never enough outlets for the number of people needing to charge their devices.In the past, I'd either stand around like a vulture waiting for someone to leave, or find an undiscovered outlet in a not-too-pleasant bathroom.Now, with this device, I just approach someone who is currently using an outlet and ask if they wouldn't mind sharing.Not only do you get to charge your device, but you can also be a hero and offer 3 other vultures to plug into this as well.The only downside is when you have to leave and take it with you.
Beautiful quality, thick and flawless.  Packing was superb too.

Very, Very nice pillow insert.Bought the 28" size to use in a 24" pillow cover - - - perfect.  The feather/down fill is a nice density, and my order did not have any odor issues that are often common with feather/down pillows.When stuffed into a 24" square pillow cover, it fills it nice and puffy, but not so much as to make the pillow too solid.These prices are hard to beat, and even at a higher price, these pillow inserts are fantastic.

Finally a nutritional drink that tastes like regular juice in clear form!My father had to be put on a clear liquid diet for 3 weeks and needed a caloric and nutritional supplement. This, along with Boost Breeze peach (from this same vendor), was a lifesaver.The Ensure brand has a selection of clear beverages (berry, peach & mixed fruit) that are easily found at grocery and drug stores.  Those flavors were okay ... certainly drinkable, but not something you'd drink if you didn't need  to.I was looking for nutrition in an apple drink and this one is delicious ... tastes exactly like apple juice!  Only problem is that this Enlive apple product is only found online, thus my ordering it here.This Ensure apple, along with a peach juice from Boost, are tasty enough that they remain pantry staples now even after his clear liquid diet requirement is over.*** Ensure does have a clear liquid peach that you can find in local stores, but both my parents think the Boost brand peach is much tastier.Both my parents are in their 80's. Both drink juice daily anyway, so why not drink these nutritional juices and add much needed nutrition and calories into their diet.

Great quality, feel and construction.  The XL fits perfectly for my husband, a 34" waist pant.The M however, was far too small for my son who wears a 30 pant.  It honestly looked like something from the boys department.  I even tried it on, thinking that I could use it (size 6-8 women), but it was too tight for me as well. I would suggest going up a size in the smaller ranges of sizes.Note:  the quality and cost of this item is so good, it was still worth paying to return it, and ordering a larger size replacement for my son.

Finally a nutritional drink in clear form.  The Ensure line also now has a selection of clear beverages, but both my parents think the peach in this Boost brand is tastier.My father had to be put on a clear liquid diet for 3 weeks and needed a caloric and nutritional supplement.  This, along with Ensure Enlive Apple (from this same vendor), was a lifesaver.Both products are tasty enough however, that they remain pantry staples even after his clear liquid diet requirement is over.Both my parents are in their 80's.  Both drink juice daily anyway, so why not drink these nutritional juices and add more nutrition and calories into their diet.

Nice medium grit on these ... not too coarse that it tears your nails, and not too fine that it just feels like a buffer ... as Goldilocks said, this is just right.Great price, and since Tweezerman is a reputable company that makes super tweezers, so it's no surprise their other products are of high quality too.

Bought this with the intention of using to transmit tv audio so my dad would be able to use a bluetooth headset to help him hear better.In a nutshell, theoretically it worked.  In reality, the latency of audio was too great to be comfortable.If using just for music, this device is great.  Easy setup, ability to keep plugged in, reliable and strong signal . . . great.One star deduction only because although latency is minimal, it is still noticeable when matching audio to video images.

I did not purchase this for motorcycle use, but to provide bluetooth transmission from our tv to two bluetooth headsets.  There are not many dual band bluetooth transmitters, so I gave this one a try.I will say that syncing and connectivity were a snap, so if using for its intended purpose, this device would probably be great.In our situation, it wasn't acceptable for the main reason that even with aptx connectivity, there was still too much latency for tv watching.  Although delay was minimal and not noticeable if listening to music, the audio delay when paired with video, was uncomfortable.Additionally, for some reason, our headsets would not remember and recognize this device from one time to the next.  There were occasional-to-frequent signal drops, and re-syncing every time, was just not feasible.I am still giving this 4 stars because the setup is very intuitive, transmission was strong and device feels very solid and durable.If our frustrations came mainly because we were trying to use this for purposes other than it was intended, then it's not fair to negatively critique this device on that basis.

My existing stainless steel dish rack is solid and still in perfect condition however, the utensil holder that came with it had started to rust.This works great as a replacement caddy. The clear plastic feels sturdy, hooks right onto my rack like it was made for it, and aesthetically blends in, matches the rack, and doesn't look like an "add on".The three compartments are divided so utensils stay upright and don't slide through from one slot to another.  There are drain holes at the bottom so water does not sit in the holder.The depth is perfect for utensils however, some of my longer serving spoons and cooking utensils are top heavy and lean over.My other holder was a bit deeper and practically sat on the sink bottom.  That it was deeper meant that longer utensils stood upright however, because it was deeper, it actually sat on the sink bottom and sometimes knife tips would poke through the bottom and hit through to the sink.This one works better overall and I am very happy with my purchase.

We have an ipod with bluetooth transmitter in the house . . . this speaker goes outside in the garden with us.Setup and sync is a snap, speaker itself is solid, quite heavy for it's size, has easy and intuitive controls, nice shape and grippy bottom for stability and easy handling, and super sound.Wow, did I mention the sound? - - - super impressive sound from this little thing.  Actually, super impressive sound even if it was coming from a speaker twice its size.  It truly surprises with its bass, clarity and depth of sound.We have it turned up about half its max volume, and that's plenty enough volume for background music in our small garden.Battery life has been not quite the 12 hrs as advertised.  Although I haven't actually timed it, roughly estimating that it lasted about 9 hours of straight play.I now make it a habit to bring it in after a full day's use and recharge it so it's ready for the next day.I believe that bluetooth range is depleted when connectivity goes through walls.  Our transmitter is in the house, and the speaker is outside.  Given this situation with physical walls/windows between the transmitter and the receiving speaker, we find the connectivity range is roughly 15 feet, rather than the advertised 30 feet.  This is still pretty impressive though, and no complaints (only fyi) by mention of this here.All that being said, I enthusiastically give this 5 stars for its sound, size, solidness and price.
I'm using this for the ipod dock remote control.This 5 pack is the same price as one battery at the local drug store, so I figured there's no way to lose with this purchase.So far, so good . . .

Good price on bulk pack of tape.  As far as the tape goes . . . it's invisible tape . . . which means it's the translucent type that goes on frosty-clear . . . the common type you find in an office or school.

Bought these for use with the Butler gum massage tool that my dentist has me using.The toothpicks are all uniform in size, and they are smooth with no splinters.Not much more to say about a box of toothpicks, except that the price and volume are great too.

I've been searching for a silpat mat for my Breville Smart Oven 12x12 baking pan.  Since silpat mats cannot be cut to size, this is the closest I could find.As for the quality of this particular mat, it's of similar and equal quality to my other Silpat brand mats.  Non stick, even heat distribution and nice, even thickness.For my specific needs, the mat works only for baking biscuits because the octagonal shape means 4 corners of the square pan remain uncovered.If and when I find a square mat, I will repurpose this for use in the microwave.  Until a square mat comes along though, I have no regrets with this purchase.

Nothing fancy, but the rollers on this type of curtain ring make smooth open/closing of shower curtains.Quality is comparable to the ones you find at bath stores for twice the price.I haven't owned these long enough to attest to durability, but for this price, I ordered 2 sets so I'll have spares to change out when/if any of the rings begin to rust or tarnish.

Sometimes you get what you pay for, and sometimes you get much, much more than you imagined.  The latter is the case here!Snap one end in, then work the other 3 sides around the nano.  Fit is snug on all 4 sides.All ports buttons are perfectly aligned and accessible.The case has a grippy-yet-rigid feel which makes this little nano easier to hold onto.  Being that the nano is so lightweight, this seems like it would easily give good protection from accidental bumps and drops.I especially like the TPU material, which is more rigid and solid than others that are soft silicone and gummy-bear-like.I ordered the clear, which is actually translucent and not clear as glass.  My nano is silver, so this is fine with me however, if you have a colored nano and wish to retain the clarity of color, take note of this.An added plus to this already insanely low price, is that this also comes with a screen protector.  Just a basic peel-and-press film, but a bonus nevertheless.

Wanted a motion sensor light for the area around the door from the house into the garage. We have tons of overhead lights in the garage, but sometimes all we need is a minute of light to just run to the mail slot or drop something in the trash can - - - kind of a waste to turn on all the overhead lights just for that.Asked our handyman to install one single separate switched light, but he said we'd need to call an electrician to run conduit.  Not worth the $ to do all that, so decided to try this.Am so glad I did.It's perfect, works reliably every time, and sheds plenty enough light in our dark garage for our needs.  The motion sensor works great! I have it mounted on the ceiling about 3 feet from the entry door and the movement of the door opening is enough to trigger the sensor.  This is great because when you open the door, the light is already on - - - no standing on the landing having to wave your hands in order to trigger the sensor.The light stays on for about 30 seconds, and sheds a comfortable warm/white light (unlike the uneasy blueish light of other LED's).Side note about the necessity of complete darkness for this to work - - - I bought two of these lights.  One for our garage and another for a rental property garage.  Our garage has 2 small 5" diameter metal grid light/vent holes in our garage door.  It lets in a little light, but not enough to be useful.Our rental property has a 2 bulb fluorescent garage fixture that is left on 24/7.  It's on the opposite side of our 3 car garage, and it's light doesn't quite reach the entry door area.In both garages, the extra existing light does not affect the function of these, so the warning that the area needs to be in complete darkness, is actually not true.I just put these up, so have no history for longevity of batteries, but at least access to the unit is easy (mounting bracket screws into ceiling, light twist onto bracket) when a battery change is needed.*** battery life update:  almost 3 months later and batteries needed to be changed.  When you notice the lights are not as bright as usual, that's a sign the batteries need replacing.  Being that our light is probably activated an average of around at least 10x a day, I'm very pleased with this 3 month life.

Am using this so my father can hear audio from tv without blasting the volume up so high as to drive everyone else out of the room.Truly easy set up.  Plug into power, plug into audio out on tv, select frequency and tune in!  The only adjustment I had to make is turning down the volume on this transmitter to erase static.  Just tune in, notice any static, and adjust volume control on transmitter until static clears.Used this transmitter, "radio-channel.com" to find vacant fm station, iPod nano 7th generation as an fm receiver, and earbuds of our choice.There is a micro minuscule delay in audio, and if the tv volume is off, it's completely unnoticeable.  News, sports or talk shows are also less noticeable than movies or programs with background soundtracks.  You don't notice it visually (lips and audio are in synch), just the slightest of an echo delay if tv speakers are up.If anyone else is watching with him and listening through the tv speakers, noticing the delay is avoided by using noise canceling earbuds.If he's watching sports or the news, he uses regular earbuds (or sometimes just puts one side in).  This way he can still hear enough "outside" noise to be social, talk and comment about the news or game with us.When watching movies or tv shows however, he switches to his noise canceling earbuds.We previously tried a bluetooth solution to this problem.  Not only was latency horrible with that, but whenever he walked out of the room, bluetooth would drop off and we'd often even have to re-pair the device.  Using fm transmission, he can leave the room, go get a snack, visit the restroom ... all without missing anything.The biggest expense with this solution is the ipod nano, so you could cut your cost greatly by using a much less expensive fm receiver  --- ie, a regular fm pocket radio, instead of the iPod nano --- but, we wanted something small and digital.Here are the components we used:SainSonic AX05B transmitter - $62IPod nano 7th generation - $140 (only generations 5-7 have fm receivers)Earbuds of choiceHappy family now!

Bought this to power a charging station I have set up in the corner of the counter.  The charging station houses 2 ipads, 2 android phones, and 2 nanos (the nanos have to share).  The charging station is a space-saver on the counter, but I had a jumble of plugs all jammed into a power strip against the wall.The charging station eliminated the eyesore of cords and devices strewn all over the counter.  The octupussy mess of cords against the wall however, were hard to hide.  I tried hiding it behind a decorative bowl, but then I found this.It's perfect!Most devices come with usb chargers that plug into wall adapters anyway, so just being able to get rid of the wall plugs saved tons of space right off the start.The shape of this is smartly styled to sit flat against the wall, and the 5 usb ports are not all powered equally.  They are labeled to coordinate with their power ratings, ie. ipad, tablet, android, etc.I haven't tested the amperage, but I followed the labels when plugging in my usb cables, and I can validate that it successfully and consistently charges all 5 devices - - - all at the same time, and all at standard speed.

If you're looking for an extension to add length to your headset, this is not for you.I wanted just the opposite.  I did not want added length to easily get tangled, but I did want to use the earbuds of my choice and still be able to control the volume without having to fish my ipod out of my pocket.Pros: short length, easy to control volume dial (more control than sliding, or arrow up/down styled ones), good range of mute thru fairly high volume, adjusting the volume is seamless (no static or cutting out)Cons: not the strongest feeling cord material.Volume dial is a "loose" spin which makes it easy to control, but I have also brushed against the dial a couple of times and have changed the volume just by doing soOverall, I am extremely pleased with this inexpensive solution to the minor annoyance I had of having to retrieve my device anytime I wanted to adjust the volume.  Price is so great, that durability is only a minor concern.

I live in Georgia and remember see this on the news as a lot of it unfolded and this is an incredible story. I think many will find it as a controversy and some will see it as a blessing from God and I think all is true in that respect, I feel so bad for the families that lost love ones during this ordeal and I am thankful he chose to stop with Ashely and wish he has chose to not have taken the very first life at all.Ashley's captor's name was Brian Nichols and he escaped from an Atlanta courthouse, killing several people in the process. Before he was able to take her hostage. He then held her hostage in her own apartment for seven hours, and she talked him into surrendering peacefully by witnessing to him about her family, her faith, and her life turnaround. At the time, Ashley was a 27 year old widow, whose husband had been murdered as a result of a fight about drugs. As a meth addict herself, Ashley was beginning to get her life together and trying to get things together for her 5 year old daughter, whom she hadn't had custody of for over two years. She as given a copy of Purpose Driven Life, threw the book away, and the woman who gave it to her pulled it out of the trash and gave it to her again. God definitely wanted Ashley to have that book as a tool for her immediate future as well as her life generally.She credits God for many miracles that took place during her ordeal with Brian. This includes the fact that Brian did not kill her, even though he had already killed four people just a few hours earlier. An additional amazing fact was that he eventually let her go, unharmed. Even more of her prayers were answered when Brian was taken into custody without anyone else being hurt.A product sample was supplied to me, by Flyby Promotions for my listening pleasure to give my honest and unbiased review.

Five stars for the products, minus one star for the lack of any packaging...This is an excellent way to try new-to-you products from Burt's Bees. While it is a "set," it isn't a "gift set."  There is no packaging and the items are tossed loose in a padded envelope. You could always buy a gift bag and some ribbon to make it into a gift set, if you are so inclined.As far as the products go...1. Intense Hydration Cream Cleanser: I LOVE this face wash.  I have been using it for 1-2 years and have it on Subscribe & Save on Amazon since the local drugstores' prices are $3+ more a tube.  It truly is like washing your face with cream.  It is super moisturizing and I don't have dry skin at bedtime since using this.  Less dry skin means less chance of wrinkles.2. Coconut Foot Cream: Nicely scented but definitely not a "cream."  It is more like a Vaseline texture.  I don't like that consistency but if you do, it is quite hydrating.3. Deep Cleansing Cream:  It is a fine face wash but a bit more drying than the Intense Hydration Cream Cleanser.  I will be sticking with my favorite but this may be good for younger teen faces that are a constantly oily.4. Milk and Honey Body Lotion:  I really enjoy the scent of this one and the lotion goes a long way.  I will be re-purchasing to use on my arms and legs before bed.  The scent is perfect to snuggle up to.5. Shea Butter Hand Repair Cream: I really like the consistency and the level of moisture but am not a fan of the smell.  I won’t be purchasing this in a larger size unless they have another scent.6. Intense Hydration Day Lotion: Very thick and a little goes a long way with this product too. I actually like this in a unique way.  The texture feels different than most lotions I've tried and I enjoy the difference... maybe because it is novel?  So far, I have not had any breakouts from this and will update if I do.

We screwed the rack in the studs and didn't have to use the included drywall anchors.  In order to make the process easier we:- Used a stud finder- Marked the holes of the first rack with a pencil- Pre-drilled holes for the one rack only- Screwed in the first rack- Used a broom handle and a level to ensure the rack was going to be straight- Marked the second holes with a pencil, after ensuring it was level- Pre-drilled holes for the second rack- Screwed in the second rackIt only took a few minutes to do the extra steps of pre-drilling and leveling and, in the end, saved us a ton of time, ensured we didn't make a mistake, and made the process smooth and easy.  The board is super secure, gives the room a "surfer vibe" and I no longer have to move the board to vacuum the room or worry it will be knocked/tripped over.  It is easy to grab off the wall and surf with if you are mounting a board you use.  In our case, we mounted a decorative board and the ones we surf with are in ugly bags ready to grab, when needed.

I don't usually expect a ton from earbuds in the bass department (the over the head "big" type I do) however, these buds just proved me wrong.  I have a pair of $150+ headphones that sound stunning, however, the bass on them is almost non-existent.  These Bose, while still maintaining the stunning sound, have amazing bass for an in-ear pair of headphones and have a very true-to-recording sound.The earbuds themselves are extremely comfortable to wear, my ears never became fatigued or got sore, and they come with three sizes included: one pair of small, one pair of medium (pre-installed) and one pair of large.  For my tiny ear canals, the small fit perfectly.  Once in, they are quite noise canceling while music is playing.  Both my co-worker and child could not get my attention when I had music playing at an average level.As for the controls, everything worked beautifully with my iPhone 6 and I didn't run into any hiccups while using them for music or phone calls.Unfortunately, my teen stole these from me and is now begging to keep them for himself.  I love these earbuds so much that I will end up purchasing a pair for myself and give him this pair so mine don't keep going missing (sharing in-earbuds... ick!).

Finish Tabs are my favorite dishwashing detergent. I have a very old dishwasher that still gets the job done and Finish seems to work the best in ol' faithful out of all I've the detergents I've tried. Finish Tabs gets off the grease and doesn't leave a film or white powder behind.The only thing I couldn't stand about the old version was that they were individually wrapped in foil wrappers. While the wrappers ensured that the detergent bricks wouldn't break apart in the box and wouldn't dissolve if the box got wet, those things were a pain to open with damp hands. I was also not a fan of touching the bleach/chemicals/whatever and would always scrub my hands after loading a tab in the dishwasher.  These tabs solved both of my problems and work just as well as its predecessor.

Dove makes my favorite deodorants and I hadn't yet tried the Advanced Care line. Given my propensity to sweat, even in the winter and without exercise, I wasn't expecting this, or any, product to keep me dry for 48 hours. Since I shower every morning, I do not need my deodorant to last this long. I was surprised to find that on a day that I took a late shower, my underarms were still fresh and dry 36 hours later, which is quite impressive.My only reason to knock down a star was for the "Clean" scent. It is a personal preference but I did not love the floral scent of this one.

My teen son was thrilled to receive this set.  Phoenix is his favorite scent in the AXE line and, as his mother, I don't find it offensive like some of the horrific things his teen friends wear.  This scent would, in my opinion, smell great on a grown man as well.  It doesn't scream "I'm a teenager" like some scents do.As for the products, he has worn the AXE solid antiperspirant for years and it has always kept him dry and smelling great.  The body wash works well, and the scent does linger a bit, but it does contain Sodium Laureth Sulfate (SLES) for those who are looking to avoid it.  Finally, the spray... ohhhhhh the spray... it seems to be a *must* for any young teenager.  It is strong but in our house the rule is, it must be sprayed outside the house, away from the body, and then walked into.  This isn't for some great health reason, it is for my poor nose when it is stuck in a small vehicle with him I don't want gag on a fragrance bomb.  One of my favorite things about the spray is how it locks so it can't accidentally go off in a drawer and coat the inside and everything else inside the drawer.  This has happened on more than one occasion with a different spray.Overall, this is a great set.  It is labeled as a "gift box" but it is really just these three items in the cardboard box pictured above.  There is nothing special to make it a gift box (like a tin, fun inserts, etc.) but it is currently much cheaper to buy these in this set rather than individually.

This is my teenage son's favorite of all the AXE deodorant scents.  He regularly uses the white/solid version of this deodorant and we figured we'd give this blue/clear one a shot.  This deodorant is great for days when you are wearing dark shirts and don't want to get white streaks on your shirt.  That said, he prefers the white one on days when the clear isn't needed.  The white one feels drier when it initially goes on and throughout the day.  No matter which one he uses, it keeps him smelling fresh and, for a guy who runs miles on the beach everyday, it keeps him dry.

I have a Revlon 1875 watt dryer that has been my holy grail appliance since 2006.  Lately, even though it is still working as well as the day I bought it, it has been giving off an "electrical" smell so I jumped at the opportunity to find a replacement for when the inevitable happens.Pros:- This thing BLOWS.  Not all 1875 watt dryers are created equal.  This thing blows harder and dries faster than my old dryer and I truly thought nothing could beat it.  I have several friends who are professional stylists with pro dryers and this blows stronger than those I tested it against, including my "old faithful."- Three heat settings.  My old dryer had two which was fine for most of the year, however, I have thick course hair and in the summer the hot was too hot and the cooler setting was not hot enough to get my hair smooth and dry in a reasonable time frame.  This is truly a Goldilocks case and third setting is "just right" for those scorching summer days.- The added concentrator and diffuser pop off and on pretty easily but stick on well enough that they will not fall off on their own.- The "Cool Shot" is necessary not only to finish my style but also to cool and dry off my hot face after a blow drying session.  I would never purchase a dryer without this option.  I use it every time after I finish drying my hair to add a smoothness and shine I don't get otherwise.Cons:- Weight.  While not the heaviest dryer I've used, it is heavier than my old dryer and will take some getting used to before I am comfortable with it.  The upside is that since this is a stronger and hotter dryer, my hair dries faster so I am not holding it as long.

Wow!  I am very impressed with this travel mug.  Sure, it is rugged and hefty looking but, to my surprise, it also kept ice water cold for over 24 hours in 80+ degree temps (no direct sun).  The next day I wanted to see how it did with hot liquids and the mug kept my coffee hot throughout the work day.  As far as leaks, there were none, even when shaken upside down.  As someone who spends a large part of the workday driving around to people's homes, to have something that won't spill in the car and will keep my liquids hot or cold (depending on what I put in) while my car sits in the sun or fog (depending on the day) is invaluable.It is super easy to wash, simply take apart the lid and throw in the dishwasher.I am always looking for gifts for my hard-to-buy-for-dad and he will be getting one of these for Christmas this year... maybe in a basket with special coffee, smoked salmon, cheeses, and crackers.

This antiperspirant does an excellent job keeping me dry and fresh smelling.  I recently had to travel to SoCal for my child's competition during a ridiculous heat wave which included a very rare, for California, level of extreme humidity.  I tried the Dove antiperspirant during our trip which was held out in the blazing sun for 9 hours.  My underarms still smelt baby powder fresh at the end of the day and, while I was sweating everywhere else, my underarms stayed dry.  Quite an accomplishment for this heavy sweater.My only note for those who are sensitive to smells is that the baby powder scent is pretty strong and does linger.  I, personally, am more than happy to smell floral-y rather than like death but I wanted to throw that out there for those with sensitive noses.

Our family enjoyed the light scent, which didn't stick around post-shower, but found that we preferred the "cream" type Dove body washes better. Having been spoiled by the white/cream washes, which can even be used to shave with, this gel-based wash was not nearly as moisturizing or thick.I did like that the dispenser is at the bottom of the bottle so it is quick and easy to dispense, however, the bottom of the bottle is a bit narrower which makes it easy to knock over. It would have been better if it was a bit wider at the base.

A shelf is a must to get the maximum storage space out of your locker.  Binders and books easily fit under this shelf, in most cases with extra room to spare, and other items like sports equipment, lunch, notebooks, hats, etc. can go on top.  We stacked quite a bit on top and the shelf showed no signs of distress or buckling.The drawer, while a cool feature, was not designed all that well.  If you pull the drawer out and slightly up, the drawer will fall right out.  This could be a problem with those who have bottom lockers since they will be pulling the drawer up and out.  For those with middle or top lockers, it is more likely they will be pulling the drawer out and down and therefore, the plastic nubs will keep the drawer from falling out.  Due to this, I wouldn't store breakables or small objects that would be difficult to gather up inside the drawer, should it fall.The other concern with the drawer is that if you don't push it in quite straight, the drawer will go off its tracks.  It takes some jiggling to get it back in place.(A side note on the drawer, there are two holes in the  bottom of the plastic drawer that are slightly smaller than a hole punch.  If you are planning on using the drawer to store something itty bitty, it will likely fall through the two small holes.)My only other word of caution when purchasing this locker shelf is to ensure that it will fit well.  The shelf is wobbly, however, in a snug locker, it does not move/shake (since there is no room to do so).  In a wider locker it will wobble about an inch in each direction.Overall, it suits our needs.  It fits well in our high school's lockers, is able to handle a heavy load on top, and provides extra space for all the junk and school supplies that need to fit in.  The drawer will likely remain empty or be used for items that rarely need to be grabbed daily/quickly.  If it becomes a bigger hassle as time goes on, it can easily be removed.

I have been using a corded non-Bluetooth headphones at work for the last few years to block out the office.  The problem is I am constantly flinging my iPhone off the desk when I turn my head or get up to grab things from other areas of the office.  The iPhone falls and the headphones rip out of my ears.  This has left me wanting to try a Bluetooth pair for awhile but I wasn't ready to spend $80+ on a pair for work.  When I was offered the chance to try these, I figured it would be a good way to see if Bluetooth headphones would be a better option.After several weeks using these at work, my thoughts are:- Pairing was super easy to do and they were paired to my iPhone 6 in just a few seconds- I love the zipper pouch these come in.  At the end of my day, I zip them up and throw them in my desk drawer- Different size earbuds.  The ones that come pre-installed on the headphones were much too large for my ears.  I put the smallest ones on, an easy task, and they fit perfectly.  Since the instructions that came with the headphones did not include how to put them on, I struggled a lot the first day to get them to stick in.  Now that I understand how they go in (thanks other reviewers for the pictures!) I pop them in, play my music, and start working.- They are comfortable. No complaints here on how they feel once in.  I can not stand hard plastic earbuds and these have a comfortable rubbery bud that fits snugly but comfortably.- Sound: For the price, they have a decent sound.  I don't struggle to hear the lyrics but they aren't as clear and bass heavy as my most expensive headphones.  For under thirty dollars, they are excellent.- And finally... they solved my problem that I had with the corded set.  I can get up, move around and don't have to worry about my iPhone falling and ripping the buds out of my ears.  I am extremely happy!I received this in exchange for a fair review.

If you plant from seeds or small plants, it is difficult to remember what's what in the garden until the plant is fully grown and begins producing.  These are excellent labels for the price and are a wonderful way to remind you what was planted where.  They are extremely sturdy and easy to stake into the ground, they are "rough" so that pen doesn't smear once dry, and you receive an amazing amount for the price.  The labels are large enough to accommodate common and scientific plant names, if that is your thing.I have already recommended them to my friends who garden as a cheap but quality solution.I received this in exchange for a fair review.

I chose this product due to the size as well as the quality I've come to expect from 5 Star products. While the quality is there, unfortunately, the notebook is not 8.5x11, the size of a standard piece of paper, and we do not have a use for a 9.5x6 notebook. All classes at our high school require a standard size page so this product will sit around until it gets tossed. Since the listing currently states the size as 8.5x11, this could be an expensive mistake for those who believe that is what they ordered.Now, if you are looking for a smaller notebook, the quality is amazing. There is a stretchy elastic loop that will hold a pen or pencil but will hold one with a good clip the best. The two subject dividers are movable which is ingenious since one subject always seems to need more paper than another. The rings are also covered by a thick sturdy fabric so the they don't catch on items in your backpack. The only downside to this 9.5x6 notebook is that there is only 100 sheets. For the price and size, it should be quite a bit thicker.If you are in the market for a 100 sheet 9.5x6 notebook, you probably won't find another with these awesome features and solid build. If you are in the market for an 8.5x11 notebook, you will need to find another 5 Star product.

With a creek in our backyard, enjoying the yard in the summer requires some intervention.  This "lantern," when lit up, matches my outdoor decor of blue Mason Jars filled with tealights and isn't noticeable as a insect repellent.  Other fans I have seen in stores are brightly colored, unattractive, and have huge brand-names written across them.The Cons:- Lantern is a misnomer.  This lantern barely lights up, more of a dull glow, but this may not be the worst thing in the world.  Light attracts bugs, the same thing the lantern is attempting to ward off.  It is strange, however, that the lantern has two settings.  One with the light and fan and a second setting for the light without the fan.  Given the minimal light, the second setting seems pointless. It would make more sense to have a fan with light option and a second option that has fan with no light.- Refills are, at this time, tough to find. Amazon sells them but they currently won't ship  for 2-4 weeks and the cost is insane compared to buying the lantern to begin with.  Refills, for those interested, can be found here: Stinger Mosquito Repellent Refills (2 Pack)The Pros:- DEET Free!  No nasty chemicals here.- Comes with batteries (always a huge plus in our family)- A fairly quiet fan.  Nothing that guests will have to scream over.- It works and looks cute doing it.  Mosquitoes are the only insects that fly in this part of California at night (besides the benign moths).  It does a great job of keeping me bite free which is the only task I really expect it to do.

Due to some significant GI issues, my GI doctor recommended that I try taking probiotics. This product was my first attempt and, I must say, my stomach upset was decreased slightly after chewing a couple of these.The flavors are fabulous (particularly the yellow) and it seemed to take effect fairly quickly.Due to the extreme nature of my GI distress, these probiotics did not "cure what ails me" but frankly, I'll take any decrease I can get.The recommended dosage, per the bottle, is 4 a day. Unfortunately, the bottle isn't full and would only provide me about two weeks worth of assistance. Looking at the cost, it is high but at this point, I am willing to sell a limb for any assistance.

Parchment paper is one of my favorite "cheats" in the kitchen. It saves so much clean up time (no scraping off burnt bits or trying to get oil residue off my pans) and you don't need to use a new sheet for each batch. The paper is strong enough to lift up cookies/brownies/etc. off the pan by grabbing the edges so they can quickly cool. Another plus is the calorie savings by not needing to oil/butter the pan. I've never had a recipe stick to parchment paper.While I regularly use the Reynold's Parchment Paper Rolls, I often find myself fighting the curling sheets. The fact that it is folded in fourths means that it lays flatter than the rolls. The downside is, it is precut so you may need to use more than one sheet for bigger cookie sheets or use scissors for smaller jobs. All of my cookie sheets are larger than these precut sheets which means I need to make smaller batches. You may want to take a peek at yours to determine if these will fit or if you would be better off using the roll.

For the last two years I've used a Neato VX-11 and before that I owned, and used, a Roomba.  To me, the Neato has been the superior product at a lower price.  First, the Neato really does scan the room and creates a "plan."  It vacuums the perimeter of the room then goes back and forth in a straight pattern to vacuum the middle.  On the other hand, the Roomba just bounces around the room slamming into things and changing directions. The Neato doesn't often hit furniture as it "sees" it and will run alongside it.  The Roomba reminds me of a child who scribbles wildly outside the lines, occasionally coloring on the table.  The Neato is the child who traces the lines of the coloring book and meticulously colors in the lines, back and forth, not missing a single spot. (See photo of the beautiful straight lines the Neato leaves when finished.)Compared to the VX-11 model, here are the biggest improvements: - The dust bin!  As you can see from my photos, the larger dust bin was much needed.  While the D75 vacuum is the same size as the VX-11, the dustbin and filter are significantly bigger.  This was a complaint of mine with the VX-11.  I believe the larger dustbin is the reason the D75 cleans so much better than its predecessor.  The D75 does not fill up as quickly and, therefore, does not lose suction from being jam packed with debris.  Note: Before you judge my dustbin, I just had new carpet installed a few days prior and a professional vacuuming job was completed after the install.  We have been shoeless in the house since.  The photo shows how much crud the Neato was still able to suck up just from one really clean room.  Cat hair, human hair, wood chips, ants?!?!? (that's a situation that is about to be handled), sand, carpet fibers, etc.- The noise.  The D75 is significantly quieter than the previous model.  This was confirmed by my son who walked in and immediately commented on the sound, the cat who didn't run into the kitchen and jump on top of the refrigerator (as he ALWAYS did with the VX-11), and my mom who stopped by and also owns a VX-11.- Maneuvering.  The VX-11 would always get stuck in a couple key places if I didn't block them off.  Two spots in particular I sat waiting for the new D75 to get stuck in.  I was shocked when it made it in-and-out of the corner with the writing desk and made it underneath our ottoman.  Our VX-11 would always call out for help if I didn't block the desk with a chair and put the ottoman up before vacuuming.- The cord system.  The charging base has built-in channels that you can wrap the cord in to shorten and hide it.  This is much better than trying to shove it behind the charging base which makes the base stick out further from the wall.  Much appreciated from someone who hates seeing cords all over the house.- The look.  While I am not in love with the giant blue "Neato" on top (it doesn't light up), I like it much better than the dark gray and orange 80s thing that was happening with the VX-11.- Battery?  Since the VX-11 is over two years old, I can't remember how many rooms it cleaned before it needed to recharge when I first purchased it.  The D75 seems to last longer but it could be the old battery I am comparing it to.  The D75 can do two decent size rooms before needing to drive itself over to the docking station, without human assistance, to recharge itself and clean the rest of the house.Overall, I have been extremely happy with the Neato vacuums I've used, especially compared to the competition.  The D75 is even better than its predecessor since it has required no human intervention to get unstuck and the larger dustbin is so necessary.  While I haven't needed to call customer support for this vacuum, I did have to call for my previous vacuum and found the customer service representative to be patient, helpful, and fully met my needs.**** IMPORTANT: There is a lot of genius packed into this robot and it isn't your industrial 1950's vacuum that could stand up to nuclear destruction.  If I could leave you with one bit of advice, ALWAYS purchase the extended warranty when buying a robotic vacuum.  In my mind, it should be mandatory.  If something goes wrong, for less than 10% of the purchase price you can have it repaired or have your money refunded.  Buy the longest warranty offered.  You won't regret it.

This cover meets my needs. I have a couple of adirondack chairs in my backyard that are constantly exposed to the elements. On the coast of California, that mostly consists of sun, fog, and dust/dirt. While we are lacking snow and rain, chairs still will eventually fade, crack, warp, and are filthy.This heavy duty cover ensures that when company comes to visit, the chairs look clean and new. (And they don't end up leaving with a brown bottom!)In heavy wind, the cover stays on with no problem due to the buckle system AND the cinching around the bottom of the chair cover.While not waterproof, water does roll off with ease and will be great if we ever see rain again.I currently have two adirondack chairs stacked under this cover and, while the cover doesn't quite reach the ground when the chairs are stacked, it is more than enough to protect both.

We are a big gaming family with at least 40 board/card games in the house at this time.  While I've heard of Castle Panic and Munchkin, I had never played either (strange, I know, given their popularity with the gaming community).  Without an emotional attachment to either, I have to say, I really enjoyed this new addition to our cupboard!  Our family enjoys cooperative games, mostly because they are fairly rare, and enjoyed that even though we were "forced" to cooperate to survive, the game also had a competitive element.  Kudos to the game designer for the free, and optional, expansion pack to mix up game play which extends replayability.  At this time we have only played the game using the original instructions but there are also instructions for Solo Play, Easier Play, or Harder Play for those who want to customize the game to the age/skill level/number of people playing.This game will definitely make it out of our cupboard but won't be a in the regular rotation as often as I would like.
