The game, while very fun and engaging, involves longer/detailed instructions and the game play lasts at least an hour.  There are rainy days (though few in California) that a game like this is perfect for.  Great for a long family night in or for a family cabin retreat!

I recently redecorated a bathroom and have been looking for a curtain to match a lot of the taupe brown I brought in.  This "Cool Brown" matches beautifully.  It has a smidge of a gray hue, which I have been looking for (but not finding).  The subtle pattern and sheen make it more expensive looking than many other curtains I have been finding in my local stores.The curtain doesn't have metal grommets, which I prefer, as all of my old curtains have eventually ended up rusting (even when they promised they were "rust free").  I am using it without a liner, since it is polyester, and it has been holding up well.

First, let me say that I had no idea how bad I was at throwing a frisbee .  I was seriously terrible!  After I practiced my aim for a couple days, this game became a blast.  It is being added to our beach bonfire games that we tote out on the sand every weekend because it:- Has a score keeper built into the post of the game (no need for pen and paper)- Has its own carrying case that easily is unpacked and packed up- Is easy to learn (though challenging to play!)- Easy to set upThis game is easy to play for a bit in between grilling burgers and can be stopped and resumed as needed.  You can easily modify the game to accommodate more people as the party grows.  Young children enjoy playing it (with the posts being closer together) and adults enjoy the challenge of a "full court" game.  Recommended for your bonfire/park day/backyard barbecue.

Update 2/7/15:Scheduling is now working on my Air Purifier!  I increased the stars to 3 since it is now a functioning product.  I never received assistance from WeMo Customer Service and I still don't love the look of the product which keeps off two stars.Original Review:I am so incredibly sad about this product.  I saw value in an connected/smart home air purifier.  I loved the idea of having it run on a schedule that wouldn't wake me up and I was thrilled that I would receive reminders about filter changes and maintenance (I have no idea when my other air purifier is due for a filter change... it is likely wayyyy past due).  Sadly, my experience has left me baggy-eyed.The WeMo app has the default schedule set as 7 days a week running from 5:28am to 5:28pm.  I opted to have it run beginning at 10am as to not be woken up by the noise.  Every time I would change the schedule back to 10am, the app would switch back to the default of 5:28am.  I spent the last several days woken up at 5:28am by the air purifier running full throttle (it is noisy at its highest speed!).It is currently Saturday so I had "free" time to contact customer service.  After nearly 20 minutes on the line, I was told that Tier I support could not help me beyond re-installing the app (did not fix the problem).  I was put on hold while Tier I spoke to Tier II support to see if I was worthy of being transferred to the next level.  In the end, Tier II would not speak to nor help me (per Tier I guy).  Tier I said that I would need to call Jarden customer service because WeMo/Belkin has no clue how to re-set the air purifier.If WeMo wants to start integrating their system into household products, they need to provide support for the entire product and not pass the buck after asking for a simple re-install of the app.  Re-install is the equivalent of asking someone to restart their computer and then giving up on providing any support beyond that.  Too bad.  I was looking forward to having this in my bedroom.  (It wasn't going in the living room, as planned, since the wood paneling is too 1970s and the size is too large making it horrific centerpiece which must remain 12 inches from any wall or object.)I've had no issue with Belkin WeMo products thus far, I own quite a few, and am extremely disappointed in my first call to their customer service team.

We have an excess of speakers in our home. Soundbars, bluetooth, docked, wired, etc.  I've known about SONOS for a long time now and, while I always thought they were cool, I didn't see the need for yet another speaker.  Our primary source of music is Spotify which means that bluetooth speakers were our main way of getting music from my iPhone to my ears.  Wire/docked speakers meant I couldn't answer texts, Google recipes, or 1980s actors I couldn't quite remember the name of while I listened to my music.  Bluetooth speakers didn't allow me to wander too far away from the speaker or listen to music throughout my house.  Also, when calls came in or my texts went "ding" that was also heard through the speakers.With the SONOS I have perfection.  I can listen to the same song in every room or listen to a song in my room while kids listen to something different (horrific) in the living room.  My whole house and backyard is covered by my WiFi so I can wander anywhere with my iPhone and still hear my music.  I can answer my texts or a phone call without interrupting my jam.  As for the sound, pretty darn good!  I am completely happy with my purchase and plan on purchasing two more to cover the rest of my house.  I haven't listened to music this much since my teen years!

Our family really enjoys the Fluxx series of games.  We own Fluxx 4.0, Pirate Fluxx and Fluxx the Board Game so we were happy to try the latest iteration of the Fluxx family.  Fluxx, by itself, is a simple game.  You start out with three cards and on your turn you must draw a card and play a card.  What makes the game wild is that there are cards that change the rules of the game, the goals of the game, and the odds of everyone winning.  The fact that it is never the same game twice makes it re-playable.What I discovered is that Fluxx 4.0 and Fluxx 5.0 are nearly identical with the exception of "Creeper" cards.  These are cards, for the most part, that you don't want.  Having them in your possession typically prevents you from winning.  While Fluxx removed these cards in 5.0 to make the game easier for those new to the game, I miss them terribly.  I miss that feeling of impending doom when I picked up a Creeper when I was one turn away from winning the game and wracking my brain trying to figure out how to get rid of it ASAP.I would say the 4.0 version of Fluxx was a 4.5 star game.  The 5.0 version of Fluxx is a 3.5 or 4 star game.  I still love the idea, game play, and portablity of Fluxx and have been eyeballing the Holiday Fluxx (my child has been eyeballing the Cartoon Network Fluxx) for our next Fluxx purchase.

I love Coffee-mate's sweet sugary creamer. I rank the refrigerated stuff (especially the Sweet Cream flavor) as a must-have every morning with my coffee. At work, we are forced to buy our own creamer (boo) and the fridge theives are always using my bottle. I've tried the shelf-stable Coffee-mate in the past and haven't loved it as much. Now this gem is fantastic! Not as great as the fridge stuff but much better than its non-concentrated counterpart. It has the added bonus of being easy to hide in my desk drawer from the fridge theives. I will buy this over and over again!

A couple years ago I had another brand of personal blender that did not blend nearly as smoothly and died within a few weeks of occasional use.  While this personal blender is not for hot food or anything else other than a smoothie/milkshake, what it does, it does so so well.Pros:- Blends so smoothly and no "ice chunks" are left in the smoothie.- The smoothie is made inside the travel cup. I have a big and amazing blender but there are excess dishes to wash when all I want is a smoothie. The Fusion Blade Personal Blender is perfect and, because it is so convenient, I find that I've been making many more healthy smoothies at home (I'm saving money and I'm eating better!).- The On/Off button just needs to be pressed and does not need to be held down which gives you time to put your fruit/milk/etc. away while your smoothie is blending.- Suction cup feet on the blender make it extremely stable on the counter.- Measurements are listed on the side of the container so you can have a consistent smoothie every time.- The cup is leak-proof and the lid snaps closed and open so it doesn't flop around when you are walking or drinking.- There is a place you can hook the travel cup to a carabiner to attach it to your/your child's backpack or gym bag.- Easy clean up.  Just throw in the dishwasher!Cons:- None yet.  I will update if I have any issues.

Our family loves card/dice/board games and every year it is a tradition to have at least one Mensa Select game under the Christmas tree.  Why Mensa Select games?  Well, for the most part, they are easy to learn but hard to master.  Our family does not like games that do not require some degree of strategy and intellect to win.  We own the majority of the Mensa Select winners and they are our absolute favorites.  I highly recommend you check out all the present and past winners to fill your family's game closet.As for Gravwell:Design: Beautiful graphics on the box and board.  One star lost for the cheap pawns (spaceships) as one spaceship came off its pedestal during normal game play. Nothing a dot of super glue won't fix but still, it should have held up past a couple minutes of moving around the board.Rules:  They are actually quite simple once you get through the back story and examples of play.  It took me a couple reads to tease out the actual rules.  We played the first game as a practice round.  After that, we did not need to reference the rules again.  Nothing is more of a fun-killer than having to go back to the rules a dozen or more times during a game.Game play: We all enjoyed the simple rules and the difficult mastery.  It is fun to predict what you think your opponent(s) will play and you *must* base your move on what you believe they will do next.Overall, a good game deserving of the Mensa Select award.  Not completely addicting like some in our closet but a game we will surely pull out and add to our rotation.

I bought this, despite the bad reviews, since it was on clearance for less than 1/3 of the MSRP.  After 1 Month:Pros:- Easy set up.  I turned the lights in my house off and closed the blinds (per a recommendation of another review) and it paired with my iPhone/WiFi/Wink Hub immediately- Has counted all my money correctly thus far- No Disconnects thus far- My iPhone immediately alerts me if my pig has been turned upside down- I love that I can change the color of the piggy noseCons:- The motion detection does not work (this is different than when the piggy is flipped upside down, which does work)- I wish the app kept track of how many pennies/nickles/dimes/quarters were in the pig rather than just the entire total- Taking the head off, which you will need to do to change the batteries, is extremely difficult.  On one hand, it is good since the money is stored in the same opening as the head is connected to... on the other hand, get ready to pull and grab and scream.

I was hoping to replace my Apple Airport Extreme (2011 version) with the Linksys AC1750 to have access to the new and faster technology.  While the performance of the router gave greatly increased speeds and response time on my AC compatible tech, the router did not reach areas of my home that the older Airport Extreme did.  Unfortunately, I need a router that will work in all areas of my home and this router did not do the job.  It would be a 5 star router if it had the reach since I did not experience any drops in signal and it was easy to set up and tweak.  Due to the limited range, I am giving it 3 stars.

Screen protectors are, in my opinion, a necessity. We own a ton of screens in this house and I learned early on that if the screen isn't protected, it WILL get scratched. I also learned the easiest way to get them on without dust bubbles.  Head into the bathroom with the protector kit and tape, close the door, run a hot shower and let the room get nice and steamy.  Dust can't float around in the thick steamy air.  Apply the protector and work out the bubbles.  If for some reason you see a tiny piece of dust that is creating a bubble, use the tape to lift the corner of the protector and use another piece of tape (not your oily fingers) to remove the speck of dust. I've always been successful with this method.  Sure, it takes a bit of time but saves the frustration of all the infuriating dust bubbles.This screen protector does its job and is a good quality.  It went on easily enough using the method above.

I spend about 5 days a week at the beach watching my child surf.  There are some Saturdays where I spend the 3-5 hours on my phone catching up on emails, reading articles, calling distant relatives, etc. This is perfect for those weekends when I need a recharge to keep going. More importantly, this charger got me through a 14 hour blackout last week.  I used my iPhone to light the bathroom, find a lighter for my candles, get a hold of the electrical company, and the alarm woke me up in time for work.  The AmazonBasics battery charger completely charged my iPhone with plenty of leftover battery to spare.Super easy to use and I'm loving it so far!

I've had these for months and I keep purchasing more and more.  They are almost the same price as plain ol' LED bulbs but with the added bonus of working with my smart home.  I run everything through the Wink Hub and they have worked flawlessly since day one.Why smart bulbs?You can still use a light switch to turn them off and on (so necessary for day-to-day use) but you will need the light switch in the "on" position to control the lights from your smartphone.You can turn the lights off/on or dim them right from your smartphone.You can create shortcuts/scenes ("Reading in Bed" or "Watching a Movie") from your smart phone. One click on your shortcut/scene and you can make various lights brighten, dim, turn off and turn on.You can set your bedroom lights up on a schedule to jar you awake in the morning (it has made getting out of bed so much faster, though slightly more painful, for me).You can set up a geofence so when you leave your house in the morning for work, all the lights in the house go off.You can set up a "random" schedule for lights to go on and off throughout the home while on vacation so it appears the house is occupied.I'm sure there are other ways people utilize these bulbs, and I'd love to hear them, but for the above reasons these bulbs are worth much more than $15 a piece to me.

This is a very nice, thick and snug fitting case.  The Kindle Fire snaps in securely and I can't imagine it ever falling out.  Even with me shaking and shaking, it held tight.  There is no need to take the Fire out since the case has access to the charging port and all of the buttons, however, I attempted to take the Fire out of the case and found it extremely difficult.  A great sign that the Fire isn't going to ever go flying out in the future.The fact the case is reversible is ingenious.  You can use the fabric side if you want an interesting design or, if you are storing the case somewhere it could possibly get dirty (ex. beach bag), flip it around and the faux leather side makes it easy to wipe down.With all the pros, the only con is that when put in "standing" position, it doesn't hold well enough to stand up to a bump. While sitting on a stable surface, like a desk, it stays up, however, in a car or plane or somewhere else it may get jostled, it may collapse.  For my needs,  I am extremely happy with the case but it did lose a star for the precarious standing position.

This truly is an amazing pan that reduces clean up by allowing us to eat out of one pan.  I can make a "fancy" omelet (goat cheese, feta, sundried tomatoes, onions, Tapatio) in one section for me and, in another section, an omelet with bacon and cheese for the kid.  Before, I would have to get out a few pans to make the same meal.  Since I am unable to eat beef and pork, I would need a separate pan to fry the bacon and cook the meaty omelet.Pros:- The omelet was so much fluffier in this pan with the steam option than I have ever made in a typical pan.- Only one pan to clean for four different "meals."  For example, it can make a meat version, a veggie version, a cheesy version and an herb version.  Hate rosemary but your significant other loves it? Super easy.  Same with making a spicy and non spicy version for the adults and kids.  One person allergic to cheese? It keeps it all separate in the same pan.- So fast!  Cooks fish and eggs in just a couple minutes while keeping it tender/fluffy/etc.- Cooks evenly.  I was worried that due to the size of the pan, one cup may get burnt while the other remained uncooked.  It was great at distributing the heat and each section turned out beautifully.Cons:- None.

I love my Rabbit corkscrew.Seriously. I. Love. It.I mean, it makes access to, and opening, wine so easy. What's not to love?I was excited to see how this, relatively inexpensive, preserver held up to my expectations of the "Rabbit" name.Overall, I am fairly happy with the results. It keeps my open bottle fresher for a couple extra days and it is fairly simple to use. You do need to put some downward force on the unit when using it to get a decent seal but once you do, you'll start feeling the difference in pressure. My only wish is that I knew when to stop pumping. I don't want to break anything so I take my best guess.... but in the back of my mind I think, "Just one more to be sure?"

I wasn't expecting these to perform as well as they did. I used regular old-fashioned chalk and it wrote beautifully across the surface. Additionally, I placed the sticker on and pulled it off of a plastic tub (the type found on rolling carts with plastic drawers), off a mirror and off a smooth metal tin. Each time the sticker came off beautifully and re-stuck without leaving gunk behind.Extremely happy and have found so many uses for these!

I was thrilled to get this as the potluck season approaches.  The prepared trays of cheeses/crackers/meats or veggies/dip are always so overpriced and often dried out after being cut and sitting for days waiting for someone to purchase them.  Making my own cheap, easy (last minute!) party platter is great!Sadly, while the outer container (lid and base) are thick enough not to bend much, the inner "dip" container arrived crushed.  It is thinner than a container you would find at your local dollar store and since mine arrived crushed, the lid won't screw on.  I have tried manipulating the plastic and was able to get the lid screwed on without dip/sauce inside but I can't/won't do it when there is something inside (I don't want to put my fingers in everyone's dip trying to get a lid on!).For now, I am covering the dip container with press-n-seal wrap and putting the lid on top of the wrap without screwing it on.  I am hoping to find a replacement container that will fit.Even with the internal container causing problems, I still really like the outer so much that I will keep it and probably use it several times a month for all the work parties/potlucks/bonfires I go to.I am already planning my next few platter ideas:- Different varieties of apples with caramel sauce- Veggies and pita chips with hummus- Crusty Bread and crackers with spinach dip- Chips and mini quesadilla triangles with guacamole- Shrimp and cocktail sauce- Crackers and veggies with blue cheese pecan dip- Chicken wings and blue cheese dressing

I'm so torn on this product.  On one hand, it sinks right into my skin with no greasy or lotion-y after feel.  My powder glides right on top of it without sticking or caking or changing the color or getting too thick.  It has made a difference on my fine lines (I'm still young enough I don't have the biggies yet).  It is in a pump container (no sticking my fingers in a pot!). It is organic to top it all off.So what's the downside?  The price.  It is only 1oz of product (though the huge pump would lead you to believe there is a ton more in there).  If I had a much larger disposable income, I would absolutely use this under my makeup everyday.  I hate that I love it...

Paying $60.99 for a $50.00 gift card is ridiculous.  It saddens me that Amazon allows this.There are so many other options out there that you can take to pay $50 for steam content:Buy content off Steam, directly, either for yourself or use the 'gift' option to give it to someone else.Buy a Steam Digital Wallet Code for $20, $50, or $100 (and actually pay that price) at Paypal Digital Gifts and send it to someone or use it yourself.Buy a GameStop gift card from Amazon, and go to a local GameStop and buy a steam gift card for the same price.Skip the Amazon step and go straight to GameStop and buy the Steam card.And I am sure there are many other options.  Anything but this.Just don't get scammed.  Every time someone gets scammed here, an angel loses her wings...

As usual, Anker impresses me.  I have purchased a great many Anker products in the past, mainly due to the perfect combination of amazing quality and affordable pricing.  Among them:Anker New Laptop Battery for Dell Inspiron 1525 1526 1545 PP29L PP41L Series, Fits P/N X284G M911 M911G GW240 GP952 RN873 K450N RU586 C601H 312-0844 (this item)Anker 5-Port Desktop Usb Charger with PowerIQ Technology, 40-Watt, Black (Twice.  One upstairs, one downstairs.)Anker® 2nd Gen Astro E4 13000mAh External Battery Portable Dual USB Charger Power Bank. PowerIQ™Anker® Astro Mini 3000mAh Ultra-Compact Portable Charger Lipstick-Sized External Battery Power Bank PackAnker® Uspeed USB 3.0 Card Reader 8-in-1 for SDXC, SDHC, SD, MMC, RS-MMC, Micro SDXC, Micro SD, Micro SDHC CardAnker® 8000 DPI High Precision Programmable Laser Gaming Mouse for PC, 9 Programmable Buttons, Weight Tuning Cartridges, Omron Micro SwitchesAnker® Golden AC Adapter + Power Supply Cord for Laptop Dell Inspiron 15(1545) 14(1440) 13(1318) 1551 1557; Dell XPS M1330; fits PA-21 XK850 NX061 RMAnker® New Ultra High Capacity Laptop Battery [9-cell / 7800mAh] for Dell Inspiron 1525 1526 1545 PP29L PP41L(all of the above from Amazon)So please trust that I am a serious Anker lover. Anker has always provided serious quality at amazing prices. Hopefully they keep up the good work and do not hike up prices like many other established companies tend to do (although since they haven't after all this time, I don't see why they  would now).As for this battery, I am replacing the last Anker battery I bought December 5th, 2012 ( I had to look that up and it amazed me that it has been that long).  The only reason I am replacing it is because I dropped my laptop and broke off part of the battery (the little tab that connects it to the laptop, which is apparently crucial).  The battery was still working until I broke it, though obviously not as well as when it was first bought.  Still it did hold a charge for several hours at a time until that fateful day when my laptop went tumbling down, thankfully no crowns or pails of water involved.Basically, I appreciate Anker. Like Amazon, they do not disappoint (so far). #fingers crossed

(a couple of season 5 spoilers included, so please proceed with caution)Great show!  These characters are so complex and layered.  So dynamic.  So substantial.  It is usually hard to tell what they will do and many instances on this show have caught me completely by surprise, which has me hooked.The delicate relationship between Boyd and Raylan has made them my favorite frenemies on television or film by far.  Olyphant's character (Raylan Givens) walks a fine line between good and bad (and sometimes even stumbles over it) and usually I want him to succeed except for the few occasions I actually want him to fail.  Usually when it comes to Boyd.  Oddly enough, I almost always want Boyd to win anything he does.  Such a deeply conflicted character.  He has certain honorable ideals, and yet he has his ALWAYS criminal lifestyle.  And Boyd has come such a long way from the season one old distant almost friend coworker to Raylan, less than loyal brother, and "all around bad guy who robbed banks and was just rather second rate" to a criminal 'almost' kingpin who is deeply devoted to his longtime girlfriend (and now ex) and even pretty loyal to his frenemy and knows how to handle himself in just about any situation.The characters have alliances and friendships that may change based on the situation.  Even Raylan is far from the man he was in season 1.  Back then it was all about the law, with a few caveats when it came to his home town and its occupants.  Now he is looking to the future and his career and his ability to care for his family.  Which actually makes him less likeable in some way, though not enough to make him unlikeable.  The man is still amazing.As for supporting characters, I cannot believe how incredible the supporting cast is from year to year.  And not just the regular characters but the one-season ones as well.  Time and again I have been shocked by the calibur of actor that has been killed off after first appearing, reminiscent of that first scene in Scream where one of the title characters just up and dies on us.  Seasonally, really great actors and characters have appeared and 'exited' all while my jaw brushes the ground.  All of it clearly well thought out by the writers.  And the ones that stick around are pretty amazing as well.  High quality, great acting.Speaking of which, this group of writers is so on point.  Their dialogue is perfect.  It is realistic while also being incredibly dark and sardonic, sometimes funny, sarcastic, curt, ridiculous (when appropriate for the character), and always reflective of the individual speaking.  The storyline is gripping and both engaging and repellent (in the 'I am glad I am not there but I just can't stop watching' sort of way).All in all, one of the best shows ever created and continues to be great even now.  I now there is one season left but my heart wants more.

Wow!  The smell of this stuff is so amazing.  I really wish I could just eat it.  It isn't that sickly sweet cough syrup cherry.  It is actually a great scent.As for the purpose, it also makes my lips feel soft and smooth and protects me from the elements.Oh, one last note, it has disappeared from my purse.  With three daughters, who knows who has it.  Going to have to go sniff it out...

This ribbon is beautiful and will add some depth and substance to any craft work.  I love the natural color and consistency of this muslin.  The edges will continue to fray with wear so adding some sort of adhesive to sections will help, especially in places that will not be visible.  For my needs, this ribbon works well in art projects such as scrapbook pages, handmade frames, and home decor.  I think it might be a bit too wide for use in cardmaking.  It is 9.8 feet long (3 meters) and about 2 inches wide if you are including the frayed edges and 1 3/4 inches wide if only counting the center without the fray.  I love that the spool is solid wood (feels substantial) and it comes with a pearl tipped pin.  Useful and pretty... who could ask for more?I added two images to show the ribbon, the spool, the pin, and the fray.  Hopefully this helps.

These are non-GMO and taste absolutely amazing.  They are great for parties, for snacking, for anything.  Personally I love serving these crackers with some nice cheeses, a little fruit, some nuts, and a little wine on the side.  They are rather large (about three inches in diameter).  All in all, we love them.

Works well but does get dirty pretty fast for me.  I love the feel and the superhero/comic book theme.  I just wish the colors were a bit more adult, subtle, muted.  Also, the design should have been put at an angle so the image is different all the way around.  Right now there are a number of heroes you can see, and a number that you never get to see because they end up on the back.  If the fabric was cut at an angle instead of straight that would not be an issue.It works wonderfully and was not too hard to put on.
Amazing music.  Mellow, relaxing, perfect.  I think this might be my favorite song to relax to.

A bit retro but very entertaining.  I was very pleased to find out that Bill Murray is a legitimate basketball player, not just comic relief.  Although, I must say, he is some pretty amazing comic relief.The animation was fun and entertaining.  Not state of the art today but it was when it was made.  Keep in mind this movie came out almost two decades ago.The story was cute, silly, exciting, and fun.This is definitely a kids movie, or for those of us who are kids at heart.Plot:Aliens arrive to steal the talent from top NBA players so they can make lots of space money.  Michael Jordan enlists the help of cartoon characters to steal back their talent.  Fun ensues.

Delicious tasting pineapple chunks.  These arrived quickly and were fresh as can be for a canned product.  It is also nice to have pineapple on hand at all times to toss into salads, fruit cups, smoothies, and to eat just fresh out of the can.  I also love that this product has no added sugar at all.  Just fresh pineapple and fresh pineapple juice.  Yum!

My absolute favorite car freshener.  Friends have commented on the pretty 'necklace' that my car wears which I love but really it is all about the scent.  This freshener is both powerful and yummy.  At times the scent is so yummy I am tempted to taste it.  I have been able to restrain myself but on an empty stomach it is a stretch.  All in all, it is a pleasure to get in my car.I am on my second of these.  The first lasted a good number of months.  I will update after the second one now that I can track how long it is up.

Perfect.  My daugher needed a wristlet for her birthday outfit for a night out with the girls and this one fit the bill.  It is large enough to fit her cards and cell phone (samsung galaxy s5) but will be easy to keep with her and not get lost.  She is a huge Harry Potter fan and loves the fact that the pattern looks like HP lightning bolts.  As girly as she has gotten there is no expelling the geek inside.  Love it!The quality is typical of Fossil.  Great quality at a great price.  I can't be happier.

Amazing.  The scents from this line are amazing and gentle.  They clean wonderfully.  I can attest to the fact that this stuff has great cleaning power and here is the list of ingredients for more info.Ingredients (from website):Water, sodium lauryl sulfate (plant-derived cleaning agent), glycerin (plant-derived foam stabilizer), lauramine oxide (plant-based cleaning agent), caprylyl/myristyl glucoside (plant-derived cleaning agent), magnesium chloride (mineral-based viscosity modifier), citric acid (plant-derived water softener), benzisothiazolinone and methylisothiazolinone (synthetic preservatives).Fragranced with plant-based essential oils and botanical extracts*Lavender Floral & Mint: Cananga odorata (ylang ylang) flower oil, citrus aurantifolia (lime) oil, citrus aurantium dulcis (orange) oil, lavandula hybrida (lavandin) oil, mentha piperita (peppermint) oil, and mentha viridis (spearmint) leaf oil.

Not the best suction.  This thing keeps slipping and can be somewhat annoying.  Other than that I love this thing.  It is so pretty and convenient.  I wish the suction cups were better but I still use this every day.

Disclaimer: There are no babies in our home.These are the best wipes ever.  They are gentle.  They are not scented.  They are durable.  I use them not just in every bathroom but also in my bedroom for any craft projects I work on and I always keep a pack in the car.  Those are the ones that get used most often.  Seriously, I can't imagine not having them in the car.I have tried other wipes and wetnaps.  I have even tried feminine wipes.  Nothing compares to these.  The wipes are so strong and durable you can reuse the same one over and over again just by rinsing it, which I have done many times when using them to clean off acrylic stamps.The odors that come along with other wipes really turn me off.  They can be so strong and perfume-y.  Ugh.  These don't have that issue at all.  They are slightly scented, I assume just from the ingredients.  No scent has been added at all and you can barely tell they even have a scent.  Basically you have to put them up to your nose to smell anything.  These aren't tissue, so really how often will that ever happen?These new packs also have free travel packs included so you can keep a pack in your purse for emergencies or in case you have to use a public restroom.  Believe me, you would rather have these and have to lug them around in case of an emergency than get stuck in a public restroom with no bathroom tissue.  Ew!Hope this helps!

These boots are wonderful.  They did hurt the first time I wore them but after breaking them in I have had no issues.  They are waterproof and hold terrain very well.  They also match pretty much any outfit.  I have used them on boulders and large rocks that are up to roughly 60 degree angles and terrain steeper than that and they have not let me down yet.  I have enjoyed using them on numerous hikes and they have so far kept me safe and dry.  Fingers crossed this continues.I am in Southern California and consider these my 'winter' hiking boots.  However, winter for me is nothing like winter in other parts of the world, so take that with a grain of salt.All in all, these have been just what I needed.  Hope this helps!

These hiking boots were so much more comfortable the first time I wore then than the Columbia boots I bought (also on Amazon - Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot) roughly at the same time.  I wore these for the first time for a 5 mile hike in Long Beach and they were great.  My feet felt great.  The hike felt relatively easy.  I was in heaven.After the second time I wore these shoes, the little cloth tab the holds the laces near the top of the boot broke open and released my laces.  Somehow, that does not fill me with confidence on the life of these boots.  Meanwhile, the Columbia boots are wonderful.  Had to break them in.  They kinda hurt the first time I wore them but after that they were great.  They are high quality and satisfying.I am kinda torn now.  I love the comfort but how do I give a great review to a pair of hiking boots that lasted all of one hike.  I mean I can still wear them and sometimes do, but I do have to forego that top level of lacing.  Fingers crossed nothing else goes wrong as these are the summer breathable hiking boots as opposed to the Columbia winter, waterproof hiking boots.

Update 8/26/2015:These socks are my favorites.  They stay in place, never slide down.  They are soft and cozy, but not too thick (great for California weather).  I use them when I go hiking, and I have never been disappointed.  The waffle weave and actually very comfy.  I need to buy more of these.  I do have to say, I usually prefer ankle socks.  I used to hate anything higher than ankle length, because I felt the socks always either fit too tight or slid down too easily.  These do neither.  I don't end up with marks on my skin from where they would strangle my legs like other crew socks.  And I don't have to worry about them either sliding down my leg or sliding into my shoes.  After two hours hiking in Eaton Canyon, they are still where I placed them and my feet feel great.  That is probably why these are my favorites.Original Review:We have been an organic eating household for a few years now and have recently started transitioning to more organic 'wear' as well. I was hesitant to buy these as I thought they might not feel good considering the waffle knit pattern and how much I am used to wearing 'smooth' material socks, but these socks feel great.From what I have learned, PACT is an ethical and organic company.  It is also a Fair Trade company, as well as qualifying for many other ethical and ecological high quality standards.I have recently learned that being organic is not only good for your body, it is good for the workers who process the ingredients put into these items.  For too long workers picking non-organic ingredients have been exposed to inhumane toxic substances while they are harvesting these very ingredients.  They actually get sprayed with pesticides and other products while in the fields!  By choosing organic, we can help make sure the standard of living for these workers improves, as well as our own health and well-being.  It's win-win!

My hummingbirds love this.  I have about 6 of them that like to come by my garden and when my flowers are not providing enough nectar, this little item does the job.For nectar I mix 4 parts water with 1 part sugar in a pot and heat to boiling.  Then let it sit til it cools.  Then fill the feeder and watch the hummingbirds go nuts.My only challenge is that ants love to come by and steal some nectar.  Developing a system now to keep them out.  Wish me luck!

We have been using this for years.  It does a fantastic job of keeping our skin looking clear and clean and much younger than it should look.  I would not use anything else.  You don't even have to use a lot.  One bottle will last me personally 9 months.  That comes to just over $10 a month.  Well worth the price for the effects.

These are absolutely adorable.  They look so good on the board and add that little touch of 'special' to any project.  My daughter loves them!  So far they have kept up wonderfully but she has only had them a month so if anything bad happens I will update this review.

Despite being labeled Italian Herb breadcrumbs, these breadcrumbs have little flavor.  However, being that we have gone organic and these are the only ones I can find, I absolutely appreciate that they exist.  To give them more traditional Italian breadcrumb taste I just add a LOT of Italian blend organic dried herbs to the mix when I am preparing anything, sometimes more and sometimes less depending on what I happen to be making at the time.  I also find this mix to be a little lumpier/clumpier than the kind I used to buy, so I will sometimes run these through the food processor or put them through my mortar & pestle to give them the right consistency.Some options for uses:Fried anything (chicken, shrimp, fish, veggies)Milanese (beef, chicken...)Baked breaded anything (chicken, veggies, fish...)Casserole topping for just about any casseroleMac and cheese toppingMeatloafMeatballs (turkey, beef, pork...)Toppings for just about anything bakedGeez, not the healthiest list but so many more options out there and now I am a little hungry so good luck!
This product is very cheaply made.  Two of the items broke (the plastic cracked) while placing them on the wall.  I would not recommend this to anyone.

I purchased these for a bulletin board for my daughter and she absolutely loves them.  They are so pretty and detailed.  There are 4 designs and I know the title says 15 total but I was actually sent 5 of each design for a total of 20 pushpins.  I don't know if that means the description is wrong or if I was sent extras so please don't be upset with me if you don't receive 20 (but fingers crossed!).  Furthermore, they came in this cute plastic box (pictured) with a little foam on the bottom so they are all popped up and adorable looking.  At the bottom of the box is the business card for Norma Jean Designs which will make finding them again much easier.  Thank you!

My daughter is an avid archer and when putting together a bulletin board for her room, this seemed the obvious choice.  However her favorite color is pink so I was disappointed these did not come in more colors.  Instead, a little pink acrylic paint and tiny paintbrush later and they are absolutely perfect.  She didn't even know I painted them.  After painting a target on her cork board in the same color, it was the perfect addition.As for the actual product, I had no trouble handling them and she has used them multiple times and they are holding up well.  I know another reviewer mentioned they broke, so I was a little worried.  I don't know if painting them made them more sturdy/durable but so far so good and she could not be happier.They are small, cute, and they look so good on the board.  The points are pretty sharp and pierce well.  All in all, very happy with the look of these arrows/pushpins.
They helped me get a new keyboard because the one a previously had broke. No hassle and it took about a week for me to get my new one. Definitely recommend this item and this company.

This item is the perfect addition to our teatime parties.  The images are lovely and so elegant and the edges are so beautifully adorned.  It is also easy to clean but you have to be gentle and careful.  Beware if you are clumsy.  This feels like it will chip or break with any harsh handling or bumping against any other items.The only downside I have found is that it can unscrew quite easily if you are not being careful.  I tend to handle it like it is an explosive and just watch every step when using this.  Then again, I tend to be clumsy so I have to be extra careful.  It has a loop on top to carry with but I always hold the base as well.  Seriously, I walk like it will blow at any moment.  It is both funny and sad.  Still, very lovely and always impressive.  Not the walking, just this lovely 3-tiered server.

My daughter loved this.  She loves wolves and normally doesn't anything too flashy but despite the picture, the image on this purse is actually more subtle and natural looking.  She uses it often enough for me to know she is not just being nice when she tells me she loves it.

I recently made my daughter a bulletin board for her room.  She is a huge Sherlock fan so I used fabric in the pattern of the sherlock wallpaper (in the famous scene where he shoots at the wall) and then hand painted the yellow smilie to scale.  Then I embellished it with famous sherlock quotes and some antique-y looking british-y embellishments and used these clever bullet pushpins to put up all the quotes and even put a few on the smilie.  She absolutely loved it and adored the pushpins.  The whole project made her cry with happiness, not to mention posting on social media.  These pushpins really put it over the top.  Perfection.The only downside I can see is that they were so oily when I first opened the package and one was also dirty/rusty.  I had to do a pit of cleaning and polishing before they could be used or even handled.

When I bought this originally it was 4 sheets of grape.  I loved it.  I used my Cricut to cut out a fancy shape in different sizes and put them on all of my pantry clear glass containers to label everything and make everything look cohesive despite being different sizes and shapes.  Thanks to these labels, everything looks amazing and as if it were a single set of containers.I only have two complaints.1. The sheets were shipped in a container that did not fit the 12" length and so the sheets were folded in half.  This ruined some of the paper.2. The color I originally ordered was grape and now that I need more there is no grape available in this 4 sheet pack.  However, this same company has grape in a two sheet of the same size for the same price as the 4 sheet.  Basically, I now have to pay double for the same amount.  From reading the reviews on the 2 sheet pack they are still shipped in too small a package for the length of the paper and are either rolled or folded in half.

This product met my expectations with regard to flavor, but really killed my wallet with regard to price based on the tiny amount it yielded.  I can get organic cashews for less at Whole Foods.  However, since these are Non-GMO verified, and the ones at Whole Foods haven't met that standard just yet, this is probably the safer bet for now.If I could, I would give the Non-GMO Verified website 5 stars because they make finding these foods so easy and painless.

I gave this journal to my daughter and she loves it.  It has a soft, padded/cushioned cover with a beautiful etched design that wraps around to the back.  The journal is pretty big (6-7/8 x 9-2/3 x 1-1/4 inches) and she can write quite a bit on each page.  The pages are lightly lined and pretty lovely.  They are also perforated in case you wanted to remove any pages.  All in all, lovely.

Infusium leaves our hair feeling so healthy and is a great alternative to gel or mousse.  Since it is a leave in conditioner, it actually helps maintain the health of our hair while it helps style it.  After a shower, when our hair is still wet, we put a little of this into our hair before we brush it.  Then we just let our hair naturally dry (but I think you can blow dry it too if you prefer) with a clip holding it together.  When our hair is totally dry, drop the clip and it looks like you just stepped out of a salon.  Smells wonderful, too.  Amazing stuff and your health stays SO healthy, shiny, beautiful.  And this is from someone who washes her hair pretty much every day.One caution...if you put enough and you try to brush your hair later when it is dry, it will flake.  However, I think the same happens with other hair products so that should be a given.  Anyway, hope this helps!

I ordered these assuming they were organic (because organic is in the title) but upon reading the ingredients list I was very disappointed.  Here is the list for those of you interested:Organic unbleached wheat flourOrganic sugarOrganic figsCORN SYRUPOrganic palm fruit oilWaterNatural flavorsLeavening (sodium bicarbonate, monocalcium phosphate)Non-fat dry milkSaltSoy Lecithin (an emulsifier)Among other shady ingredients (like soy lecithin) is CORN SYRUP.  How can something with corn syrup be organic when corn and soy are the two most genetically modified foods in the United States?

These speakers were just as great as the reviews said they were, for the first few months.  Then they would start to cut out and now they no longer work.  They worked well for the first two months.  The next couple months they would work some days and not others.  The last month they have not worked AT ALL.  I only purchased them just over six months ago.  Now I am shopping for new speakers.  Do not waste your money on these.Also, when I bought them on June 24th they were $44.99.  Now they are above $100.  Ridiculous markup for something that will not last.  Please save yourself money and frustration and let me live vicariously through you.

This carousel is plastic and lightweight.  It is not made of marble or any other nice looking material.  However, I didn't buy it for the looks.  I bought it for the function and BOY does it ever function!  I am a crafter and have had to constantly open and close drawers and compartments to reach the most often used supplies.  With this item I imagined things would get a little easier.  I had no idea how much I was missing this item until I finally bought it.  Things run so smoothly now.  Anything I can't reach I just have to spin and get.  The only items I still keep separate are my glue dots and foam tapes.  The only thing I would change about this item is to make the center a complete cup-like section instead of separated into four pie sections as it is now.  That would make this absolutely perfect.  Still, it has helped so much and been such a time saver that I still rank it at 5 stars.Despite the light weight and construction, this item does hold pretty much everything I use often and doesn't have any chance of tipping over.  The base is so wide (10.5 inches) that when loaded with all of my supplies, it's very sturdy and stable and still spins easily.  I added two images that show this carousel loaded up with crafting tools and items while it is sitting on a mat that is labeled in inches.I still can't believe how much easier things are with this item.  I hope this helps!

I really do love these (although I prefer the ones from this brand that have lace and rhinestone accents).  These come in pretty colors and have cute bow accents.  The sizes do run slightly small but not enough to be an issue.  They are comfortable and stay in place, which I have found to sometimes be an issue with other brands.  The elastic is great. The fabric is soft and smooth and feels good against my skin.  The bow sometimes digs in a bit but it depends on what position you are in and it is not too bad.  I did remove a star for this, though.  The best thing about these is the price.  Such a value.  I am not sure how durable they are but so far so good.  All in all, recommended.

Love these.  They come in pretty colors and have cute rhinestone accents.  The sizes do run slightly small but not enough to be an issue.  They are very comfortable and stay in place, which I have found to sometimes be an issue with other brands.  The elastic is great.  The fabric is soft and smooth and feels good against my skin.  Best of all the price is terrific. I am not sure how durable they are but so far so good.  All in all, recommended.

This mouthwash is great.  Tastes great and does the job it is supposed to.  The flavor is lovely and it keeps my mouth feeling fresh.  Knowing I am helping the planet by purchasing from companies that take the earth into consideration is important to me.  The only reason I did not give this product 5 stars is because the cap does not secure the liquid inside without leaking slightly.  Since the bottle is made of plastic, when you grab it you do tend to squeeze it slightly and if it is full then it will drip through the cap.  That was the problem I had with it.  The stuff inside is pure gold, though.
Great song, great music, great band!  I could not be happier.  You can youtube the song and try it out before you buy but I am glad this one is part of my collection.

We live in an area with hard water, not as hard as when I was a kid where you could leave a glass of water out and it'd turn brown from iron in an hour, but enough that it will build up in the coffee pot.  So we've been using pitchers like this for drinking for a few years.  We've been using Brita simply because the local warehouse store stocks their filters primarily and it's cheaper.It's a bit smaller than our Brita, which is slightly annoying since you have to fill it up more often. On the other hand, it takes less room in the smaller fridge in the bedroom easily.  Speaking of taste, the water is quite good.  I found it better than our tap and on par with bottled water we drink.  Of course, I pretty much find all bottled water to taste the same, so if you're particularly sensitive to a brand I'm sure you'll readily notice a difference.  The pitcher fills up quickly enough, slower than you'd probably expect if you've never used one of these, in which case don't expect to put in water and stand there waiting to fill your glass up.  You'll want to let it do its thing and chill in the refrigrator for at least 15-20 minutes ahead of time.The LED is kind of useless since it doesn't measure the water that goes through it.  It's only a timing indicator for how long they think it will run through that much water.  Our Brita has that too, though not as nice a one, and I've had water bottles that had it.  I find the best option is to just keep track on the fridge how many time you filled it or failing that, stick a piece of tape on the outside to say when you changed the filter.  The companies that make these have every incentive to be extremely conservative on how long a filter lasts so you'll buy more.  That said, if you do fill these very rarely they will "go bad" over time too.  A filter's usefulness is a factor of both time and throughput.No real complaints about the pitcher. The lid could be a little more durable, but isn't anything I'm too terribly worried about.  When measured against our old Brita, we'll probably keep using that as our primary simply due to filters being readily available in store near us and our already having a membership to that place.  If they switched to stocking PUR filters, then we'd switch to PUR.

There are two different attachments so it can be used as a full grill, full griddle, half grill/half griddle or panini maker.  We've been using it primarily for turkey panini sandwiches and grilled cheese.  The grill works fast and my wife reminded me twice to make sure I mention how easy it was for her to clean.  It's absolutely the most convenient way we've found to make sandwiches with sliced French bread or longer slices of sourdough because it's longer and doesn't fit well in a toaster and the toaster oven takes longer.There were a few little things about it that we didn't like.  The way it opens on the top, my wife pinched her hand pretty well in it.  Nothing serious, just enough to hear a yelp from the other room.  Having the control knobs on the front makes it take more space than it needs to on the counter and also make it easier to get grease in and harder to clean.  The most important thing though was the release for the top removable grill part.  The release lever jammed after only a couple of uses and she had to work at it for about ten minutes to get it out.  I then spent some time shoving it really hard into the top, ejecting it, and repeating until it seems to have worked out the kinks now.  If you have a similar issue, the release thing triggers a small moving metal piece roughly in the middle/front of the top.  You can sort of work it unstuck a little bit.It is heavy, which is a blessing and a curse.  My guess, it'll be a lot more durable than some cheaper brands, but it is a little more of a hassle to move around; it's not a major problem though.  The temp controls are great and help make the sandwiches come out the way I like them.

Here's my main qualification, and why I can't rate higher; it's loud.  Not loud across the room, but more hear it within a few feet when bending over to plug something in.  It's a weird almost hissing/crackling sound that I've never heard before.  I know some electronics make sound, but this is the first protector I've ever had this happen with and it has me freaked out.  Maybe it's normal for the device?  Maybe it's a defective one?  I don't know.  No reviews currently mention any annoying sounds.  If anybody knows, please advise.Aside from that, I like the design better than the last protector I got.  It is very attractive, the plugs are spaced well to allow for different shaped cords, and the USB ports are the icing on the cake.  Both ports together output up to 4.8 Amps which will charge even two tablets pretty quickly.  The screw that holds it into the outlet makes it harder to install, needing at least a Phillips screwdriver and in my case a flathead one too, but also means it won't pop out of the wall when you're unplugging something else.  I was happy to see it wasn't drawing extra power, even with a USB cable in, until the phone/tablet was plugged in, so no wasted power usage leaving just the cord plugged in.  The two indicator lights are directly on the front and a little bright, so might be irritating if used in the bedroom.  Pretty good all around form and function.Electrical ratings are: 15A, 125V, 60Hz, 1875WUSB Output: Combined 4.8 AmpsSurge Rating: 900 JoulesResponse Time: < 1 NanosecondMax Spike Current: 30,000AUL Clamping Voltage: 500V (UL 1449 3rd. Ed.)EMI/RFI Noise Filter: 150kHz - 100Mhz up to 40 DbThe manual is actually amusing to read for a change.  Below are a few quotes.-"Please follow these cautionary statements.  If you don't, your Studio4.8 might break, your warranty will be void, and you will be very unhappy with yourself"-"If you're feeling all handy and want to alter or repair your Studio4.8...Don't"-"...We know you're tough, but take'er easy on the mounting screw.  Over tightening = sadness..."Normal caveat I have to say for any surge protector.  I'd always suggest paying for a UPS (backup battery) for a computer system or anything really sensitive.  These MOV units are simple devices with a finite lifespan.  When the internals on these have taken the Joule rating it's got, 900 in this case, it's dead.  That can be one big spike or a lot of little ones over a long period.  Also, don't expect to collect on the $100K advertised protection.  Per their included booklet, it covers only what isn't covered by your home owner's insurance, even if you can prove everything and file a claim in time.  It's hard to mark down for that though, almost literally all cheaper protectors make those claims.  Best to figure you'll never see a cent from any of them and maybe be pleasantly surprised.

I've had some bad luck with my Dell XPS 8700 and I mean bad.  It's on its third motherboard, second hard drive, and 2nd PSU.  After the second motherboard died, I started suspecting the Dell PSU so I tried this as a cheap and well speced PSU to replace it.  I've LOVED my EVGA graphics cards and their customer service was top notch so what the heck.Well, first one came and there was a sort of ticking, but not quite ticking, sound.  Sort of an oscillating sound.  After a few hours research and watching videos on Youtube, I tracked it down to a likely bearing issue.  Not good for a 2 day old supply.  Amazon was AWESOME and took care of the shipping label and sent me a new one.  So far at least, no sound at all from the new one, though it had another minor issue.  The first fit very easily in my case.  This one took several minutes of almost forcing in and even after it clicked in place as it should, the screw hole on one side is slightly off.  It still screws in, so it works, but definitely not quite right.Time will tell, but thus far I'm not overly impressed with the quality control so I have some worry it will die prematurely.  As to actual operation, it seems good enough.  No issues yet with my system the past few hours and it feels heavy and solid.  The cords are plentiful and sleeved, but almost too long.  Good to have ones for the video card and a couple of the motherboard ones that power the CPU, but I found it hard to find places for all of them.  Maybe next time I'll go moduler.

We got one of these to try out because we live in a populated area and over the air used to work with our old TV, but the new one needs an antenna.  Anyway, we got NBC all blocky and dropping every 30 seconds or so, about 4-5 different Spanish language shows, and some old movie channel.  Not impressed in the slightest.  Returned it to the store.

I love the first Magicka game on PC.  It was a surprise hit that blew me away with its humor and the things it nailed just like I always wanted to do as a kid, namely the way it does shields.  Though I like the rest as well.Android games tend to be massively inferior to even the old Gameboy Advance games of ages ago due simply to the fact the controls stink.  You can't have a precision game where you can't feel a real button since you're looking down at the keys so much.  It means you either have to have almost turn based style, along the lines of Plants vs. Zombies or Angry Birds, or you have to make the enemies react slower so there's time for the player to find buttons.  Magicka does the latter.  It's a pretty easy game that's still fun and humorous.

My wife is Asian and we tend to eat a lot of rice with our meals.  The first thing she was interested in after we opened the box was the pot part.  I think maybe it's cultural, but she swears that a thicker pot makes the rice taste better.  She was delighted by the thickness of this one and wanted to make sure it was the first thing I listed.  I don't know if it's the pot or the settings, but the rice turned out great.The construction is solid and the buttons sealed so they won't get any water or gunk in them.  The design is attractive and we both liked the color.  The box it came in was gigantic and I was worried at first glance, until I opened it and took the cooker out and found it was only a little larger than our old rice cooker.  Despite being a little bigger than desired, it does make up for it by taking the place of a crock pot and rice cooker.  I mentioned that we'd got a new one and showed a lady at work.  She just looked at it on Amazon and is talking about buying one herself.The primary use for this one will be a rice cooker, but it's also getting a fair amount of use for pot roast.  It was also good for steaming those buns with the red bean paste in them.  It's been good that it's simple to operate from the black and white instruction sheet so we could get up and running without too much effort.  The 70 something full color cookbook included has a lot of simple looking recipes we're going to try out after we deal with a recent death in the family.The only thing that was a little frustrating was trying to figure out the buttons on the front without the little guide.  I got frustrated that I couldn't get it to go to the right time I wanted, but it turned out to be my own fault for hitting the preset button instead of the one I wanted.  She also thought it wasn't doing anything because we couldn't tell immediately if it had started heating or not.  So basically, after trying it out briefly and actually reading the instructions, no problems getting it to work as expected.

First off, never do their automatic renewal if you get it.  I've head horror stories about their payment partner and you'll nearly always get a worse deal.  Heck, today they have a 6 month free offer if you look on the SlickDeals website.  If you buy via Amazon or another seller you're better off.  I've never had a problem with billing doing it that way and while rebates were really slow they haven't cheated me out of one yet.One thing I do like about Bitdefender is they give you the option to upgrade to the latest version if you still have a valid key.  So you can now get the 2016 version by buying the last version and save some money.  To the reviewer who got the bad copy of the disk, you can use your code and activate a download a copy from their site.So, for the actual 2015 (and 2016 so far) performance here are the pros and cons.Pro:-Detection is great.-Very good at detecting and removing stuff.-Rated among the highest.-Cheap if you can find it on sale.Con:-Can drag an older system to the ground.-Can drag a newer system to the ground, be prepared to do repair installs every few months.-Slightly weird interface makes it hard to find things.-Web based tool doesn't remotely reflect reality of the machines it's supposedly monitoring.

These are thicker than the ones we had before and not that much higher priced.  It's stupid and irrelevant, but the fake metal box just looks pretty cool sitting in the closet.  I use fairly often for things like cleaning the gutters so we don't have a hanging garden like the neighbors and past ones shredded pretty quickly, but to be fair aren't called heavy duty.  These held out quite a bit longer to scraping against the tiles on the roof so I'm moderately impressed.  My tactile sensitivity wearing them is slightly less, but that would be due to being slightly thicker.They're powder free so if you're borderline sensitive maybe it helps.  I don't have even a mild latex allergy so really don't consider it much.  I got the medium size and it fits well, except the fingers have a little bit more length to them so I kind of look like the wicked witch of the west.  Not a big thing, just slightly less comfortable.

I'm not certain the height range this is for, but it seems better for slightly below average.  The wife and I are 5'5" and 5'6" and didn't find it uncomfortable, but the resting sitting position due to the lumbar support is sort of a head lying back rested on the back that's not really a position you'd do work in.  I feel kind of like a king holding court from his thrown.  The arm rests dig into my arms after a while.  For home use in front of the computer it's not an issue.  For 8 hours a day at work, I can't see it being very comfortable.I have no real problems with the cheap fake leather stuff used to cover it. Actual leather chairs will tend to crack and break eventually.  A friend of mine had one where the arm cracks were scraping up his arm.  Synthetic shouldn't have that problem, but also don't look or feel as good.  If I'm wearing shorts and it's hot/humid then I stick to it when getting up.  It's got quite a bit of chrome, so plan on wiping finger prints.  Adjustments are limited to up/down and tilt tension control.  Base is wide enough to be stable, but is a little larger than your average door so we had  to twist a little bit getting into a door.  Really wish I'd built it in the room it will reside, but not a major hassle.The box size is reasonably compact and packed well.  Given there was a giant whole torn in the package from what appears to be bad shippers, I was initially worried, but everything survived intact.  Getting the parts out was easy and things were better protected than I'd expected with lots of protective wrapping.  The instructions are cartoons, probably so they don't have to pay for translations, and go from a couple basic steps, to figure out how the heck we did stuff in between these to steps, to fully finished chair.Assembly was the worst I've had to do with a chair.  You need a Phillips or flat head screwdriver and an included Allen wrench to do it.  Plan on it taking at least half an hour, and unless you're a skilled contortionist, two people.  The top part is pretty easy, until you get to attaching the back to the bottom.  The wholes are nearly impossible to line up without someone pushing down hard on the seat while you try to line them up.  Afterwards, the screws don't want to go in evenly at all.  I had one that hung out and I had to just brute force to turn the screw, eventually pretty much stripping it to the point it'll never be usable again, but so it's lined up with the others and should be safe.Minor thing, but there's also an obnoxious orange label that shows what you're not supposed to do in the chair.  Let's just say if you have a teenager, or a dirty mind, one of the images will certainly be a source of a few laughs you won't want.  Only way to get rid of it is to cut it off.

I really liked the idea of the paper because it's thin so you can put more in the paper tray, have it take less room in a folder, and it doesn't hurt that it's on the nicer side of ecological concerns where printer paper is concerned.  I found it to be really good as far as thin paper goes.  Basically, it's something I would use for printing off coupons for restaurants, our yearly tax returns, etc. where looking pretty has little effect.  I would absolutely NEVER use for something that would go out to customers, be posted anywhere, or for a resume.  The paper is thin, almost transparently thin, and doesn't feel substantial when I hold it.  It's also not great for double-sided printing because the letters show through.All this didn't bother me, I knew that going in.  The problem I had is that after printing a 3rd sheet of paper with it, my Brother MFC-J430W started having spasms.  The paper loaded fine, but I got the first ever software error message it could not complete a page print.  I tried again, it spent several minutes thinking to itself, then printed out most of a page.  Then it wouldn't even print for probably 10 minutes and I had to reboot.  It printed, but made awful whinging noises inside.  I took out the paper, ruffled it up a bit, and put the tray back.  The next sheet took longer to print that usual, but did come out alright.  The one after that worked fine as well.  I've had the printer maybe 1.5 years and never had a paper feed issue in that time.  My first 10 pages using this paper took me well over 30 minutes to finally get out.So anyway, I'll hopefully be able to use the rest of this paper, because it really is exactly what I needed in terms of use of space, but if the printer keeps having problems I'll have to give up and go back to the thicker stuff.---Update 06/22/15---I've raised it up to four stars now.  After fanning the paper really well and replacing it I've been printing with no further jams so far.  Still not entirely confident there won't be more given the initial experience, but I'm now cautiously optimistic.  I'll update my review if it does start jamming regularly again.  I'm starting to sense the cheaper the printer the more likely this paper is to not work properly.

I've been buying Worms games that are basically the same for probably 15 years now.  I even have Worms World Party for the GBA!  No, I'm not complaining...well, other than Worms World Party for GBA was literally completable due to massive bugs.  It's nice to still be able to play such a timeless classic and they keep refining and adding little things, though often break some of the good things.So, since there are a lot of reviews I'll keep this short.  The good is classic Worms like you've probably played many times in the past.  Ninja ropes actually function so that's a plus.  The bad, the thing is fairly glitchy and will crash semi-regularly.  It also has log in problems with its DRM which may make it unplayable for you for a short time or permanently.  Getting it to give you an option to go to your home screen is often an exercise in frustration where you have to swipe many times before anything recognizes.  So yeah, it's Worms on Android and it's good for that, but it's still got a lot of problems that mar it.  Bitdefender's Cueful program recognizes it as a moderate privacy risk as well, so they may very well be collecting data to sell to supplement a game that's already pricier than many.  At least I got it on discount.

Come on guys, this thing is priced relatively close to what you can get the full 22 episode seasons for and you only have one DVD and no special features?!?  Wtf?  It's a cynical money grab since they know if you bought the earlier seasons you'll want to complete the set.  Not cool.That said, my star rating reflects the DVD set, not the quality of the show.  The fourth season was on par with Season 3.  I watched them when it originally aired and missed one, so I'm looking forward to getting up to that again.  I'm currently on disc 2 of Season 3 and binge watching so I'll be up to Season 4 soon.  Anyway, it's a wrap up because the network was good enough to not just leave the show hanging after season 3.  The main gist is the final shutdown of Division and the Shop trying to get Nikita to go away.  You also have the final "battle" with Amanda that wraps up that arc well, though it wasn't quite the ending I'd have chosen.If you can get over a completely implausible series where the highly trained bad guys are taken down two and three at a time by the main characters then you'll enjoy Nikita.  I'd highly recommend getting the first three seasons and starting from there.  This was a good one to finish out my set, but I think at minimum they should have had a second DVD with special features for the price.

Seasons 1 and 2 of Nikita were some really awesome TV.  I'd liked the old La Feme Nikita alright, only saw season 2 and 3 I bought on sale, but in my opinion the remake is a lot more plausible, even if it's still a thoroughly implausible show.  What I mean is that so many people are double, super secret, triple agents with secret pasts, it really run similar to that old 90's Spider man cartoon where basically everybody he knows ends up as a super hero or villain by the end.  Heck, they have to fill episodes and it's enjoyable if you don't question things too deeply so who cares?Anyway, season 2 has some really good arcs and I loved Percy's return from caged animal to something else by the end.  He was my favorite character in the entire show because he was just so dedicated and not exactly evil, but ruthless in getting what he wanted.  The bits where they made him physically impressive were a bit much for me, sort of like the old Stargate SG1 where Carter was not only a scientist, but a perfect shot, a decent cook, and always attractively made up.  People tend to have a flaw or two, which is why the scientist guy from Stargate Atlantis was better IMHO, because he was brilliant, but a neurotic wreck who wasn't that great in combat.  One of the signture bits of Percy's whole presence in the series is the last episode where he gets out of a situation and I don't want to give away any spoilers, so the part in that episode where he does something highly objectionable because he was in a rush.  I won't give away whether he sneaks away, ends up dumped in a deep dank hole to rot, or meets an untimely end, but this was the last season he appeared in and so this was the season I feel the show peaked.In short, get the first season and get this one and you'll not be disappointed.  The third and final season (a paltry 6 episode wrap up) change the dynamic of the series for better or worse, worse in my opinion but tastes vary, though still I'd consider them worth picking up to complete the set.  Just be ready to binge watch because if you miss episodes you'll quickly become lost.

We just got a bunch of memory cards for our new video camera a few months ago.  I'd been keeping them in the camera case as best I could, but the micro SD cards are tiny and rattled around a lot and so figuring out which one was empty fast became problematic as I moved from only having a couple to having 5 of them.  So this grip box looked like a really interesting way to go.First, I really think it felt like the device as a whole was good quality and sturdy.  I don't think dropping it would break it and the closing mechanism was very sturdy and the drawer was secure and didn't come out even when it was rattling around in my pocket.  The size was small and convenient, maybe twice as wide and half as fat as a lighter.  The orange color makes it handy for me to find visually against the black of my camera, case, and luggage, so that's been convenient.Unfortunately, this seems more like a first draft of a product than a finished one.  The drawer liner was not quite centered so it had an annoying sort of dip to it.  The profile was too low to fit all my SD cards, but no problems with the micro SD.  However, while you can fit a bunch in there, there's no divider or anything that tells you which card is which.  So unless each one is a different size or brand, it's still pretty hard to remember which ones are full and which are empty.  If they'd sort of marked it off with a grid even that'd help a lot when it comes to labeling it.  Which is another problem, the labeling is on the underside of the drawer so to write on it you either have to balance or take all out and then write on it.  You have five boxes you can write in.  Reading can be done without removing the cards, but it's awkward.  These things would be more forgivable if it were maybe 3/4 of the current price.  As is, my personal feeling is it's not a rip off, but is still a bit expensive for what you get.

I haven't had much time to read things lately so it's been hard to find a book to pick up. This one caught my eye because it was a cartoonists take on an topic I'm interested in.  I absolutely agree with the author the medium of radio is far from dead.  For one thing, so long as we are driving our own cars or need background noise at work, something we can listen to will be needed.  Whether it stays as traditional radio or goes entirely to streaming or podcasts, who knows, but there will always be room for good story telling.Since it's a "comic book" I should probably mention that first.  I was expecting something more of a graphic novel.  This is not to be derogatory, but it's really closer to well drawn newspaper comics instead of a more comic book feel.  Not to say that all are simplistic, but there are a fair number of panes which are very similar to the former one, just with different dialog.  Everything is in black and white, which is OK, but a little color might have been a nice.  I really hate to sound like I'm comparing the two for content or level of detail in the drawings, but for example the old Dilbert books which were collections of comics benefited from the color Sunday strips were nice for the visual break for the pallet.  The font was pretty good sized, but the font they choose and how sometimes text bubbles were squeezed together made it a little tiring to try to read with any speed sometimes.The author focuses a lot on NPR, which has a number of story telling programs, but is hardly the only one.  I've heard multiple talk radio shows out there of a variety of political ideologies be very compelling.  Sometimes on a topic as unpolitical as a TV news guy who lost three jobs in seven years for stalking a coworker, fighting the driver of a UN delegate over a parking space, and then a coworker in the parking lot of a Hooters.  Still, it's probably for the best she didn't focus on the political shows though.  Nowadays, people seem so ready to jump on anyone who thinks differently than they do, without questioning if the other person has a valid point or not.  Anyway though, the breakdown of the various things you should do as a good story teller was handled quite well in my opinion.The general feel of the book is a build up to how you would build a good story.  One of my favorite parts was the one on editing, where a lot of stories really, really fall short.  The old adage of less is more really holds a lot of the time.  From personal experience writing papers it's often the hardest to cut something that I really like, but just doesn't fit well into the overall project.  So that made me feel a little closer to that section of the book.  I also liked the times where multiple points of view were given, for example when they had two different opinions on whether you should reflect at the end of the story or not.  So all in all an enjoyable read and a nice look behind the curtains of Ira Glass' show.

It's almost impossible to write a song review for someone else, so listen to the preview.  It covers the catchy part of the chorus pretty well.  Great song, there are a few bits I'd change if I were all powerful, but good enough I probably listened to it 10-15 times in a row after downloading it because I enjoyed it so much.  Might want to check out the video.  It's sort of a running from black eyed zombies or something, not quite explained, but creepy.  That too, could have had a few tweaks to be better, but overall enjoyable.

I found this one better than the old La Fem Nikita.  It's a little more plausible than the old one where the agents were killed fairly frequently.  Basically, it's a spy who got out, got a double agent inside, and then works to bring them down.  It's out there and not really very plausible, but it's a lot of fun.  Looks great on a high def TV even without the Bluray players.  I have an upscaling DVD player and the picture is wonderful.  Good set.

If you've not seen a Chromebook before THIS IS NOT A WINDOWS LAPTOP.  Don't expect to run all the software you run on your PC.  Boiled down to the most basic level, it's a web browser in a netbook's body.  If you're looking for a simple buy/don't buy decision, then buy this as it's great, it's cheap, and the annoyances are not deal breakers.  Longer answer, ask yourself, what do you care about?  If you have to have Windows software programs and can't find a work around, this is a pass.  Otherwise, if you can get by with Google Docs and this preferably won't be your main PC at home then it's a good option.  You need a "real" computer running the Chrome browser to be able to print documents.
