I've always purchased Logitech or Microsoft keyboards, but the KP400 has me looking at Kensington as a great keyboard manufacturer.  This keyboard may not be for everybody based on use and feel, however, it performs very well and is a five star device.You can tell the KP400 is a bit different than your standard desktop keyboard.  The look and feel is more like that of a laptop.  The keys are lower and don't have as much bounce back.  I actually prefer this style.  Even though the keys are lower there is still great feedback and response, yet is quiet.  The layout of keys is fairly common to other keyboards, but the backslash key is located on the left side near the Crtl and Alt keys.  The design of the keyboard is more sleek and modern.The KP400's greatest feature is the ability to switch from USB to Bluetooth.  If you have a desktop or laptop hooked up on USB, but have another laptop or tablet connected on Bluetooth you can easily go back and forth.  It's not a feature for everybody, but if you have multiple devices you'll likely love it.  Installation was a breeze and it was truly plug and play across multiple devices.Overall, it's a well built device that is versatile.

Avery's Color Laser Glossy Brochures are a great option for creating an impact.  The weight of the brochures is good, and combined with the glossy texture they are very professional.  Creating the brochures is fairly simple with the provided templates.  The paper is scored to allow for easy folding.  These are an excellent choice for trade shows, conferences, or mailings.  Clear seals are included for mailing purposes.Keep in mind these are for laser printers only.  Overall, these provide an easy way to promote your event or business with relative ease while looking very professional.

The Maroo Folio for the Surface Pro 3 is one of the best cases I have used for my SP3.  I've tried many cases and none of them really succeeded.  Some were too tight, some too loose and big, some didn't have a good loop for the pen.  This folio, however, has been keeping my SP3 protected for awhile now.The materials are nice.  The grey felt combined with the dark brown synthetic leather is a good balance.  Good stitching and overall great quality.  Unlike so many cases out there, this was actually designed for the SP3.  Most cases were designed for other devices and just slightly adapted to the SP3.  One easy way to tell is the nice fit.  The case is slim, but the SP3 is easily slipped into the case and removed.  It's not too snug, it's just right.Taking the device in and out the case is also made easier by the material used on the interior.  It doesn't case friction with the SP3's type cover, which was a problem on nearly SP3 case I tried.  There is a loop for the stylus on the inside, but it doesn't get in the way of the device.  So you don't have to worry about scratching the sides of the Surface.I definitely recommend this case for anyone that is looking for a well designed product to match the great design of the Surface Pro 3.  Get this case and skip the others.

Avery's Tri-Fold Brochure with Tear-Aways cards is a nifty idea.  At first, I questioned the need for the tear-away cards on brochures.  They suggest using them as business cards, coupons, or promotions.  I don't see much need in using them as business cards, but the coupons or promotional use is a great idea.Designing and printing the brochures is simple, as are most Avery products.  The material is a nice product and it feels professional.  The cards are pre-scored, but could use a better perforation.Overall, the brochures with cards are a nice touch.  They might have limited use in some businesses, but do offer a good amount of professionalism and are a simple way to deliver promotions.

The Philips Norelco NT3155/60 Trimmer is one of the better trimmers I have ever used.  When I first took the device out of the package I could tell it was a well made item.  It felt solid and strong, unlike many of the cheap trimmers that last only a couple of months.The battery compartment cover is firm, the blade on top is solid as well.  I know it sounds silly, but if you have used many trimmers you are well aware of how flimsy most of them feel.  Even the comb that fits on the blade is snug and secure.After popping the battery in and turning the trimmer on you are instantly surprised by the amount of power it delivers.  It was a pleasant surprise.  I really do love this trimmer, but if there is one fault it might be how the blade/trimmer is to the curve of the head.  It might just be me, but it was hard to determine if I had the blade down against the skin or area you wanted to trim.  It's easy enough to get used to, though, especially with the overall quality of the device.We'll see how long the trimmer lasts, but I have very high hopes.  It's one of my new favorite tools on the sink.  Definitely recommended.

The BLU Studio 6.0 HD Smartphone is an excellent device, offering a phone with many nice features at a great off-contract price.  BLU does a great job of making their product feeling premium and overall, it's a good device for just about anybody.Opening the box, you get a pretty nice experience.  It's well packaged and includes a screen protector, headset, and case.  Most manufacturers don't include all the extras and expect you to purchase them individually.  So receiving them up front is a nice touch.  The case has a firm grip to it and fit the phone very well.  The cutout for the headphone jack was a little rough, but not a big deal.  The screen protector was fairly average, fairly simple to install and did not disturb the use of the screen.  The only issue I had with the case was that it did make it difficult to use the buttons, but that is often the issue with cases.While the 6" screen is a bit large, it is a really nice display.  It's clear and bright.  The phone itself feels fairly light for a 6" device, but it's still a little bulky in your pocket.  Performance was very nice.  Most applications were snappy.  The processor held its own and the 1GB RAM was adequate.  Obviously, I would prefer more internal storage, but it's a great start.  You can add a micro SD card if the 8GB isn't enough (and it likely won't be enough).  That's an easy fix though and memory cards are super cheap these days.Phone quality was excellent when I tried it on the AT&T network.  Internet browsing on both the cellular network and Wi-Fi was good.  Camera was good and more than adequate, but not the camera of a premium or flagship device.  The charging port is on top, which some people love and some people hate.  I'm somewhat indifferent, but prefer a charging port on the bottom.One issue I had was with buttons.  The volume is on the left, directly across from the power/lock button on the opposite side.  While it may not be an issue on smaller phones, I found myself adjusting the volume when hitting the lock button.  The size of the device made me hold the device in a way where my thumb kept hitting the volume.Overall, I'm very pleased with the BLU Studio 6 HD.  It feels like a premium device.  While it does have a few minor quirks, the specifications hold up well and the phone is very easy to like and enjoy.

The Revlon Curl Collection Heated Styling Brush does a pretty good job with styling, but misses the mark in a few areas.  The overall styling ability is pretty good, it definitely gets hot enough (almost too hot) to style hair.  However, it's a bit too bulky, has no temperature control, and the size of the brush probably isn't the best for most people.My main issue is the fact that there is no temperature setting.  That really limits you and styling with this brush when at its hottest can be difficult.  The glove can be helpful, but it awkward with the bristles of the brush and the brush itself is a bit too small.  It can be difficult to style much.  But it does do a good job of styling when at the right temperature.  I wish the brush was a big larger, but then the entire thing might be too big.  Overall, it works, but is a bit disappointing.

TP-LINK's UH720 USB 3 Hub with Smart Charging Ports works flawlessly.  It's fast, simple to setup, and provides plenty of USB inputs for all of your devices.  The USB Hub is equipped with USB 3.0, so you'll get plenty of transfer speed for your newest devices.Setup really is quick and easy.  As advertised, it's plug and play.  You are up and going quickly without hassle.  I tried several devices and all of them worked like a charm.  The device itself is nothing fancy.  It's black and does not stand out.  It's relatively small to have a large number of ports, so it's doesn't take up too much space.  The smart charging ports are handy, as well.The spacing between ports is just right.  The power is on the left, charging ports on the right, and the additional USB ports all lined up on front.  The device itself is fairly light.  If you don't have much hooked up to it, it can be somewhat easy to knock or pull off your desk.  However, once you have a few devices hooked up, it's sturdy and stays in place.Overall, it's been flawless.  If you have a large number of devices and want to have some extra charging ports, then the TP-LINK UH720 is for you.

Avery's Matte White Flyers with Tear-Away Cards are a nifty business marketing product (although if you are advertising something in your local community, they'd be great for personal use, too).  While you could easily accomplish this task with a plain or stock piece of paper and simply precut the ends like most of us have done for years, the Avery version offers a very professional product.  For businesses, the quality and the ability to design your flyer and cards is simply fantastic.You can also layer the tear-away cards, placing more cards on a flyer in higher traffic areas, or returning to your flyer to add more at a later date when the first set has been depleted.  I know it sounds simple, but the ability to add cards and layer them is a great idea.  The cards tear away fairly easy as well.  My only concern is the adhesive.  While I didn't have any issue using them, I'd be concerned about extreme wet weather or extreme heat/cold having an effect on them.  But in my environment, during late Winter with temperatures above 30-40 degrees, I did not have any problems.Designing them is simple, as is the case with most Avery products.  Overall, I was thrilled with the idea of the tear-away cards and the implementation went very well.  Would definitely recommend.

Avery's Adhesive Round Display Cards are a new alternative to tent cards.  I'd imagine there are tons of uses.  These would look very professional in a bakery, or any business that has a glass showcase of their products.  They would also be great for tradeshows, conferences, or anywhere you might have a booth setup.  A dinner party or buffet might also be a good use.They are very easy to design and print.  As is typical with Avery products, you have plenty of options out of the box, but there is plenty of room for your own adjustments and customizations.  The adhesive does a good job of holding, but I was more surprised at how cleanly they came off.  I've been extremely pleased with all the Avery products coming to consumers and small businesses lately.  They have really been producing some great products that can be used by any of us and the round display cards are no exception.

Avery's Small (2" x 3.5") Tent Cards are great for meetings, conferences, trade shows, or place cards.  We used these at a recent dinner that was more of a buffet style.  They worked very well and added a real professional touch.  It was an easy way to identify the food (although if you want much more information on the card, like an ingredient list, you would need to use a bigger tent card.  Avery also offers them in a large size or a medium size that might be better for your situation.  It really depends on the amount of content you want to place on the cards.  The small tent cards are likely best for name place cards, either for a dinner or meeting/conference.Setup and printing was super simple, which is something I always love about Avery products.  The cards are embossed, giving them a nice feel and look.  The weight of the cards is just right and they really do feel professional.  I can certainly see using this in a business setting.  I would definitely recommend these for your next event.

Avery's (2.5" x 8.5") Tent Cards are great for meetings, conferences, trade shows, or place cards.  We used these at a recent dinner that was more of a buffet style.  They worked very well and added a real professional touch.  It was an easy way to identify the food and even offer a brief description or ingredient list.  I think these are the most appropriate size, although Avery also offers them in a large size that might be better for your situation.  It really depends on the amount of content you want to place on the cards.Setup and printing was super simple, which is something I always love about Avery products.  The cards are embossed, giving them a nice feel and look.  The weight of the cards is just right and they really do feel professional.  I can certainly see using this in a business setting.  I would definitely recommend these for your next event.

Avery's Large (3.5" x 11") Tent Cards are great for meetings, conferences, trade shows, or place cards.  We used these at a recent dinner that was more of a buffet style.  They worked very well and added a real professional touch.  It was an easy way to identify the food and even offer a brief description or ingredient list.  The large cards might be a bit too big for this scenario, but Avery does offer some smaller tent cards that may suit your needs best.  It really depends on the amount of content you want to place on the cards.Setup and printing was super simple, which is something I always love about Avery products.  The cards are embossed, giving them a nice feel and look.  The weight of the cards is just right and they really do feel professional.  I can certainly see using this in a business setting.  I would definitely recommend these for your next event.

The Netgear N300 Wi-Fi Router with High Powered Antennas offers very good range, good speeds, and has a small footprint.  Many of the routers you see today are fairly large, but the N300 is a good size. The antennas are fairly long offering higher power and range.Setup is pretty painless.  After about 15-20 minutes you'll easily have it up and going.  Additional time might be required if you have a large number of devices in your home or office.  The WPS (Wi-Fi Protected Setup) offers you the ability to configure most devices to connect to the N300 with the simple push of a button.  I've always found WPS to work very well and the N300 was no different.  There is also an option to save power by scheduling the Wi-Fi to be off.  It appeared to work fine, but wasn't something I was interested in, as I have so many devices and typically they need access at one time or another.  But it's certainly a handy feature that you don't see in many routers.The N300 offers adequate speeds, although there are faster and more full featured (for instance, dual band) if you have the need and devices in your network that would benefit from it.  However, the N300 is an excellent value.  The user interface was good, although not nearly as perfect as I'm used to with most Netgear products.  Overall, it's a nice router and it's easy to setup.  It offers simplicity over high end features and is a great option for many people.

The Delkin 64GB microSDXC Memory Card performs very well, on par with similar cards.  When needing a high performance memory card for your camera, you want it perform day in and day out.  After using the Delkin 64GB microSDXC card with a GoPro Hero4, I can say that I am very pleased.  As a longtime SanDisk fan, the Delkin replaced a similar SanDisk model in terms of specs.Delkin is a good brand, I just never knew they produced memory cards.  I've used several of their other products with my SLR cameras, but I was confident that Delkin would provide a good product in memory cards as well.  The microSDXC didn't let me down.  I was able to get plenty of coverage on the GoPro without a hiccup.  Transfer speeds back to the computer were equally impressive.  While I won't comment much on price or value, I'll say that similar Sandisk cards performed in similar fashion at a lower price point.  So the price might be because of the Delkin name or possibly the longer life of the product that they are advertising (rugged, durable, etc).I cannot knock the Delkin card.  It performed very well and the casing does seem a bit more durable than competing brands.  I put trust in the Delkin name.  I'm not sure it warrants a higher price tag, but so far so good.

Dr. Brandt's Do Not Age Transforming Pearl Serum delivers a noticeable difference, both in feel and looks.  While it can be hard to justify the pricing of some of these products, I cannot judge this serum on price, and will only examine the results.  First, the packaging felt like it was an expensive product.  It was well packaged and felt like a product that is high end.The serum itself was a little thin, but was easy to apply and did not linger.  So it wasn't something that you would easily get into your eyes or clothing.  The packaging felt more luxurious than the serum itself.  The thinness and overall appeal of it wasn't bad by any means, but it wasn't something that felt like a million bucks.  However, within a short amount of time you could really feel a difference.  You really do get a feeling of firmness or tightening soon after application.The bigger question is whether there are noticeable visual results.  While examining the visual results of products like this usually takes a more long term approach I can safely say that I have noticed some difference.  There was a noticeable smoothness in some areas, but I would imagine minimizing wrinkles take more time to see a difference.So far I have not had any reactions or negative side effects.  Everything has been on the positive side.  There wasn't an overwhelming scent and so far the product has been going a long way.  It seems like it only takes a little bit during application, so a bottle of the serum should last a while.

Avery has been coming out with a large number of products lately.  It's not just labels anymore.  They have a large selection of marketing products and the Door Hangers with Tear-Away Cards are an excellent example of a great product.  Whether it's for a small business, a nonprofit, political campaign, or just about anything else, these door hangers are quick and simple to use that will provide a marketing edge for you.The door hangers are simple to design, as are most Avery products.  While you can get going quickly, I'd recommend taking your time and designing a very professional layout.  The best part of the door hangers are the tear-away cards.  Great for coupons, promotions, or contact info, it's just another way that your promotion will look professional.At 80 per pack, I think the price is very reasonable.  The count per pack also gives you the ability to play around a little bit and have enough to make a great promotion.  This is one of the best Avery solutions I've seen.  I've used many Avery products and these are among my new favorites.

The APC Dual USB Slim Portable Power Pack is very versatile, holds plenty of charge, and is great on the go or for emergencies.  At 10,000 mAh, there is plenty of power to go around.  While it can charge a tablet, it can also provide up to four charges for a cell phone.  I've always kept the smaller "stick" styles in my briefcase, but this APC power pack is now moving into the frontrunner spot.The power pack is light enough to slip into a briefcase and not be very noticeable.  It's very portable and is handy to have around, as you never know when you'll need a phone charge and don't have quick access to an outlet.  This is also a great unit to keep around for emergencies, maybe in an emergency kit.  It could easily provide you enough phone charges to last through a small blackout period or during a disaster.Overall, I give this power pack five stars.  It's slim, fairly lightweight, packs plenty of power and has few, if any flaws.

Avery's Durable Self-Laminating Business Cards have many different uses, everything from luggage tags, business cards, and to ID cards.  Personally, I found these to be useful for store loyalty cards.  You can fit several loyalty cards (if they use a bar code) on one card.  It can really save room in your wallet.Like most Avery products, they are fairly simple to design and print.  Plenty of instructions, templates, and options.  The self-laminating worked fairly well, although you might need to plan for some trial and error.  While these business cards have plenty of uses, I found them to be less durable than what I originally hoped.  Yes, they are self-laminating, but the cards themselves aren't nearly as thick as I'd like.  Overall though, great idea and good execution.

Hefty's Odor Block Tall Kitchen Bags feature Hefty's strong bags that provide a punch against odors.  I got the Lavender Vanilla scent.  Usually, I don't care too much for scented bags, opting instead for standard bags or odor blocking bags.The bags are typical Hefty, nice and strong.  They are a good thickness that don't get easily poked.  The drawstrings also don't easily break (an issue I've experienced on many trash bags).  While the odor blocking appears to work well, the Lavender Vanilla was surprisingly calm.  I thought it would be way too strong, but it was a subdued scent, not strong at all.Overall, a strong trash bag with odor blocking and a nice scent that isn't overpowering.

The Netgear Nighthawk Wi-Fi AC1900 Range Extender was very easy to setup and it offers an excellent range to connect up additional devices in your home or business.  I've grown to really like Netgear wireless products, mostly for their ease of use.  While they have options for additional configurations and advanced setups, the installations out of the box are usually a snap.If you have a wireless router with WPS (Wi-Fi Protected Setup), most of setup will simply involve pressing a couple of buttons.  Setting up the equipment and taking care of configuration shouldn't take more than fifteen minutes or so, but possibly longer if you are not using WPS.  I live in a two story home, with my wireless router placed in one corner of the home on the second floor.  Wireless connections were spotty at the opposite end of the house, especially on the lower floor, but after installing the extender I was receiving excellent coverage.  Actually, I now have great coverage in my backyard as well, although that may not be desired for some buyers.I was able to roam my house with existing connected devices and not lose connections or much signal strength.  So far I've been very pleased with the extender and haven't experienced any issues.

The TP-LINK Archer T8E AC1750 Dual Band Wireless PCI Express Adapter offers great speed, compatibility, and signal.  First, the adapter is fairly compact and should be in most desktop computers without hassle.  I have several desktop PCs serving as media centers and upgraded one of them with the TP-LINK adapter.  I was instantly getting better speeds and signal quality.For installation, I used the provided disc, but you could always opt for downloading updated drivers.  It's hard to knock the device, as I've had zero trouble.  The installation was super simple, the speeds have been great, and I haven't experienced any network issues.  I've been streaming HD video and copying large files without hassle.  Definitely recommended.

The DII Oceanique Shower Curtain is a nice, although fairly average curtain.  My initial opinion before opening it up was pretty good.  It was a neutral color and pattern and looked soft.  After opening it up, the only thing that changed was the appearance of softness.  Of course, it is 100% polyester and because of this I think it will be easy to clean and maintain.The size was a standard 72x72 and fit perfectly.  The pattern and color (cool brown) were certainly neutral so it would work for almost any bathroom.  The pattern isn't as noticeable until you get closer to the curtain.  It came out of the package with only a few wrinkles.  Since it is a dark color not as much light came through, but that wasn't a problem in my bathroom.  The thickness was pretty good.  Overall, I felt that it had a good quality and could work in almost any design.

I consider myself to be an amateur photographer, by no means a professional, but proficient in most areas.  Having owned several DSLR cameras, I've always wanted a kit like the Delkin DDSS-SCOPE3 SensorScope System.  I'm usually very careful when swapping lenses out to minimize debris getting to the camera's internals and sensor.  However, no matter how careful you are there will be dust and small particles that get in and in many cases it might be larger, more noticeable dirt.A couple of years ago I took my camera to a camera shop and they had a similar setup to this system, but they clearly knew more about what they were doing.  So I admit, I was a bit timid at trying the Delkin system out.  Fortunately, I found the step by step guide that was included to be thorough enough to ease my worries.  I would consider the kit to be fairly complete, with not just the scope but a fair amount of solution, swabs/wands, pen, and vacuum.  For some this might be overkill and you might be better off buying the individual pieces that you need.  However, I find this kit to be well documented and fully prepared.The lights on the sensor provide amble lighting and there is good magnification to see what you are doing.  The vacuum is a nice touch and while it's fairly light in power, you don't really expect or need much.  There are also several wands, enough for multiple cleanings, as well as an adequate amount of solution.Overall, I'm very pleased.  For a first timer when it comes to cleaning my DSLR, I was very comfortable using the products and feel like I can use the system again as needed.

The Thunderbolt 2 Dock, an excellent Elgato product, is a great way to clean up cord cutter and be able to sit down at your desk and not have to worry about hooking up a bunch of cables.  The market seems to flooded with these docks lately, but that's good as it gives us plenty of choices.The Elgato dock features a decent selection of ports, including HDMI, a three USB ports (yes, all of them are USB3), Ethernet, microphone, headphone jack, and two thunderbolt ports.  I really wish more of these dock manufacturers would add additional USB ports and while I was going to knock the Elgato for it, three is pretty decent but more importantly they are all USB3.  I know I could always attach a USB hub if I needed more, but if there was one improvement that would be it.  Otherwise, the Elgato dock performs wonderfully.Getting up and going was simple and straightforward.  I had some video issues, but I think that was mostly on my end.  Having tried many different docks, both on the PC and MAC side, video issues are normally the number one problem.  The overall design of the dock is nice and sleek.  All of the ports are pointed the same direction (makes the cord clutter appear a little less messy), and the footprint of the dock is relatively small.  Overall, it's been performing very well and I haven't experienced any connectivity issues.

I wanted a clear crystal case for my brand new Galaxy S6 white and this case was perfect. The free screen protector that comes with it is amazing and does an amazing job protecting the screen from scratches. I have been using this case for 3 weeks now and I am very happy with the case. It fits perfectly and I love the USB and headphone port covers that will prevent dust from gathering there. Strongly recommended if you want a premium feel case.

I have been using this since it came out and cannot get enough of it. I use it everyday for streaming YouTube videos and also live streaming games on my TV. It is relatively inexpensive compared to Roku or Apple TV and very easy to setup. Even if you are a beginner, it wouldn't take you more than 5 mins to set up. You can also cast things from multiple devices such as a PC or tablet.What I love most is that it doesn't consume battery on the smartphone so you can turn off the screen after you have initiated the streaming.It doesn't support any local storage media directly so the only way to do it is by connecting the storage media to your PC and stream from there.

The Cooler Master Hyper 212+ is one of the most popular heatsinks of all time and it provides excellent performance for its value.  If you can't afford to purchase a premium air or water cooler then the Hyper 212+ is the best heatsink money could buy. Most high-end heatsinks are priced above $70+ while this beast goes for around $30. Also, you also have a high risk of a water cooler leaking and completely destroying your other components.Installing it is a piece of cake and the instructions are very easy to follow in case if you have never installed a heatsink before.There are also videos on YouTube that you could watch that show step by step of how to install a heatsinnk.The performance of this heatsink is excellent. I installed this heatsink to my 3770K CPU and temps were running 43C idle with stock heatsink. After applying the Hyper 212+, the temps dropped to 34C idle so that's a big difference and I have a lot of headroom for overclocking. I plan on overclocking my 3770K to 4.4Ghz but I need to do more testing for that.It comes with a 120mm fan attached pre-installed onto the heatsink and the metal clips make it very easy to remove the fan for heatsink. You also have an extra two metal clips in case you would want to add a second fan for more airflow. When it comes to noise, this beast is very quiet and does a good job at staying quiet even under full load. The Hyper 212+ comes with its own thermal paste which is decent but not the best one out there.

I would like to thank Netgear for sending me this Wireless-N router (FVS318N) as part of the Friends and Family program. I’ve been using this product for a few days now and so far I've been impressed with the features and quality of the product. I have taken a couple of pictures to show you guys the packaging and the product itself so make sure to check them out!-Physical Specifications/FeaturesThe FVS318N is basically an improved version of the FVS318G that was released back in 2009. Netgear has improved the FVS318N by not just adding new features but by also adding new wireless capabilities and increasing performance. With that being said, the FVS318N is physically the same as the FVS318G. It is 7.5" wide x 4.9" length x 1.4" high and weighs 1.3 lbs.The old version of this router that was release in 2009 had a 250Mhz processor, 32MB of ram and 8MB of flash but the new model sports a 300Mhz processor, 128MB of RAM and 32MB of flash. When it comes to cooling, the FVS318N is passively cooled so it's dead silent.Most routers come with four ports but the FVS318N comes with a nice 8 Gigabit Ethernet ports and also supports IPv6. The FVS318G didn't have jumbo frames but it seems like Netgear has added it to the 318N and according to Netgear, the 318N supports up to 9720 byte frames. After a quick research about the jumbo frames on the 318N, it seems that jumbo frames are only supported on ports 1 through 4 so that's a bit of a disappointment that it only works on half the ports. The FVS318N has a single band 802.11b/g/n radio and can be configured to run four separate SSIDs.-SetupAfter installing the router, I had an issue connecting to the ISP because it wouldn't pull an IP address without cloning the computer MAC. The menu structure is pretty straight forward and easy to understand but one thing that I noticed is that when rebooting the router, it takes a good 2+ minutes for the router to become resposinve again. Also, the menu seems to lag quite a bit and you have to wait a couple of seconds for the menu to refresh after applying the configurations. This becomes very annoying when you are trying to troubleshoot something.-ConclusionThis router has many professional features that are nice such as the 8 Gigabit LAN ports with jumbo frames. The router is only 802.11n and only single channel. However, it is more expensive compared to the Cisco RV120W which has a higher performance. The 318N goes for $170 while the RV120W sells for $130. Overall, it's a decent router and also, don't forget that all Netgear ProSafe devices come with a lifetime warranty.

It stopped charging my Galaxy S4 after two weeks out of the blue. It used to charge my Galaxy S4 just fine but now it doesn't charge it. I spent around 5hrs thinking that my Galaxy S4 had gone bad but it turns out it was this crappy charger. This looks like the original OEM charger that comes with the Galaxy S4 but it's a fake. STAY AWAY FROM THIS!

I would like to thank Netgear for sending me this Powerline 500Mbps adapter kit (XAVB5201) as part of the Friends and Family program. I’ve been using this product for a few days now and so far I’m very impressed with the quality and speed of the product. I have taken a couple of pictures to show you guys the packaging and the product itself so make sure to check them out!-Physical Specifications/PackagingOpening the box, you will find two Powerline 500 adapters nicely wrapped in a plastic bag and two 2 m (6.5 ft) Ethernet cables. There’s also a quick installation guide that can come in handy if you need help setting it up. The dimensions of this Powerline 500 adapter kit are 70 (H) x 51 (W) x 25 (D) mm and weighs 68 grams so it’s pretty small and light.I have a medium sized two-story house and my router is on the first floor near my living room. I have a smart TV in my living room which easily connects to my router and never drops a single connection. However, I have a second smart TV in my room which is in on the second floor and it’s all the way in the corner of the house. There are a lot of walls upstairs so my smart TV and my Galaxy S4 have a hard time keeping a stable connection and they sometimes randomly disconnect which can be very annoying. Not only that, but watching YouTube videos is a pain since I have to wait for it to buffer for a couple of minutes.-Setup/InstallationThis Powerline adapter kit couldn’t have come at a better time for me. I plugged it in an outlet on the second floor and used a long Ethernet cable that I had lying around and plugged it into my router. I didn’t need to configure or install new software which was very nice. It’s even got a ‘Pick-a-Plug’ LED which identifies the best outlet for optimal performance. The difference this kit has made is HUGE, no kidding. No more dropping connections and waiting for YouTube videos to buffer. My Galaxy S4 now easily has full bars and it hasn’t dropped a single connection since I started using this Powerline adapter kit. I can now use my Galaxy S4 if I’m in the attic which I wasn’t able to before.Here’s what I observed when testing my Galaxy S4 on speedtest.net with/without the Powerline kit.-My Room (Second Floor) without Powerline Kit:Signal Strength: One BarDownload Speed: 4.7 MbpsUpload Speed: 3.9 Mbps-My Room (Second Floor) with Powerline Kit:Signal Strength: Full BarsDownload Speed: 19.2 MbpsUpload Speed: 9.2 MbpsAs you can see, this kit has made a world of difference in downloading and uploading. I can now watch YouTube videos in HD without having to wait to buffer. That’s amazing! Another thing that I like about this Powerline kit is that when it’s not in use, it automatically powers down to save power.I highly recommend the Powerline 500Mbps adapter kit (XAVB5201) for anyone who has dead spots in their house or who just want to extend their wireless signal.

I'm pasting this review from my website but you will have to go to my website in order to see the benchmark results because I cannot put pictures in Amazon reviews. The link to my website is posted on the comments.Noctua has become one of the most popular companies in the cooling market and they have been constantly releasing top notch products one after another. Noctua has been getting a lot of positive attention for their superb fans and exceptional coolers and the color scheme is the reason why people recognize Noctua products when they see one.Noctua offers a six year warranty on their products and has possibly the best customer service out there and I can certainly vouch for that. They have always sent me replacements for fans and mounting kits free of charge and that was long before I became a reviewer. Noctua sets the perfect example of what a customer service should be like. To me, customer service is one of the most important aspects when deciding to purchase a product and that's why I praise Noctua's customer service in my reviews because they truly value their loyalty to their customers. A simple Google search will reveal how great Noctua's customer service is.Today we will be taking a look at the Noctua NH-C12P SE14 which is the successor to the classic NH-C12P that has won more than 100 awards and recommendations from the international press. The NH-C12P SE14 uses the same exact heatsink as the original NH-C12P and the only difference between the two of them is that the original heatsink used the NF-P12 (120mm) fan while the newer model uses the NF-P14 FLX (140mm) fan. That might not seem like a big change but the 140mm fan should be much more efficient at cooling the CPU since it's not only bigger but it also incorporates some unique fan design features that the 120mm model lacked. Another difference is that the original heatsink did not support the new Intel CPU sockets while the NH-C12P SE14 adds support for those sockets.The design of the NH-C12P SE14 is a little bit different to what we are used to seeing nowadays and it is referred to as the "C-Type" design. The NH-C12P SE14 is designed for applications where space is limited thus in order to cut down on height, the six copper heatpipes come out of the base and bend 180 degrees making the cooler only 114mm tall while still retaining all the great features that traditional coolers have such as the six heatpipe design, a whisper quiet fan and an easy mounting system.The link to my website is posted on the comments so visit my website in order to see the benchmark results because I cannot put pictures on reviews on Amazon.

Noctua has become one of the most popular companies in the cooling market and they have been constantly releasing top notch products one after another. Noctua has been getting a lot of positive attention for their superb fans and exceptional coolers and the color scheme is the reason why people recognize Noctua products when they see one.Noctua offers a six year warranty on their products and has possibly the best customer service out there and I can certainly vouch for that. They have always sent me replacements for fans and mounting kits free of charge and that was long before I became a reviewer. Noctua sets the perfect example of what a customer service should be like.The other product that we will be taking a look at is the complete opposite of the NH-L9i. This is Noctua's largest CPU cooler that combines a massive six heatpipe dual tower design for extreme overclocking. We are talking about none other than the notorious NH-D14 that has won numerous awards for its exceptional performance. We will put the NH-D14 to the test to see how well it stacks up against other high end water coolers and air coolers.As you might have guessed from the name (-D14), this monster features a 14cm/140mm (NF-P14 FLX) fan that sits right in the middle of the two towers and also a 12cm/120mm (NF-P12) fan that sits on the side used in push/pull configuration. Similarly like the NH-L9i, this cooler also comes with SecuFirm 2 that makes installation a breeze.The packaging of the NH-D14 is also top notch. The accessories included in the box are excellent. Noctua has included mounting brackets needed to mount the cooler either on an Intel or AMD motherboard. They have also included a Phillips screw driver that you can use during the installation, two U.L.N.A. adapters which can be used to reduce fan speed for ultimate quietness, a manual is included as well and their amazing NT-H1 thermal compound.Moving on to the design of the NH-D14, we can see that this thing is huge compared to the NH-L9i. The NH-D14 weighs in at a hefty 900 grams without any fans and 1240 grams with both fans installed. That's over two pounds for a CPU cooler and it's a lot of weight for the motherboard to support. As you can see from the picture, this monster uses six 6 mm copper heatpipes and they have been soldered to the base plate and to the aluminium fins as well. The copper base plate measures 2 mm to 4.5mm thick and has a nickel-plated finish. Each stack has 42 aluminium fins and measures 0.4 mm thick and is approximately spaced 2 mm from the next.Something that many people probably don't know that I personally like about Noctua is that everything from fan design to bearing design is done in house. And this means that a lot of testing and R&D goes through when making a Noctua fan. Most manufactures simply use a stock model fan from an OEM and just slightly tweak the RPM levels and call it a day.Noctua puts a lot of R&D into their fan designs and it totally shows in the build quality of their fans. Typical fans don't last a long time; most fans come with a MTBF of 50,000 to 100,000 hours and most of them stop working before they even hit the limit; some even start to make high pitch noises.All the fans that Noctua designs come with a MTBF of more than 150,000 hours so they essentially pay for themselves in the future since you don't have to keep buying new fans if they stop working. Noctua also has an amazing customer service that I have always been very fond of. I have lost mounting kits numerous times and they have always sent me new ones free of charge. They have even sent me extra fans free of charge. I wish more companies had a customer service like Noctua! A simple Google search will reveal how great Noctua's customer service is.The fans that are used on the NH-D14 are the NF-P14 & NF-P12 and these are a little older fans than the one that's used on the NH-L9i. These fans use the first generation of SSO bearing. The NF-P14's max rotation speed is 1200 while the NF-P12 is 1300 RPM.If you decide to use the Ultra-Low-Noise-Adapter then the speed will drop to 900 RPM for both of them. These fans are whisper quiet even under full load and you will hardly hear them spinning. Noctua has discontinued the NF-P14 FLX because they have released the successor to that fan and that is the NF-A15 PWM fan.Installing the NH-D14 was relatively easy thanks to the SecuFirm2 mounting system that Noctua has greatly designed. SecuFirm2 is compatible with pretty much all AMD and Intel sockets. The whole assembly took less than 5 minutes and even if you are someone with no knowledge whatsoever, you will still be able to install this cooler with little to no effort thanks to SecuFirm2.SecuFirm 2 isn't compatible with Intel's 775 and 1366 sockets so you will need to contact Noctua so they can send you the necessary equipment free of charge. Noctua also promises to provide upgrade kits for future sockets free of charge which is also very nice!Since I'm using low profile RAM modules, I didn't have any problems with the cooler hanging over the RAM slots. If you are using RAM with tall heatsinks then you might need to do some calculations before purchasing the NH-D14.In my opinion, there's very little reason to purchasing RAM with tall heatsinks because RAM does not produce enough heat that you would need to dissipate it and there's no performance boost to having the tall heatsinks. I know some people like them for looks but you have to decide if you're one of those people. If you need help figuring out the RAM compatibility with the NH-D14 then head over to Noctua's website NH-D14 RAM Compatibility.Before I talk about the test methodology, I just want to say that since these two coolers are engineered for completely different purposes, we will be testing them differently from each other. We will be testing the NH-D14 with our regular system setup and that is with the 3770K overclocked to 4.6Ghz with using around 1.30 volts. This will be a good way to test this beast because we all know that Ivy Bridge runs super hot once overclocked and it really puts a lot of stress into any modern CPU cooler that's out there.All of the testing is done with an ambient temperature of ~24C. RealTemp will be used to monitor the temperature of the CPU and Prime95 (Large FFTs) will be used to deliver the full load to the CPU for 20 minutes.Idle temperatures will be measured after leaving the computer idle for 20 minutes. CPU-Z will be used to verify the CPU speed and the voltage being used in Windows 7. Also, the coolers are tested with the default settings (Turbo, C1E etc) enabled in the BIOS.We will measure the noise levels for both in idle and load using a dBA meter and point it at the computer at a distance of ~50 CM. It's always difficult to measure noise levels because there are always noises in the background which can affect it so the results may not be 100% precise but it should give you a clear indication of the noise levels for the cooler.One thing that I have to say before the test is that I'm using 1.30 volts for the overclock but you clearly don't need 1.30 volts to get the 3770K stable at 4.6Ghz but I'm doing this to stress test the cooler to its limits. You can easily get it stable with using ~1.24 volts and you will probably get much better temperatures than I did so keep that in mind.Visit my website in order to see the benchmark results because I cannot put pictures on reviews on Amazon.

Noctua has become one of the most popular companies in the cooling market and they have been constantly releasing top notch products one after another. Noctua has been getting a lot of positive attention for their superb fans and exceptional coolers and the color scheme is the reason why people recognize Noctua products when they see one.Noctua offers a six year warranty on their products and has possibly the best customer service out there and I can certainly vouch for that. They have always sent me replacements for fans and mounting kits free of charge and that was long before I became a reviewer. Noctua sets the perfect example of what a customer service should be like.The NH-L9i is Noctua's low profile heatsink designed to fit into small factor systems or HTPCs for Intel socket LGA115x (1155/1156/1150) processors only. Since it's designed to work only on Intel platforms, this makes for a super easy installation thanks to Noctua's SecuFirm 2 mounting system. It comes at a super low profile of only 37mm tall (23mm heatsink and 14mm NF-A9x14 low profile fan) that makes it extremely slim and ideal to use for mini ITX cases. It provides full compatibility with tall RAM modules and VGA cards on mini ITX mainboards.The NH-L9i is designed to replace stock cooling that comes with Intel CPUs and should theoretically eliminate overheating issues that you might have with the stock heatsink. The NH-L9i comes with a strict set of TDP guidelines and according to Noctua's website, it should be used with care on CPUs with more than 65W TDP.The packaging of the NH-L9i feels top notch and very sturdy. Just as you would expect with any Noctua product, the components inside are well packaged and everything feels well secured inside the box. The front of the box lists some of the features such as Full Memory Compatibility, compatibility with past and future sockets, 6 year warranty, PWM support, Low-Noise Adaptor, and the NT-H1 thermal compound.When opening up the package for the NH-L9i, you are presented with a high density foam that securely holds the NF-A9x14 PWM fan, NT-H1 thermal compound, Low-Noise-Adapter, four mounting screws, four screws, Noctua case sticker and a manual. Noctua has always done a fantastic job on their packaging and the packaging of the NH-L9i is no exception.Here we can see how the NH-L9i is constructed and that is with a copper base and heatpipes, aluminium fins, soldered joints and nickel plating. The dimension for the NH-L9i come in at 95 mm x 95 mm x 37 mm (L x W x H) for the heatsink which makes it perfect for mini ITX cases. The cooler weighs 345 g without the fan and 420 g with the fan installed. This might be a tiny cooler but it has two 6 mm heatpipes while Intel's stock cooler has none. You can't rely on Intel's stock cooler for anything because it's cheaply made and makes loud noises. Noctua engineers everything for quietness and puts a lot of R&D into their products, more on that on the next page. Something that many people probably don't know that I personally like about Noctua is that everything from fan design to bearing design is done in house. And this means that a lot of testing and R&D goes through when making a Noctua fan. Most manufactures simply use a stock model fan from an OEM and just slightly tweak the RPM levels and call it a day.Noctua puts a lot of R&D into their fan designs and it totally shows in the build quality of their fans. Typical fans don't last a long time; most fans come with a MTBF of 50,000 to 100,000 hours and most of them stop working before they even hit the limit; some even start to make high pitch noises.All the fans that Noctua designs come with a MTBF of more than 150,000 hours so they essentially pay for themselves in the future since you don't have to keep buying new fans if they stop working. Noctua also has an amazing customer service that I have always been very fond of. I have lost mounting kits numerous times and they have always sent me new ones free of charge. They have even sent me extra fans free of charge. I wish more companies had a customer service like Noctua! A simple Google search will reveal how great Noctua's customer service is.The NH-L9i comes with the NF-A9x14 PWM fan that spins at a maximum 2500 RPM, or 1800 RPM with the L.N.A. It uses Noctua's second generation SSO2 bearing with metal bearing shell and Noctua's custom designed PWM IC for fully automatic PWM speeds. The metal bearing shell is made from CNC milled brass that delivers long term stability and durability. The NF-A9x14 PWM fan can drop as low as 600 RPM via PWM mode. It comes at a 14mm thickness that makes it ideal for low profile CPU coolers.Installing the NH-L9i was relatively easy thanks to the SecuFirm2 mounting system that Noctua has greatly designed. SecuFirm2 is compatible with pretty much all AMD and Intel sockets. The whole assembly took less than 5 minutes and even if you are someone with no knowledge whatsoever, you will still be able to install this cooler with little to no effort thanks to SecuFirm2.SecuFirm 2 isn't compatible with Intel's 775 and 1366 sockets so you will need to contact Noctua so they can send you the necessary equipment free of charge. Noctua also promises to provide upgrade kits for future sockets free of charge which is also very nice!Visit my website in order to see the benchmark results because I cannot put pictures on reviews on Amazon.

I'm pasting this review from my website but you will have to go to my website in order to see the benchmark results because I cannot put pictures in Amazon reviews. I posted the link in the comments because Amazon doesn't allow URLs in reviews.With so many great ATX motherboards being launched recently for Z87 chipset, it's easy to forget mATX boards like the Maximus VI Gene that is targeted at both overclockers and gamers. Like its predecessor, the Asus Z87 Maximus VI Gene is truly a fantastic board that has the capability of putting other higher end boards to shame. You would expect a mATX board like this to come with only a few SATAIII ports but ASUS has equipped this bad boy with eight SATAIII ports, sixteen USB ports (8x USB 3.0 and 8 USB 2.0), a ridiculous amount of headers especially for fans, amazing built in sound quality and much more. With Haswell being released, you really have to consider which motherboard best fits your needs. If all you are going to do is gaming and light overclocking then you don't really need a full ATX board. I'm seeing a lot of people purchase ATX boards just for gaming and browsing the internet which isn't very smart because a mATX board like the Maximus VI Gene will do all of those just fine and much more and you will save money in the end.The Z87 Maximus VI Gene sports the black and red color scheme that you would expect from the ROG series and it looks very attractive. Considering that this is only a mATX board, it comes with an endless amount of features for overclocking, fan customization and power saving options. I recently did a full review of the Z87-Pro which is a fantastic mid-range ATX board and was able to handle my 4770K at 4.8Ghz like a champ. I will put the link on the bottom of this review so you guys can check it out for yourself. If you guys want a full ATX board that has some of the features that higher end boards have, then I seriously recommend taking a look at the Z87-Pro because at $199.99, it becomes hard to beat.The Z87 Maximus VI Gene comes with the brand new AI Suite III which ASUS has improved quite a lot and they have done a fantastic job at making overclocking as easy as possible for people with less overclocking experience. I will be using the same test setup that I used to benchmark the Z87-Pro so we can see what this little beast is capable of. To fully stress test the motherboard, I will be overclocking the 4770K to 4.6Ghz to see how well it handles it. I will be using the new AI Suite III to overclock it because it makes overclocking much easier that what we are used to. With a single mouse click, AI Suite III is able to overclock my 4770K to  4.6Ghz with the correct settings and voltages.AI Suite III will automatically find the right settings, voltages and optimize the system to perform like it should with the new overclock. ASUS has completely redesigned the interface in AI Suite III which is easier to understand and follow and has also implemented a lot of new features that are very useful for overclockers. AI Suite III allows you to control every single part of your motherboard and even turn off some parts of the motherboard to conserve energy which can be quite useful if all you do is browse the internet and watch videos.I'm surprised at how ASUS has managed to pack so many awesome features in this mATX board which is mind blowing if you think about it. You get all the amazing features such as the new and improved UEFI BIOS making it super easy to navigate around in the BIOS, awesome built in sound quality, a ton of USB 3.0 ports and much more which I will talk about later. It has so many options that it can be overwhelming at first but after getting used to it, I literally fell in love with it. Haswell has really changed the traditional overclocking methods that we are all used to seeing and you really have to tweak a lot of settings in the BIOS to get the overclock you want which is why I recommend using AI Suite III because it makes this process extremely easy.+Packaging & Accessories:Like with any ASUS packaging, the packaging of the Z87 Maximus VI Gene is overall great. ASUS really knows how to securely protect the components inside the box during transit. The retail packaging feels sturdy and very attractive. Everything that you need to know about the motherboard is presented right in front of you. The color scheme on the box is a combination of black and red which is the same as it was on the Z77's version. The color scheme of the box is supposed to match the color scheme of the motherboard.On the center of the front cover, we have the name of the motherboard written in big white text. At the top left, we have the Republic of Gaming logo and on the bottom left we have the SLI and Crossfire sticker. There's not a whole lot of stuff on the front cover so let's move on to the back because that's where most of the information is. So on the top of the back cover, we have four little square boxes with images that show some of the features that come with this motherboard. First, there's the SupremeFX which if you remember was once a discrete audio card but it's now integrated into the motherboard so you can expect amazing sound quality. It uses ELNA premium Japan-made audio capacitors that provide immersive sound with exceptional clarity that are great for game effects and multimedia. Second is mPCIe Combo II and it can support socket M2 (NGFF) SSDs along with a Dual Band WiFi Bluetooth module. Third is Extreme Engine Digi+III and that is an upgraded VRM system designed by ROG for Haswell processors. It comes with all Maximus VI series motherboards. And the last one is SLI/CrossFireX which is pretty self-explanatory. Below these four little boxes, we have the all specifications of the motherboard listed out.When we open up the package, we can see that the motherboard is placed inside an anti-static bag for protection as you would expect from any motherboard manufacture. The motherboard itself is securely packaged and isn't going to shift during transit. ASUS has always done a fine job at making sure their motherboards are well secured inside the box. Beneath the motherboard, we will find the typical accessories that you would expect from any motherboard manufacture to include.Along with the motherboard, these are the accessories that you will find inside the package.* User's manual* Support DVD* I/O Shield* 1 x mPCIe Combo II expansion card* 3 x 2-in-1 SATA 6Gb/s cables* 1 x SLI bridge* 1 x 2-in-1 Q-Connector Kit* 1 x 12 in 1 ROG Cable Label* 1 x ROG Door Hanger+Build Quality / Design:The overall layout of the motherboard is excellent and the ROG color scheme looks attractive on the black PCB. There's plenty of room around the socket region to install even some of today's largest CPU coolers like the Noctua NH-D14. It comes with a stainless steel back I/O for great protection and extended motherboard lifespan. The build quality of the motherboard feels very sturdy when holding and very durable like with any ASUS motherboard.The Z87 Maximus VI Gene also offers a massive 8+2-phase power design for high overclocking, and best of all, there are 10K Black Metallic Capacitors rated for 10,000 hours at 105C. The 10K Black Metallic capacitors last five times longer and deliver 20% greater extreme temperature endurance than generic solid state capacitors. The Z87 Maximus VI Gene uses NexFET MOSFETs that can handle up to 90% efficiency under normal operation and better durability than the standard MOSFETs. The Z87 Maximus VI Gene is greatly designed to handle high volts really well even though it is a mATX board. The 8+2 phase power design is more than enough to get a 4770K to 4.6Ghz or even more with the correct cooling.The black metal heatsinks on the VRMs look great and you can feel that they are made with high quality materials. All of these great design features make the motherboard very attractive and the heatsinks are nice and big for better heat dissipation and improved cooling. This means it can handle more volts without overheating which will result in higher overclocking. On the back of the motherboard you will see that there are a few backplates where the VRMs are and this is to protect the circuitry and help with dissipating the heat. It also comes with a 3 year warranty which is very nice to have.+Ports / Features:The Z87 Maximus VI Gene comes with a whopping eight SATAIII ports and they are all 6Gb/s ports. Six of those SATA III ports are from the Z87 chipset and two of those are from the ASMedia 1061 controller. When using a M.2 slot on mPCIe Combo II, SATA port 5 will be disabled. Long gone are the days where you had only one or two SATAIII ports. The motherboard is SLI and Crossfire ready so you can stick two of your favorite cards in there and get awesome performance (they won't run at full x16 but instead at x8 which is still more than enough). You also have sixteen USB ports; eight are USB 3.0 ports via the Z87 chipset and eight more from ASMedia 1042 controller.Features such as USB 3.0 Boost, mPCIe Combo II, Fan Xpert and the new Dual Intelligent Processors 4 and 4-Way optimization are great features that can really improve the user's experience. It's little things like this that separates Asus from other companies in this industry and that's why I recommend Asus products to anyone who reads my reviews.The new AI Suite III offers automatic overclock, improved power efficiency, customized fan controls and optimized digital power delivery. All of these are unique features that can easily tweak your system without too much effort. It auto detects the best performance for your system which is great if you don't want to spend countless of hours into tweaking your system. You can even set the max power delivery for your system and it will try to not go over that limit which can be useful if you want to conserve electricity. You can enable the EPU mode and you will be instantly saving power and money without sacrificing performance. It can even shut down parts of your motherboard to save power and it can also improve the cooling of your system and reduce fan noise.The Z87 Maximus VI Gene comes with a total of four PCI-Express slots. Two PCIe 3.0 x16 slots, one PCIe x4 slot and one mini-PCIe 2.0 x1 port. The board supports full x16 bandwidth but only with a single card. If you want to run dual GPUs, it will run at x8/x8 and triple card setup isn't possible. The Z87-Pro that I reviewed recently offered a triple card configuration at x8/x8/x4 which can be great for people who want to run that many cards. I personally have never run more than two cards because it's just not worth it in my option. Drivers are usually not optimized for more than two cards and don't scale very well and games don't fully utilize beyond two cards and sometimes applications randomly crash. Also, something to note about the Z87 Maximus VI Gene is that there are no PCI slots which might disappoint some people. I personally like that it doesn't have any PCI slots because it can take up precious space in the motherboard and they have become so outdated and slow nowadays.It comes with four DDR3 DIMM slots supporting up to 32GB of ram in dual channel mode and can even support ram up to 2800Mhz-3000Mhz if you can overclock it. The motherboard comes with a debug LED which can be very useful if something goes wrong when installing a new hardware. The LED display on the board will give you an error code which then you can use to look up what the problem is. The LED display is always on and when there isn't an error, it displays the BIOS version. This feature can be quite handy when troubleshooting new hardware and really easy to figure out what exactly is not working properly. I congratulate ASUS for implementing an awesome feature like this because it can really help people like me that are constantly upgrading their hardware. Also, the southbridge has two additional heatsinks with a small heatpipe in the middle of them. ASUS really knows how to cool them southbridges!An excellent feature that Asus has implemented into their boards is the USB BIOS Flashback button. You can use this to flash the BIOS without having to boot the system into the UEFI BIOS which makes it much easier. There's no need to have a CPU, memory, or GPU installed in the motherboard to update your BIOS. You simply plug in a USB drive with the correct BIOS file into the lower USB 3.0 port underneath the LAN port and press the button for 3 seconds until the integrated LED begins to flash. While the BIOS is updating, the LED flashing frequency increases letting you know that it's still working. When the LED stops flashing, the flash operation is completed and the board can be booted. With the USB BIOS Flashback feature, it's impossible to brick your board!Back I/O Ports* 1x ROG Connect Button* 1x Clear CMOS Button* HDMI Port* LAN (RJ45) port* 6x USB 3.0 (blue)* 4x USB 2.0 (black)* Optical S/PDIF out* 6x Audio jack(s)Internal I/O Ports* 1x USB 3.0 connector supports additional 2 USB 3.0 ports* 2x USB 2.0 connectors support additional 4 USB 2.0 ports (1 connector shares with ROG_EXT header)* 1x ROG extension (ROG_EXT) header* 8x SATA 6Gb/s connectors* 1x CPU fan connectors for smart DC/PWM mode control* 1x CPU optional fan connector* 3x Chassis fan connectors* 1x 24-pin EATX power connector* 1x 8-pin EATX 12V power connector* 10x ProbeIt measurement points* 1x LN2 Mode jumper* 1x Power-on button* 1x Reset button* 1x DirectKey button* 1x MemOK! Button* 1x DRCT (DirectKey) header* 1x S/PDIF out header* 1x Front panel audio connector (AAFP)* 1 x System panel connector* 1 x TPM connector* 1 x mPCIe Combo II connector+Software/AI Suit III:The Asus Z87 Maximus VI Gene comes with the brand new AI Suite III which makes overclocking extremely easy even for first time users. With the new AI Suite III, you have pretty much control over your entire motherboard and when I say you have control over your entire motherboard, I really mean it. When using AI Suite III, you are presented with five sections at the top and each one does its specific thing. You have the option of putting your computer in power saving mode to reduce as much electricity as possible or set it to high performance to get the most out of your computer. You can customize your fan speeds for silent mode, automatically/manually overclock your CPU and many more which I'll explain into details below.When you first open up AI Suit III, the first section that you will see is the 4-Way Optimization section and this deals mostly with automatic overclocking, optimizing fan speed and power savings options. At the bottom of this section, we can see our current CPU frequency, Dram frequency, the voltage for each core, temperature of the CPU/Motherboard and how fast each fan in your case is running at. Also, on the side you have four power saving modes, Auto, High Performance, Max Power Saving and Away Mode. This section will mostly display the settings your current components are running at; you can't really tweak anything here.Moving over to the second section, we have the TPU section and this is where you will be spending most of your time tweaking your CPU settings and overclocking it. Here we have adjustable settings for BCLK, CPU Ratio, CPU Cache Ratio, Voltages and CPU Cache. Overclocking has never been this easy and Asus has done a fantastic job at improving their software. I know some of the earlier versions of AI Suit had some glitches but it seems like Asus has fixed all of them. I remember one glitch in the earlier version of AI Suit where it would report a different CPU temperature than what it actually was in the BIOS. There is also a checkbox called Group Tuning that allows for adjusting each core individually or all cores at once. On the side of this section, we have four cylinders which each one represents each core of the CPU. You can also overclock each core differently if you like and it will show you using the cylinder. There is a subsection in the TPU section marked CPU Strap where you can change the CPU Strap to 100, 125, 167, and 250. At the bottom of this section, we can see the sensors for voltages, temperatures and fan speeds. Everything in the software feels well designed and very easy on the eyes.The third section is the EPU section and this is specifically designed for power saving options. There are four subsections in the EPU section, Auto, High Performance, Max Power Saving and Away Mode. You have the option to set the voltage decrement to either auto or manual. You can also undervolt the CPU to conserve as much energy as possible. I know many people who undervolt their CPUs because they simply don't need all that power when browsing the internet so this is an outstanding feature in the new AI Suit III. You can control your monitor sleep time, computer sleep, fan profiles and you can even turn off the USB controller power if a device is not attached to save as much energy as possible. I love the option of turning off the fans when doing light tasks such as browsing the internet or watching movies. I could hardly hear the system running when I turned off most of the fans in my system.The fourth section is the Digi+Power Control section and here you have two subsections, one for CPU and for RAM. The CPU section contains settings for load-line calibration, CPU Power Phase Control which can be set to either: Standard, Optimized, Extreme or Manual Adjustment. You also have CPU Current Capability, CPU Power Thermal Control, Voltage Frequency, CPU Power Duty Control and Active Frequency Mode which can be set to either OFF or ON. There are so many options in this section that you can play around with and get awesome overclocks. The memory subsection has adjustable settings for DRAM Current Capability, DRAM Voltage Frequency and DRAM power phase control. You can overclock your RAM with literally one mouse click and you don't have to constantly reboot into BIOS and keep tweaking the settings.The fifth section is the Fan Xpert 2 section which is probably one my favorite feature of the AI Suite III because you have pretty much control over every single fan in your case, from the CPU fan to each individual case fans. You have four profiles to choose from when you click the Fan Xpert 2 section, Silent, Standard, Turbo and Full Speed. You can set the fan in `silent' mode if you are doing light tasks such as watching YouTube videos or browsing the internet and you won't even hear the computer running. If you are going to be playing intensive games such as BF3, Crysis 3 or Metro LL then consider choosing a different fan profile. There is also a fan curve customization for the CPU fan which you can play around with so you can make your own profile and it will automatically adjust its speed which is what I did.+BIOS:As soon as you boot into BIOS, you are presented with a simple (EZ Mode) and advanced mode. The BIOS has full support for both keyboard and mouse and it's designed in a way that both first time users and advanced users can jump right in and start tweaking. The EZ Mode is targeted at people who have little to no experience with overclocking and has very few little options that you can play around with. With the release of Haswell, Asus has expanded its functionality by adding XMP memory control and the ability to select pre-defined fan profiles. Overclocking your RAM has literally gotten so easy that even a caveman can do it.The UEFI BIOS comes loaded with a ton of amazing features that you could ever want in a BIOS. My first favorite feature of the BIOS is the option of writing quick notes while you are in the BIOS for future references. I can imagine this being useful to pretty much everyone because this makes it so much easier to remember what you have to do when you get in the BIOS. There is a quick note button on the right side of the screen which will bring up a text box where you can write notes so it's pretty easy to access.You can take notes of the results you get when overclocking and compare them with the previous results and you know they will be in a safe place and not get lost. I can safely say that Asus has possibly the best UEFI BIOS out of all the manufactures in this industry. There's so many things that I like about the BIOS but a cool little feature that Asus has created is that now you can take screenshots within the BIOS by pressing F12 and it will save the screenshot in your USB in a bitmap format at 1024x768 resolution.My second favorite feature of the BIOS is the new `Favorites' screen which allows you to add any BIOS option to the screen for fast and easy access. There is also a last modified button which will show you the last modified changes that you made to the BIOS which is very useful because if something goes horribly wrong or is not working like it should, you can go back and easily fix it. Another neat little feature that Asus has made to the BIOS is that when you are about to save your settings and prepared to exit, it will show you all the changes you are about to make which can be useful just in case you make a mistake.Another very useful feature for people who reboot hundreds of times a day when overclocking/tweaking is the new ASUS Boot Setting. This allows you to boot directly into the BIOS without having to press delete repeatedly on the POST screen. I'm one of those OCD people who reboots into the BIOS at least 20 times a day (I'm dead serious) and this is probably the smartest feature that Asus has created for overclocking geeks like me. This will save me a ton of time when I go back into the BIOS and start tweaking stuff.+Test System:I will be using the same test setup that I used to benchmark the Z87-Pro so let's get right to it. I did a clean Windows 7 Ultimate SP1 64bit format on my Samsung 840 Pro 256GB SSD and made sure nothing was running in the background while I was doing the benchmarks. All the components will be inside the enormous Corsair 900D which offers great performance for both air cooling and water cooling setups. I'm using the Kingston HyperX Beast (2x8GB) 16GB at 2133Mhz which is very fast and the Samsung 840 Pro 256GB which is one of the fastest SSDs in the market right now.All the benchmarks below have been made with the 4770K at 4.6Ghz and then some of the other benchmarks are done with the GTX Titan and the Intel iGPU since I don't have any other dedicated GPUs in my house to test it against.  The EVGA SuperNOVA 1000W will be used to power everything that you see below. Also, Noctua fans will be used instead of the stock H100i fans for the radiator and the case fan since they are quieter and overall much better.* Test System:Case: Corsair 900DGPU: EVGA GTX TitanCPU: Intel Core i7 4770KPSU: EVGA SuperNOVA 1000WRam: Kingston HyperX Beast 16GBSSD: Samsung 840 Pro 256GBCooling: Corsair H100iMB: ASUS Z87 Maximus VI GeneOS: Windows 7 64bit SP1+Benchmarks:I will be doing the same benchmarks that I did to the Z87-Pro on the Z87 Maximus VI Gene motherboard so we can see how well it performs. First, I will start with the boot times since that's obviously very important. After having installed all the drivers and done all the windows updates, the boot times were approximately the same as the Z87-Pro, under 8 seconds which is incredibly quick.+Boot Time using Windows 7 Ultimate SP1 64bit: ~7 seconds----------------------------------------------------------------------------Another test that people have requested me do on my previous reviews is benchmarking the performance of the SATAIII controller. SATAIII has become the standard nowadays and while it is slowly become saturated by newer SSDs; it is still more than enough to drive an SSD to its full limits. I will be using the Samsung 840 Pro 256GB which is one of the fastest SSDs your money can buy to measure how fast the SATAIII controller is on the Asus Z87 Maximus VI Gene. The software that I will be using is CrystalDiskMark which is a very useful benchmarking tool that's used to measure the speed of a drive based on Sequential, 512K and 4K read and write tests.As you can see from the results below, I got very impressive scores. Very close to what I got with the Z87-Pro and in some cases better.+SATAIII: CrystalDiskMark (Samsung 840 Pro 256GB):---------------------Read ----------- WriteSequence: 531.2MB/sec --- 498.6MB/sec512K: 498.8MB/sec -------510.1MB/sec4K: 39.78MB/sec -----------85.35MB/sec4K QD32: 398.1MB/sec -----337.87MB/sec----------------------------------------------------------------------------Moving on, testing the speed of the USB 3.0 controller on the Asus Z87 Maximus VI Gene was done by using the "Orico 6619US3-BK Super Speed USB3.0" which converts your SSD/HDD to a USB 3.0. I have a couple of these at home that I use regularly and they are quite useful. The drive inside was the exact same that I used before, Samsung 840 Pro 256GB and once again, the results were very similar to what I got on the Z87-Pro. I'm very impressed with the results.+USB 3.0: CrystalDiskMark (Samsung 840 Pro 256GB):---------------------Read ----------- WriteSequence: 498.7MB/sec --- 459.7MB/sec512K: 456.4MB/sec -------482.7MB/sec4K: 29.13MB/sec -----------46.86MB/sec4K QD32: 93.5MB/sec -----155.79MB/sec---------------------------------------------------------------------------+Overclocking:Haswell has brought different overclocking methods and challenges that are different from what we are used to. Now, we all know that Ivy Bridge CPUs run hot but Haswell runs even hotter due to having the VRMs on-die so you can no longer rely on a stock Intel cooler to cool your CPU. Many people have been switching to high end water cooling setups to achieve reasonable overclocks. If you have a good closed liquid cooler such as the H100i or an air cooler like the NH-D14 then you should be able to get high overclocks very easily.Asus has done an excellent job of providing users with as many options for people that like to tweak every single component on their machines to get the best possible performance. You can either overclock manually by go into the BIOS which can get a bit tiresome or use the brand new AI Suite III which makes it a lot easier. The AI Suite III makes it extremely easy for people that just want to overclock their CPU and not waste countless hours trying to tweak other settings and figuring out what's causing BSODs and things of that nature. With a single mouse click, the AI Suite III automatically optimizes your CPU for the best overclock your system can handle and you never have to look back. I personally know many people that would love to have this feature and don't want to sit in their BIOS all day to test each setting individually.For this test, I'm going to use AI Suit III because with one mouse click, it overclocked my CPU to 4.6Ghz and it was fully stable. I used Prime95 for 30 minutes to test the stability of the CPU and I only needed 1.21volts for it to be fully stable. Temps are also great on the Z87 Maximus VI Gene and it never exceeds 75C which is awesome. I could have easily gone for 4.8Ghz and this motherboard would have had no problems handling it but my Corsair H100i wouldn't have been able to keep the temps down. I did test it and the temps went through the roof, well over 90C so I had to dial it back a bit.Moving along, here are some of the benchmarks that I did to test the performance of the motherboard. Everything has been tested with the 4770K overclocked at 4.6Ghz using 1.21volts/1920x1080.+Cinebench 11.5:CPU: 9.98 - (Multi-Threaded)CPU: 2.11 - (Single-Threaded)OpenGL: 89.46fps - (iGPU)+PCMark 8 Work: 5609+PCMark 8 Home: 6165+PCMark 7 Computation: 8659+PCMark 7 Storage: 5276+PCMark 8 Vantage Productivity: 40146+PCMark 8 Vantage Gaming: 30725+wPrime 32M: 7.043+wPrime 1024M: 176.532+3DMark 11 Physics: 12559+3DMark Fire Strike Physics: 41.05+3DMark Cloud Gate Physics: 31.66+3DMark Ice Storm Physics: 203.86----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+x264 HD Video Encoding v5.0.1:This is a popular benchmark that measures how fast your machine can encode a short HD quality video clip into a high quality x264 video file.
